nodes.label: Atomic Design
nodes.desc: The definitive text on atomic design methodology. Free to read online. Covers atoms through pages with practical examples.
nodes.author: Brad Frost

nodes.label: The Elements of Typographic Style
nodes.desc: The typographer's bible. Covers rhythm, proportion, harmony, and the relationship between type and the page.
nodes.author: Robert Bringhurst

nodes.label: Interaction of Color
nodes.desc: Foundational exploration of how colors behave in relation to each other. Changed how artists and designers understand color perception.
nodes.author: Josef Albers

nodes.label: A Type Primer
nodes.desc: Clear, practical introduction to typography. Covers anatomy of letterforms, setting type, and designing with type.
nodes.author: John Kane

nodes.label: Design Systems
nodes.desc: Practical guide to creating effective design systems. Covers patterns, practices, and principles from real-world systems.
nodes.author: Alla Kholmatova

nodes.label: A Nerd's Guide to Color on the Web
nodes.desc: Comprehensive guide to color on the web: hex, RGB, HSL, and newer color spaces. Practical and well-illustrated.
nodes.author: Sarah Drasner

nodes.label: Color & Contrast (Accessible Color Guide)
nodes.desc: Interactive guide to accessible color combinations. Visualizes WCAG contrast ratios with real-time preview.
nodes.author: Aatash Parikh

nodes.label: OKLCH Color Picker & Converter
nodes.desc: Interactive OKLCH color picker. OKLCH is the most perceptually uniform color space available in CSS.
nodes.author: Evil Martians

nodes.label: Practical Color Theory for People Who Code
nodes.desc: Color theory translated for developers. Covers hue, saturation, lightness, and building palettes programmatically.
nodes.author: Natalya Shelburne

nodes.label: Accessible Color Systems (Stripe)
nodes.desc: How Stripe built an accessible color system. Methodology for generating palettes that meet WCAG AA across all combinations.
nodes.author: Daryl Koopersmith & Wilson Miner

nodes.label: Practical Typography
nodes.desc: Free online book covering typography essentials: font choice, page margins, line spacing, and body text formatting.
nodes.author: Matthew Butterick

nodes.label: Responsive Typography: The Basics
nodes.desc: How typography adapts across screen sizes. Covers fluid type, viewport units, and responsive type scales.
nodes.author: Jason Pamental

nodes.label: Type Scale
nodes.desc: Visual calculator for building type scales based on musical intervals (major third, perfect fourth, etc.).
nodes.author: Jeremy Church

nodes.label: Variable Fonts Guide
nodes.desc: Comprehensive guide to OpenType variable fonts in CSS. Weight, width, slant, and custom axes.
nodes.author: MDN Web Docs

nodes.label: Thinking with Type
nodes.desc: Widely used design school textbook. Covers letter, text, and grid with historical context and practical exercises.
nodes.author: Ellen Lupton

nodes.label: Space in Design Systems
nodes.desc: Definitive guide to spacing in design systems. Covers inset, stack, inline, and grid spacing models.
nodes.author: Nathan Curtis

nodes.label: The 8-Point Grid System
nodes.desc: Why 8px is the most popular base unit for spacing grids. Aligns to common screen densities and creates visual rhythm.
nodes.author: Spec.fm

nodes.label: Modular Scale
nodes.desc: Calculator for creating proportional scales using musical ratios. Applicable to type, spacing, and layout.
nodes.author: Tim Brown & Scott Kellum

nodes.label: Layout and Composition
nodes.desc: The Elements of Graphic Design. Covers space, unity, page architecture, and the use of white space.
nodes.author: Alex White

nodes.label: The Noun Project
nodes.desc: Library of over 5 million icons. Useful for understanding icon conventions and visual metaphors.
nodes.author: Noun Project

nodes.label: Phosphor Icons
nodes.desc: Flexible icon family with 6 weights. Well-designed system that demonstrates consistent icon design principles.
nodes.author: Tobias Fried & Helena Zhang

nodes.label: Icon Usability (NNG)
nodes.desc: Research-based guidelines for icon design: when to use icons alone, with labels, and recognition vs. recall.
nodes.author: Aurora Harley, Nielsen Norman Group

nodes.label: Designing Better Icons
nodes.desc: Practical guide to icon design: grid systems, optical alignment, stroke consistency, and metaphor selection.
nodes.author: Scott Lewis

nodes.label: Designing Interfaces
nodes.desc: Pattern library of UI components: navigation, lists, forms, actions, and information display. Third edition covers mobile and responsive.
nodes.author: Jenifer Tidwell, Charles Brewer & Aynne Valencia

nodes.label: Refactoring UI
nodes.desc: Practical design tips for developers. Covers hierarchy, spacing, color, typography, and component design with before/after examples.
nodes.author: Adam Wathan & Steve Schoger

nodes.label: Component-Driven Development
nodes.desc: Methodology for building UIs from the bottom up: components in isolation, compose into screens, iterate with real data.
nodes.author: Chromatic (Storybook)

nodes.label: Patterns.dev — Component Patterns
nodes.desc: Modern web development patterns including compound components, render props, hooks patterns, and performance optimization.
nodes.author: Lydia Hallie & Addy Osmani

nodes.label: Compound Components Pattern
nodes.desc: How to build flexible molecule-level components using the compound component pattern. Shares implicit state between children.
nodes.author: Kent C. Dodds

nodes.label: Web Form Design
nodes.desc: The definitive guide to form UX. Covers label placement, input types, validation, error handling, and progressive disclosure.
nodes.author: Luke Wroblewski

nodes.label: Form Design Patterns
nodes.desc: Practical patterns for accessible, usable forms. Registration, checkout, filtering, and complex multi-step forms.
nodes.author: Adam Silver

nodes.label: Inline Validation in Web Forms (Research)
nodes.desc: Eye-tracking study showing how inline validation improves form completion. Evidence-based form design.
nodes.author: Luke Wroblewski

nodes.label: Best Practices for Form Design (Google)
nodes.desc: Google's guide to modern form design. Covers input types, autocomplete, validation, and accessibility.
nodes.author: Google Web Fundamentals

nodes.label: Microinteractions: Designing with Details
nodes.desc: The definitive book on micro-interactions. Covers triggers, rules, feedback, and loops/modes for small design moments.
nodes.author: Dan Saffer

nodes.label: The Illusion of Life: Disney Animation
nodes.desc: Disney's 12 principles of animation. Squash, stretch, anticipation, and follow-through apply directly to UI motion design.
nodes.author: Ollie Johnston & Frank Thomas

nodes.label: Animation Principles for the Web
nodes.desc: Applies animation principles to web interfaces. Easing, timing, and the psychology of perceived performance.
nodes.author: Rachel Nabors

nodes.label: Material Motion Guidelines
nodes.desc: Google's comprehensive motion design system. Transition patterns, easing curves, and duration guidelines.
nodes.author: Google Material Design

nodes.label: Designing Interface Animation
nodes.desc: Meaningful motion in UI design. Covers animation purpose, performance, choreography, and building an animation style guide.
nodes.author: Val Head

nodes.label: Inclusive Components
nodes.desc: Pattern library of accessible component implementations. Toggle buttons, tabbed interfaces, data tables, tooltips, and more.
nodes.author: Heydon Pickering

nodes.label: WAI-ARIA Authoring Practices
nodes.desc: Official W3C patterns for accessible widgets. Accordion, breadcrumb, carousel, dialog, menu, tabs, tree view, and more.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: A Web for Everyone
nodes.desc: Accessible UX design from personas through implementation. Bridges the gap between accessibility standards and user experience.
nodes.author: Sarah Horton & Whitney Quesenbery

nodes.label: Accessibility for Everyone
nodes.desc: Concise introduction to web accessibility. Covers disabilities, guidelines, content, design, and development practices.
nodes.author: Laura Kalbag

nodes.label: axe-core Accessibility Testing
nodes.desc: Industry-standard accessibility testing engine. Automated WCAG 2.1 checking that integrates into development workflows.
nodes.author: Deque Systems

nodes.label: Don't Make Me Think
nodes.desc: The classic web usability book. Covers navigation conventions, homepage design, and usability testing in plain language.
nodes.author: Steve Krug

nodes.label: Information Architecture
nodes.desc: The polar bear book. Comprehensive guide to organizing information: taxonomy, navigation systems, search, and labeling.
nodes.author: Louis Rosenfeld, Peter Morville & Jorge Arango

nodes.label: Navigation Patterns for Responsive Design
nodes.desc: Survey of responsive navigation patterns: hamburger, priority+, toggle, footer anchor, and multi-level approaches.
nodes.author: Brad Frost

nodes.label: Command Palette Pattern
nodes.desc: Analysis of the command palette pattern (Cmd+K). How keyboard-driven navigation is reshaping complex application UIs.
nodes.author: Maggie Appleton

nodes.label: The Visual Display of Quantitative Information
nodes.desc: The foundational text on data visualization. Data-ink ratio, chartjunk, graphical integrity, and the principles of graphical excellence.
nodes.author: Edward Tufte

nodes.label: Envisioning Information
nodes.desc: How to present complex information on a 2D surface. Escaping flatland, micro/macro readings, layering, and small multiples.
nodes.author: Edward Tufte

nodes.label: Visualization Analysis & Design
nodes.desc: Systematic framework for visualization design. What-why-how analysis, marks and channels, spatial layout, and evaluation.
nodes.author: Tamara Munzner

nodes.label: D3.js — Data-Driven Documents
nodes.desc: The definitive JavaScript library for data visualization. Bindable data, transitions, and SVG/Canvas rendering.
nodes.author: Mike Bostock

nodes.label: Observable Plot
nodes.desc: High-level charting library built on D3. Concise API for exploratory data visualization with sensible defaults.
nodes.author: Observable

nodes.label: Data Tables Design Patterns
nodes.desc: Comprehensive survey of data table patterns: fixed headers, sorting, filtering, pagination, row expansion, and inline editing.
nodes.author: Andrew Coyle

nodes.label: Every Layout
nodes.desc: CSS layout primitives that compose into any interface: Stack, Sidebar, Cluster, Center, Cover, Grid, Frame, and Switcher.
nodes.author: Andy Bell & Heydon Pickering

nodes.label: Cards: UI Component Design
nodes.desc: Research-based guidelines for card design: content hierarchy, interaction, sizing, and common card anti-patterns.
nodes.author: Nielsen Norman Group

nodes.label: UI Patterns (Collection)
nodes.desc: Large collection of UI design patterns. Input, navigation, content, social, and e-commerce patterns with examples.
nodes.author: Anders Toxboe

nodes.label: Container Queries: A Quick Start Guide
nodes.desc: How CSS container queries enable truly responsive components. Components adapt based on their container, not the viewport.
nodes.author: Ahmad Shadeed

nodes.label: Responsive Components (Patterns)
nodes.desc: Early exploration of responsive component patterns using ResizeObserver, before container queries landed natively.
nodes.author: Philip Walton

nodes.label: The State of Responsive Design
nodes.desc: Reflections from the creator of responsive web design on where the discipline is headed in the container query era.
nodes.author: Ethan Marcotte

nodes.label: Modern Fluid Typography with clamp()
nodes.desc: How to create fluid type and spacing that scales smoothly between breakpoints using CSS clamp(), eliminating hard breakpoints.
nodes.author: Adrian Bece

nodes.label: Grid Systems in Graphic Design
nodes.desc: The foundational text on grid systems. Covers columns, margins, modules, and the mathematical basis of typographic grids.
nodes.author: Josef M\u00FCller-Brockmann

nodes.label: Ordering Disorder: Grid Principles for Web Design
nodes.desc: Adapting print grid principles to the web. Practical approach to creating flexible, proportional grid layouts.
nodes.author: Khoi Vinh

nodes.label: CSS Grid Layout (MDN)
nodes.desc: Comprehensive reference for CSS Grid. Tracks, lines, areas, auto-placement, and alignment in the native grid system.
nodes.author: MDN Web Docs

nodes.label: An Interactive Guide to CSS Grid
nodes.desc: Visual, interactive guide to CSS Grid. Builds intuition through hands-on examples of grid behavior.
nodes.author: Josh W. Comeau

nodes.label: A New Canon of Page Layout
nodes.desc: Rethinking grid design for the web. Argues for moving beyond the column-based grid to more flexible compositional frameworks.
nodes.author: Mark Boulton

nodes.label: Responsive Web Design
nodes.desc: The book that defined responsive web design. Fluid grids, flexible images, and media queries as the three pillars.
nodes.author: Ethan Marcotte

nodes.label: Responsive Web Design (Original Article)
nodes.desc: The A List Apart article that launched the responsive design movement. Coined the term and laid out the core approach.
nodes.author: Ethan Marcotte

nodes.label: Intrinsic Web Design
nodes.desc: Beyond responsive: using CSS Grid and Flexbox for layouts that are intrinsically flexible. Squish, stretch, wrap, and overflow.
nodes.author: Jen Simmons

nodes.label: Learn Responsive Design
nodes.desc: Google's comprehensive course on responsive design. Media queries, typography, images, theming, and interaction.
nodes.author: Jeremy Keith (web.dev)

nodes.label: Utopia: Fluid Responsive Design
nodes.desc: Calculator for fluid type and space scales. Generates CSS clamp() values for seamless responsive design without breakpoints.
nodes.author: James Gilyead & Trys Mudford

nodes.label: Layout Patterns (web.dev)
nodes.desc: Collection of modern CSS layout patterns: sidebar, pancake stack, holy grail, RAM, and super-centered.
nodes.author: Una Kravets

nodes.label: 1-Line Layouts
nodes.desc: Ten modern CSS layout techniques in a single line of code each. Demonstrates the power of modern CSS layout.
nodes.author: Una Kravets

nodes.label: Every Layout
nodes.desc: Compositional layout primitives: Stack, Sidebar, Cluster, Switcher, Cover, Grid. Axiomatic CSS for intrinsic layouts.
nodes.author: Andy Bell & Heydon Pickering

nodes.label: Flexbox Froggy
nodes.desc: Interactive game for learning CSS Flexbox. 24 levels covering justify-content, align-items, flex-direction, and more.
nodes.author: Codepip

nodes.label: Grid Garden
nodes.desc: Interactive game for learning CSS Grid. 28 levels covering grid-column, grid-row, grid-template, and grid-area.
nodes.author: Codepip

nodes.label: Designing for the Web
nodes.desc: Free online book on web design fundamentals. Typography, layout, color, and the process of designing for the web.
nodes.author: Mark Boulton

nodes.label: F-Shaped Pattern for Reading (Research)
nodes.desc: Eye-tracking study showing how users scan web pages in an F-shaped pattern. Foundational for page layout decisions.
nodes.author: Jakob Nielsen

nodes.label: Visual Hierarchy in UI Design
nodes.desc: How size, color, contrast, spacing, and position create visual hierarchy. Research-based guidelines for page layout.
nodes.author: Nielsen Norman Group

nodes.label: Above the Fold Revisited
nodes.desc: Research on how users interact with content above and below the fold. Users scroll, but priority placement still matters.
nodes.author: Amy Schade, NNG

nodes.label: The Art of Color
nodes.desc: Bauhaus master's comprehensive color theory. Seven color contrasts, color harmony, subjective color experience, and color expression.
nodes.author: Johannes Itten

nodes.label: Interaction of Color
nodes.desc: Foundational work on color relativity. How colors change appearance based on their neighbors. Exercises in seeing.
nodes.author: Josef Albers

nodes.label: The Dimensions of Colour
nodes.desc: Free online resource covering color science for artists and designers. Comprehensive treatment of hue, value, and chroma.
nodes.author: David Briggs

nodes.label: Color and Light: A Guide for the Realist Painter
nodes.desc: How light behaves in the real world: subsurface scattering, specular highlights, color temperature, and atmospheric perspective.
nodes.author: James Gurney

nodes.label: Color Appearance Models
nodes.desc: Definitive technical reference for how humans perceive color. CIELAB, CIECAM02, and computational models of color appearance.
nodes.author: Mark D. Fairchild

nodes.label: A Perceptual Color Space for Image Processing (OKLAB)
nodes.desc: The paper that introduced OKLAB and OKLCH. A perceptually uniform color space that's now in CSS Color Level 4.
nodes.author: Bj\u00F6rn Ottosson

nodes.label: LCH Colors in CSS: What, Why, and How?
nodes.desc: Why LCH is superior to HSL for design work. Perceptual uniformity, wider gamut, and practical CSS usage.
nodes.author: Lea Verou

nodes.label: The Munsell Color System
nodes.desc: The first systematic color ordering based on perceptual attributes: hue, value, and chroma. Foundation of modern color science.
nodes.author: Albert Munsell

nodes.label: CSS Color Level 4 Specification
nodes.desc: The specification introducing oklch(), oklab(), color(), color-mix(), and relative color syntax to CSS.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: Color Spaces (Bartosz Ciechanowski)
nodes.desc: Interactive visual explainer of color spaces. Beautiful illustrations showing how RGB, HSL, LAB, and LCH relate to each other.
nodes.author: Bartosz Ciechanowski

nodes.label: The Principles of Harmony and Contrast of Colours
nodes.desc: The original text on simultaneous contrast. How adjacent colors alter each other's appearance. Influenced the Impressionists.
nodes.author: Michel Eug\u00E8ne Chevreul

nodes.label: Color Harmonies: Beyond the Basics
nodes.desc: Practical exploration of color harmonies: complementary, analogous, triadic, split-complementary, and tetradic schemes.
nodes.author: Nita Leland

nodes.label: Huemint — AI Color Palette Generator
nodes.desc: Machine learning-powered palette generator. Generates harmonious palettes for specific UI contexts: website, brand, gradient.
nodes.author: Huemint

nodes.label: Coolors
nodes.desc: Popular palette generator with color blindness simulation, contrast checking, and export to various formats.
nodes.author: Fabrizio Bianchi

nodes.label: Building Color Palettes for Design Systems
nodes.desc: How to build systematic color palettes with consistent lightness steps, semantic naming, and theme support.
nodes.author: Lydia Hallie

nodes.label: WCAG 2.2: Understanding Contrast (Minimum)
nodes.desc: Official WCAG guidelines for color contrast. 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text. The minimum standard for accessibility.
nodes.author: W3C WAI

nodes.label: Who Can Use
nodes.desc: Shows how color combinations appear for people with different vision types. Simulates protanopia, deuteranopia, tritanopia, and more.
nodes.author: Corey Ginnivan

nodes.label: APCA Contrast Calculator
nodes.desc: Advanced Perceptual Contrast Algorithm. The next-generation contrast method being developed for WCAG 3.0. More accurate than current ratios.
nodes.author: Andrew Somers (Myndex)

nodes.label: Color Accessibility Workflows
nodes.desc: Practical guide to designing with color accessibility in mind. Testing tools, patterns, and common pitfalls.
nodes.author: Geri Coady

nodes.label: Material Design 3: Dynamic Color
nodes.desc: Google's system for generating personalized color schemes from a single seed color. Tonal palettes and color roles.
nodes.author: Google

nodes.label: Dark Mode Design Guidelines
nodes.desc: Apple's comprehensive dark mode guidance. Semantic colors, elevated surfaces, vibrancy, and accessibility considerations.
nodes.author: Apple Human Interface Guidelines

nodes.label: Designing Systematic Colors
nodes.desc: How Lyft rebuilt their color system. Perceptually uniform lightness curves, accessibility-first, and programmatic generation.
nodes.author: Linda Dong (Lyft)

nodes.label: Radix Colors
nodes.desc: Open-source color system for building design systems. 12-step scales for backgrounds, interactive components, borders, and text.
nodes.author: Modulz

nodes.label: Open Color
nodes.desc: Open-source color scheme optimized for UI design. 12 hues with 10 lightness steps each, designed for consistency.
nodes.author: yeun

nodes.label: The Design of Everyday Things
nodes.desc: The foundational HCI text. Affordances, signifiers, mappings, feedback, and conceptual models. Required reading for every designer.
nodes.author: Don Norman

nodes.label: Designing the User Interface
nodes.desc: Comprehensive HCI textbook. Eight golden rules of interface design, direct manipulation, and information visualization.
nodes.author: Ben Shneiderman, Catherine Plaisant, et al.

nodes.label: About Face: The Essentials of Interaction Design
nodes.desc: Goal-directed design methodology. Personas, scenarios, and interaction design principles for digital products.
nodes.author: Alan Cooper, Robert Reimann & David Cronin

nodes.label: The Humane Interface
nodes.desc: Radical rethinking of interface design by the creator of the Macintosh project. Modes, habituation, and cognetics.
nodes.author: Jef Raskin

nodes.label: Human-Computer Interaction (CS 5440)
nodes.desc: Carnegie Mellon HCI course. Covers design thinking, prototyping, evaluation, accessibility, and AI in HCI.
nodes.author: Jeff Bigham (CMU)

nodes.label: Designing with the Mind in Mind
nodes.desc: Cognitive psychology principles applied to UI design. Perception, attention, memory, learning, and decision-making for designers.
nodes.author: Jeff Johnson

nodes.label: 100 Things Every Designer Needs to Know About People
nodes.desc: Accessible survey of psychology for designers. How people see, read, remember, think, feel, decide, and are motivated.
nodes.author: Susan Weinschenk

nodes.label: Cognitive Load Theory in UX
nodes.desc: How to minimize cognitive load in interfaces. Intrinsic, extraneous, and germane load applied to UX design decisions.
nodes.author: Kathryn Whitenton, NNG

nodes.label: Miller's Law: The Magical Number Seven
nodes.desc: The classic paper on working memory capacity. Often misinterpreted — it's about chunking, not about limiting menus to 7 items.
nodes.author: George A. Miller

nodes.label: Mental Models (NNG)
nodes.desc: How users' mental models of a system differ from the actual system model, and why this gap causes usability problems.
nodes.author: Jakob Nielsen

nodes.label: Usability Engineering
nodes.desc: The foundational usability text. Defines usability metrics, heuristic evaluation, and discount usability testing methods.
nodes.author: Jakob Nielsen

nodes.label: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
nodes.desc: The most-used heuristic evaluation framework. Visibility, match, control, consistency, error prevention, recognition, flexibility, aesthetics, recovery, help.
nodes.author: Jakob Nielsen

nodes.label: Rocket Surgery Made Easy
nodes.desc: Practical guide to DIY usability testing. How to run a test, what to look for, and how to prioritize fixes.
nodes.author: Steve Krug

nodes.label: Measuring the User Experience
nodes.desc: Quantitative methods for UX. Task success, time-on-task, errors, satisfaction, SUS scores, and statistical analysis.
nodes.author: Tom Tullis & Bill Albert

nodes.label: System Usability Scale (SUS)
nodes.desc: The industry-standard quick usability questionnaire. 10 questions producing a 0-100 score. Simple, reliable, and widely benchmarked.
nodes.author: John Brooke

nodes.label: Fitts's Law: Modeling Movement Time in HCI
nodes.desc: The time to acquire a target is a function of distance and size. Foundational for button sizing, touch targets, and menu design.
nodes.author: Paul Fitts

nodes.label: Hick's Law: Making the Choice Easier
nodes.desc: Decision time increases logarithmically with the number of choices. Applies to navigation menus, option sets, and feature disclosure.
nodes.author: William Edmund Hick

nodes.label: Direct Manipulation Interfaces
nodes.desc: The theory behind direct manipulation: continuous representation, physical actions, rapid feedback. Why drag-and-drop feels natural.
nodes.author: Edwin Hutchins, James Hollan & Don Norman

nodes.label: Laws of UX
nodes.desc: Beautifully designed collection of UX laws: Fitts, Hick, Jakob, Miller, Doherty, Tesler, and more. Each with clear explanations and examples.
nodes.author: Jon Yablonski

nodes.label: The Gulf of Execution and Evaluation
nodes.desc: Norman's model of the gap between user intentions and system actions (execution) and between system state and user understanding (evaluation).
nodes.author: Don Norman

nodes.label: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2
nodes.desc: The international standard for web accessibility. Perceivable, operable, understandable, and robust (POUR) principles.
nodes.author: W3C WAI

nodes.label: Inclusive Design Principles
nodes.desc: Seven principles for designing inclusive experiences: comparable, considerate, consistent, controlled, contextual, contributory, and compliant.
nodes.author: Paciello Group

nodes.label: Mismatch: How Inclusion Shapes Design
nodes.desc: Reframes disability as a mismatched interaction between a person and their environment. Inclusion as a design driver.
nodes.author: Kat Holmes

nodes.label: The Accessibility of Styled Form Controls
nodes.desc: Accessible implementations of custom-styled form controls. Checkboxes, radios, switches, selects, and range sliders.
nodes.author: Scott O'Hara

nodes.label: Theory of Games and Economic Behavior
nodes.desc: The founding text of game theory and decision theory. Establishes expected utility, minimax, and the mathematical framework for strategic interaction.
nodes.author: John von Neumann & Oskar Morgenstern

nodes.label: The Foundations of Statistics
nodes.desc: Subjective expected utility theory. How rational agents should make decisions under uncertainty. Foundation for Bayesian decision theory.
nodes.author: Leonard Savage

nodes.label: Rational Choice Theory (Stanford Encyclopedia)
nodes.desc: Comprehensive overview of instrumental rationality and rational choice. The theoretical basis for understanding how users "should" choose.
nodes.author: Sven Ove Hansson

nodes.label: Decision Theory: A Brief Introduction
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction to normative and descriptive decision theory. Good starting point before behavioral economics.
nodes.author: Sven Ove Hansson

nodes.label: Nudge: Improving Decisions About Health, Wealth, and Happiness
nodes.desc: The foundational text on choice architecture. How the structure of choices influences decisions. Default effects, feedback, mapping, and structuring.
nodes.author: Richard Thaler & Cass Sunstein

nodes.label: Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products
nodes.desc: The Hook Model: trigger, action, variable reward, investment. Framework for designing engaging products (use ethically).
nodes.author: Nir Eyal

nodes.label: Evil by Design
nodes.desc: How persuasive design patterns work — and when they cross into manipulation. Maps the seven deadly sins to design patterns.
nodes.author: Chris Nodder

nodes.label: Dark Patterns: Deceptive Design
nodes.desc: Taxonomy of deceptive design patterns. Understanding dark patterns is essential for ethical design — know them to avoid them.
nodes.author: Harry Brignull

nodes.label: Persuasive Technology
nodes.desc: How computers can be designed to influence attitudes and behaviors. The Fogg Behavior Model: motivation, ability, and triggers.
nodes.author: B.J. Fogg

nodes.label: Thinking, Fast and Slow
nodes.desc: Nobel laureate's synthesis of decades of research. System 1 (fast, intuitive) vs. System 2 (slow, deliberate). Biases, heuristics, and prospect theory.
nodes.author: Daniel Kahneman

nodes.label: Predictably Irrational
nodes.desc: Systematic irrationality in human decision-making. Decoy effect, anchoring, free pricing, and social vs. market norms. Directly applicable to UI design.
nodes.author: Dan Ariely

nodes.label: Misbehaving: The Making of Behavioral Economics
nodes.desc: How behavioral economics emerged as a field. Mental accounting, endowment effect, fairness, and the gap between Econs and Humans.
nodes.author: Richard Thaler

nodes.label: Prospect Theory: An Analysis of Decision Under Risk
nodes.desc: The paper that launched behavioral economics. Loss aversion, reference dependence, and the S-shaped value function.
nodes.author: Daniel Kahneman & Amos Tversky

nodes.label: Cognitive Biases in UX Design
nodes.desc: Direct application of cognitive biases to UX. Framing, anchoring, confirmation bias, and sunk cost applied to interface design decisions.
nodes.author: David Dylan Thomas

nodes.label: Computational Geometry: Algorithms and Applications
nodes.desc: Definitive text on computational geometry including convex hull algorithms. The mathematical foundation for understanding design space boundaries.
nodes.author: Mark de Berg et al.

nodes.label: Multi-Objective Optimization in Design
nodes.desc: Pareto frontiers in design: the boundary of designs where no objective can be improved without worsening another. The convex hull of the design space.
nodes.author: various

nodes.label: Design Space Exploration
nodes.desc: Systematic exploration of the space of possible designs. Trade-off analysis, design dimensions, and mapping the boundaries of possibility.
nodes.author: Hartmut Ehrig et al.

nodes.label: Actionable Gamification: Beyond Points, Badges, and Leaderboards
nodes.desc: The Octalysis framework: 8 core drives of motivation. Goes beyond superficial gamification to understand intrinsic motivation.
nodes.author: Yu-kai Chou

nodes.label: Reality Is Broken
nodes.desc: Why games make us better and how they can change the world. The psychology of voluntary engagement and intrinsic motivation.
nodes.author: Jane McGonigal

nodes.label: Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience
nodes.desc: The science of optimal experience. Flow state requires clear goals, immediate feedback, and balance between challenge and skill — directly applicable to UX.
nodes.author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi

nodes.label: For the Win: How Game Thinking Can Revolutionize Your Business
nodes.desc: Framework for applying game elements to business contexts. Mechanics, dynamics, components, and the player journey.
nodes.author: Kevin Werbach & Dan Hunter

nodes.label: Self-Determination Theory in UX
nodes.desc: Autonomy, competence, and relatedness applied to UX. The psychological needs framework that underlies sustainable engagement.
nodes.author: Raluca Budiu, NNG

nodes.label: Art and Visual Perception
nodes.desc: The foundational text on visual perception in art and design. Balance, shape, form, growth, space, light, color, movement, tension, and expression.
nodes.author: Rudolf Arnheim

nodes.label: Gestalt Principles for Data Visualization
nodes.desc: Beautiful talk applying Gestalt principles to data visualization. Proximity, similarity, enclosure, connection, and continuity with visual examples.
nodes.author: Nadieh Bremer

nodes.label: Gestalt Principles in UI Design
nodes.desc: Series of articles applying each Gestalt principle to interface design. Practical examples showing proximity, similarity, and common region in real UIs.
nodes.author: Aurora Harley, NNG

nodes.label: Universal Principles of Design
nodes.desc: 125 design principles including all Gestalt laws, with examples from architecture, product design, and visual communication.
nodes.author: William Lidwell, Kritina Holden & Jill Butler

nodes.label: Laws of Simplicity
nodes.desc: Ten laws for simplifying complex systems: reduce, organize, time, learn, differences, context, emotion, trust, failure, and "the one."
nodes.author: John Maeda

nodes.label: Visual Grammar
nodes.desc: Concise taxonomy of visual elements and their relationships. Abstract objects, activities, and relations that form the basis of visual communication.
nodes.author: Christian Leborg

nodes.label: Visual Thinking for Design
nodes.desc: How the visual system processes information for design. Pre-attentive processing, pattern perception, and visual queries.
nodes.author: Colin Ware

nodes.label: Layout Essentials: 100 Design Principles
nodes.desc: Practical layout principles: grids, hierarchy, white space, typography, and the anatomy of effective page layouts.
nodes.author: Beth Tondreau

nodes.label: Pre-Attentive Visual Properties in Visualization
nodes.desc: Interactive demonstration of pre-attentive visual properties: color, form, spatial position, and motion. What the eye detects in under 200ms.
nodes.author: Christopher G. Healey

nodes.label: Information Visualization: Perception for Design
nodes.desc: Definitive text on perception for visualization. Color, texture, motion, pattern, and how the visual brain creates meaning from data.
nodes.author: Colin Ware

nodes.label: The Invisible Gorilla
nodes.desc: Inattentional blindness and the illusions of attention. Why users miss obvious UI elements and how to design for limited attention.
nodes.author: Christopher Chabris & Daniel Simons

nodes.label: Change Blindness in User Interfaces
nodes.desc: How users fail to notice changes on screen, even significant ones. Design implications for notifications, updates, and state changes.
nodes.author: Jakob Nielsen

nodes.label: Recognition Over Recall in User Interfaces
nodes.desc: Why recognition is easier than recall and how to design interfaces that leverage this. Menus over commands, autocomplete over free text.
nodes.author: Raluca Budiu, NNG

nodes.label: Emotional Design
nodes.desc: Three levels of design processing: visceral (appearance), behavioral (function), and reflective (meaning). Why attractive things work better.
nodes.author: Don Norman

nodes.label: Designing for Emotion
nodes.desc: Maslow's hierarchy applied to UX: functional, reliable, usable, and pleasurable. How to design interfaces that create emotional connections.
nodes.author: Aarron Walter

nodes.label: Seductive Interaction Design
nodes.desc: Psychology of engagement in UX. Curiosity, feedback loops, playfulness, and the science of creating delightful interactions.
nodes.author: Stephen Anderson

nodes.label: The Aesthetic-Usability Effect
nodes.desc: Research showing that aesthetically pleasing designs are perceived as more usable. Beautiful design builds trust and tolerance for minor usability issues.
nodes.author: Kate Moran, NNG

nodes.label: Semiotics: The Basics
nodes.desc: Clear introduction to the study of signs. Signifier/signified, icon/index/symbol, denotation/connotation applied to visual communication.
nodes.author: Daniel Chandler

nodes.label: The Semiotics of Emoji
nodes.desc: How emoji function as a sign system. Relevant to understanding how icons and visual symbols communicate in interfaces.
nodes.author: Marcel Danesi

nodes.label: Icon Classification: Resemblance, Reference, and Arbitrary
nodes.desc: Three types of icon-meaning relationships: resemblance (looks like the thing), reference (associated with the thing), and arbitrary (learned convention).
nodes.author: Page Laubheimer, NNG

nodes.label: Visual Communication: Images with Messages
nodes.desc: Comprehensive visual communication textbook. Covers visual perception, persuasion, semiotics, and the role of images in meaning-making.
nodes.author: Paul Martin Lester

nodes.label: Design Tokens W3C Community Group
nodes.desc: The emerging standard for design token format. JSON-based specification for cross-platform token exchange.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: Style Dictionary
nodes.desc: Build system for design tokens. Transforms tokens into platform-specific outputs: CSS, SCSS, iOS, Android, and more.
nodes.author: Amazon

nodes.label: Tokens Studio for Figma
nodes.desc: Figma plugin for managing design tokens. Connects Figma to code via token JSON files with Git sync.
nodes.author: Tokens Studio

nodes.label: Design Tokens — Beyond the Basics
nodes.desc: Deep dive into token architecture: naming conventions, aliasing, theming, and multi-platform token management.
nodes.author: Cristiano Rastelli

nodes.label: Naming Tokens in Design Systems
nodes.desc: Systematic approach to token naming. Category-type-item pattern and how to create names that scale across themes and platforms.
nodes.author: Nathan Curtis

nodes.label: Modular Web Design
nodes.desc: How to create reusable component libraries. Component definition, documentation, governance, and organizational adoption.
nodes.author: Nathan Curtis

nodes.label: Storybook
nodes.desc: The standard tool for developing UI components in isolation. Documentation, visual testing, and interaction testing for component libraries.
nodes.author: Storybook maintainers

nodes.label: Chromatic (Visual Regression Testing)
nodes.desc: Visual regression testing for Storybook. Catches unintended visual changes in components across browsers and viewports.
nodes.author: Chromatic

nodes.label: Component-Driven User Interfaces
nodes.desc: Methodology for building UIs from components. Build, test, document, and combine components into screens.
nodes.author: Varun Vachhar (Chromatic)

nodes.label: Headless UI Patterns
nodes.desc: Separation of component logic from presentation. Build accessible, unstyled components that teams can style to match any design system.
nodes.author: Diego Haz

nodes.label: Design Systems
nodes.desc: Practical guide covering how to establish, maintain, and evolve a design system. Pattern definition, naming, and governance models.
nodes.author: Alla Kholmatova

nodes.label: Team Models for Scaling Design Systems
nodes.desc: Organizational models for design system teams: solitary, centralized, federated, and cyclical. Pros and cons of each approach.
nodes.author: Nathan Curtis

nodes.label: The Component Gallery
nodes.desc: Collection of design system components across major systems. Compare implementations of the same component pattern across organizations.
nodes.author: Various

nodes.label: ADRs (Architecture Decision Records)
nodes.desc: Lightweight format for recording architectural decisions. Essential for documenting the "why" behind design system choices.
nodes.author: Michael Nygard

nodes.label: Contribution Models for Design Systems
nodes.desc: How teams contribute to design systems: guidelines, processes, quality gates, and recognition models for contributors.
nodes.author: Nathan Curtis

nodes.label: Figma for Design Systems
nodes.desc: Figma's official guide to building design systems. Components, styles, libraries, variables, and team collaboration.
nodes.author: Figma

nodes.label: Design System Versioning
nodes.desc: Semantic versioning for design systems. Breaking changes, deprecation strategies, and migration paths for consuming teams.
nodes.author: Nathan Curtis

nodes.label: Visual Regression Testing for Design Systems
nodes.desc: How to set up visual regression testing with Storybook and Chromatic. Catch visual regressions before they ship.
nodes.author: Varun Vachhar

nodes.label: Figma Plugin API
nodes.desc: Build custom Figma plugins to automate design system workflows: token sync, lint, generate code, and enforce standards.
nodes.author: Figma

nodes.label: Material Design (Google)
nodes.desc: Google's comprehensive design system. Material 3 covers dynamic color, typography, motion, and components across platforms.
nodes.author: Google

nodes.label: Lightning Design System (Salesforce)
nodes.desc: Enterprise design system for Salesforce. Tokens, components, patterns, and accessibility standards for complex business applications.
nodes.author: Salesforce

nodes.label: Carbon Design System (IBM)
nodes.desc: IBM's open-source design system. Comprehensive components, data visualization, patterns, and contribution guidelines.
nodes.author: IBM

nodes.label: Polaris (Shopify)
nodes.desc: Shopify's design system for building admin experiences. Tokens, components, patterns, and content guidelines.
nodes.author: Shopify

nodes.label: Spectrum (Adobe)
nodes.desc: Adobe's cross-platform design system. Inclusive design, internationalization, and consistency across Creative Cloud products.
nodes.author: Adobe

nodes.label: Primer (GitHub)
nodes.desc: GitHub's open-source design system. CSS framework, React components, and design guidelines powering GitHub's interface.
nodes.author: GitHub

nodes.label: Biomimicry: Innovation Inspired by Nature
nodes.desc: The foundational text that popularized biomimicry as a design discipline. Benyus surveys how engineers and architects can learn from biological models across scales.
nodes.author: Janine Benyus

nodes.label: The Architectural Relevance of Biological Structures
nodes.desc: Comprehensive treatment of how structural principles in biology inform architectural engineering, from insect shells to plant mechanics.
nodes.author: Werner Nachtigall

nodes.label: Architecture Follows Nature: Biomimetic Principles for Innovative Design
nodes.desc: A richly illustrated guide linking specific biological organisms to architectural strategies, with detailed case studies and design methods.
nodes.author: Ilaria Mazzoleni

nodes.label: Nature's Building Methods: Biology as Inspiration for Architecture
nodes.desc: Gruber systematically maps biological strategies to building functions, providing a rigorous methodology for translating nature's solutions into architecture.
nodes.author: Petra Gruber

nodes.label: Biomimetics in Architecture: Architecture of Life and Buildings
nodes.desc: A survey chapter mapping the intersection of biology, materials science, and architectural design with a focus on transfer methodologies.
nodes.author: Petra Gruber & Barbara Imhof

nodes.label: A Review of Biomimicry in Building Energy Efficiency
nodes.desc: Systematic review of how biomimetic strategies have been applied to building envelopes, HVAC systems, and energy management.
nodes.author: Moham M. Alzoubi & Yousef Al-Zoubi

nodes.label: Biomimicry in Architecture: State of the Art and Challenges
nodes.desc: Explores current challenges in translating biological knowledge into viable architectural systems, including interdisciplinary collaboration barriers.
nodes.author: Natasha Chayaamor-Heil & Nikoletta Hannachi-Belkadi

nodes.label: Learning from Nature: Biomimetic Design for Sustainable Architecture
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction distinguishing organism-level mimicry from behaviour-level and ecosystem-level mimicry in architectural design.
nodes.author: Maibritt Pedersen Zari

nodes.label: Janine Benyus: Biomimicry in Action
nodes.desc: Benyus presents real-world examples of designs inspired by nature, including self-cleaning surfaces and energy-efficient buildings.
nodes.author: Janine Benyus (TED)

nodes.label: Michael Pawlyn: Using Nature's Genius in Architecture
nodes.desc: Architect Michael Pawlyn demonstrates three habits of nature that could transform architecture: radical resource efficiency, closed loops, and solar energy.
nodes.author: Michael Pawlyn (TED)

nodes.label: Neri Oxman: Design at the Intersection of Technology and Biology
nodes.desc: Oxman presents her lab's work on material ecology, where computational design and biological fabrication converge to create adaptive structures.
nodes.author: Neri Oxman (TED)

nodes.label: Biomimicry: A Short Introduction (Crash Course)
nodes.desc: A concise animated introduction to the core principles of biomimicry and how they apply across design disciplines including architecture.
nodes.author: Biomimicry Institute

nodes.label: Termite Mounds as Organismal Constructions
nodes.desc: Turner's landmark work recasts the termite mound as an extended organ of the colony, analyzing gas exchange, humidity regulation, and the physics of airflow.
nodes.author: J. Scott Turner

nodes.label: Termite-Inspired Thermoregulation: Lessons for Architecture
nodes.desc: Detailed study of how Macrotermes mounds regulate CO2 and temperature through porous wall structures, with implications for building-envelope design.
nodes.author: Rupert Soar & J. Scott Turner

nodes.label: How Termites Build Complex Mounds (BBC Earth)
nodes.desc: Accessible documentary segment showing CT scans and thermal imaging of termite mound ventilation systems.
nodes.author: BBC Earth

nodes.label: The Extended Organism: The Physiology of Animal-Built Structures
nodes.desc: Broader treatment of animal-built structures as physiological extensions, with a central chapter on termite mound thermoregulation.
nodes.author: J. Scott Turner

nodes.label: Natural Ventilation in Buildings: A Design Handbook
nodes.desc: Comprehensive engineering handbook covering stack-effect ventilation, cross-ventilation, and wind-driven strategies for naturally ventilated buildings.
nodes.author: Francis Allard (ed.)

nodes.label: Ventilation and Airflow in Buildings: Methods for Diagnosis and Evaluation
nodes.desc: Technical guide to measuring and modeling airflow in buildings, including tracer gas methods and computational fluid dynamics techniques.
nodes.author: Claude-Alain Roulet

nodes.label: Passive Cooling of Buildings (Coursera)
nodes.desc: Online course covering passive cooling strategies including natural ventilation, thermal mass, earth coupling, and evaporative cooling.
nodes.author: University of Louvain

nodes.label: DesignBuilder CFD Simulation Tutorials
nodes.desc: Official tutorial series for simulating natural ventilation and thermal comfort in buildings using integrated EnergyPlus and CFD engines.
nodes.author: DesignBuilder Software

nodes.label: Eastgate Centre, Harare: Biomimicry in Practice
nodes.desc: Architect's own account of the Eastgate Centre, which uses termite-inspired passive ventilation and thermal mass to cool a 31,000 m2 building without air conditioning.
nodes.author: Mick Pearce Architects

nodes.label: CH2 Melbourne City Council House
nodes.desc: Case study of Melbourne's 6-star Green Star building featuring biomimetic night-purge ventilation, shower towers, and phase-change materials.
nodes.author: City of Melbourne & DesignInc

nodes.label: BedZED: Beddington Zero Energy Development
nodes.desc: South London mixed-use development using wind-driven ventilation cowls and high thermal mass to achieve near-zero heating demand.
nodes.author: Bill Dunster Architects

nodes.label: Finding Form: Towards an Architecture of the Minimal
nodes.desc: Otto's seminal work documenting decades of form-finding experiments with soap films, hanging chains, and pneumatic models.
nodes.author: Frei Otto & Bodo Rasch

nodes.label: Thin Shell Concrete Structures
nodes.desc: Classic engineering text on the analysis and design of thin concrete shells, covering membrane theory, bending theory, and stability.
nodes.author: David P. Billington

nodes.label: Biology and the Mechanics of Shells
nodes.desc: Review of how biological mineralized shells achieve fracture toughness through hierarchical microstructures, with lessons for engineered composites.
nodes.author: A. R. Studart

nodes.label: The Architecture of Heinz Isler: Shells for Living
nodes.desc: Monograph on Isler's concrete shell designs, documenting his hanging-model technique and over 1,500 built shell structures.
nodes.author: John Chilton

nodes.label: Geodesic Math and How to Use It
nodes.desc: Practical mathematical guide to constructing geodesic structures, explaining the coordinate geometry and frequency subdivisions behind Fuller's domes.
nodes.author: Hugh Kenner

nodes.label: Tensegrity: Structural Systems for the Future
nodes.desc: Comprehensive treatment of tensegrity mechanics, from Kenneth Snelson's sculptures to deployable space structures and biological cytoskeletons.
nodes.author: René Motro

nodes.label: Buckminster Fuller: Starting with the Universe
nodes.desc: Documentary overview of Fuller's geodesic domes, Dymaxion designs, and his philosophy of doing more with less.
nodes.author: Whitney Museum of American Art

nodes.label: Tensegrity Structures: Form, Stability, and Symmetry
nodes.desc: Mathematical framework for the analysis and design of tensegrity structures, covering form-finding algorithms, stability criteria, and symmetry groups.
nodes.author: Jing Yao Zhang & Makoto Ohsaki

nodes.label: Kangaroo Physics for Grasshopper
nodes.desc: Real-time physics engine for Grasshopper enabling interactive form-finding of shells, membranes, and tensile structures through particle-spring simulation.
nodes.author: Daniel Piker

nodes.label: Form Finding and Optimization of Membranes and Minimal Surfaces
nodes.desc: Technical paper on finite-element-based form-finding methods for membrane structures, including the updated reference strategy and force density method.
nodes.author: Kai-Uwe Bletzinger

nodes.label: Karamba3D: Parametric Structural Analysis
nodes.desc: Structural analysis plugin for Grasshopper allowing real-time feedback on shell thickness, stress distribution, and deflection during parametric design.
nodes.author: Clemens Preisinger

nodes.label: The Force Density Method for Form Finding (Lecture)
nodes.desc: Lecture from Philippe Block's group explaining the force density method and thrust network analysis for compression-only shell design.
nodes.author: ETH Zurich Block Research Group

nodes.label: Plant Biomechanics: An Engineering Approach to Plant Form and Function
nodes.desc: Rigorous biomechanical analysis of plant structures, including turgor-driven movements, hygroscopic actuation, and nastic responses relevant to facade design.
nodes.author: Karl J. Niklas

nodes.label: Biomimetic Research for Architecture and Building Construction
nodes.desc: Collected research from the German SFB-TRR 141 programme, including chapters on plant-inspired adaptive shading and flap mechanisms.
nodes.author: Jan Knippers, Klaus Nickel & Thomas Speck (eds.)

nodes.label: How Do Pinecones Open? Hygromorphic Actuation Explained
nodes.desc: Short lecture explaining the bilayer mechanism that drives pinecone scale opening and its potential for architectural applications.
nodes.author: Lorna J. Gibson (MIT)

nodes.label: The Adaptive Building Initiative: Bio-inspired Facades
nodes.desc: Description of the HygroScope and HygroSkin pavilions at the University of Stuttgart, where wood veneer elements respond passively to humidity changes.
nodes.author: Achim Menges & Steffen Reichert

nodes.label: Al Bahar Towers: Adaptive Facade Case Study
nodes.desc: Technical case study of the kinetic mashrabiya screen in Abu Dhabi, which uses origami-folding elements to reduce solar gain by up to 50%.
nodes.author: Aedas Architects & Arup

nodes.label: Adaptive Building Skins: Design and Technology
nodes.desc: Survey of state-of-the-art responsive facades covering mechanical, pneumatic, and material-based actuation systems.
nodes.author: Ulrich Knaack et al.

nodes.label: Climate Adaptive Building Shells (CABS) Database
nodes.desc: Curated database of over 100 climate-adaptive building shell concepts with performance data, categorized by adaptation mechanism.
nodes.author: TU Delft

nodes.label: One Ocean Pavilion: Kinetic Facade (Yeosu Expo 2012)
nodes.desc: Time-lapse and behind-the-scenes footage of the SOMA pavilion's lamellar kinetic facade, inspired by the movement of fish gills.
nodes.author: soma architecture

nodes.label: Smart Materials in Architecture, Interior Architecture and Design
nodes.desc: Comprehensive guide to shape-memory alloys, electrochromic glazing, thermochromic coatings, and photovoltaic integration in building envelopes.
nodes.author: Axel Ritter

nodes.label: Thermobimetal Responsive Architecture
nodes.desc: Sung demonstrates thermobimetal panels that curl autonomously with temperature change, providing self-ventilating building skins without electricity.
nodes.author: Doris Sung (USC)

nodes.label: Shape Memory Alloy Actuators for Adaptive Facades
nodes.desc: Review of shape-memory alloy applications in building facades, covering nitinol actuator design, fatigue life, and energy-harvesting potential.
nodes.author: A. Aelenei et al.

nodes.label: Electrochromic Glazing: Performance and Control Strategies
nodes.desc: Lawrence Berkeley National Lab study on dynamic electrochromic windows that modulate visible transmittance in response to glare and solar heat gain.
nodes.author: Eleanor S. Lee et al.

nodes.label: Topology Optimization: Theory, Methods, and Applications
nodes.desc: The definitive textbook on computational topology optimization, covering SIMP, homogenization, and level-set methods with engineering applications.
nodes.author: Martin P. Bendsøe & Ole Sigmund

nodes.label: A 99-Line Topology Optimization Code in MATLAB
nodes.desc: Classic paper and accompanying MATLAB code providing a minimal working implementation of SIMP-based topology optimization.
nodes.author: Ole Sigmund

nodes.label: TopOpt: Interactive Topology Optimization (Web App)
nodes.desc: Free web-based tool for experimenting with 2D topology optimization in real time, illustrating how bone-like structures emerge from load conditions.
nodes.author: Technical University of Denmark

nodes.label: Design in Nature: Wolff's Law and Bone Remodeling
nodes.desc: Concise review of Wolff's law and computational bone remodeling, connecting biological adaptation to engineering topology optimization.
nodes.author: Rik Huiskes

nodes.label: Design in Nature: Learning from Trees
nodes.desc: Mattheck presents the constant stress hypothesis, showing how trees optimize their shape at branch junctions, and applies these principles to engineering design.
nodes.author: Claus Mattheck

nodes.label: The Stuttgart Airport Tree Columns
nodes.desc: Case study of the Stuttgart Airport terminal's tree-like branching steel columns that distribute roof loads efficiently inspired by natural branching patterns.
nodes.author: Buro Happold & GMP Architects

nodes.label: Branching Structures in Architecture
nodes.desc: Lecture on how tree-branching morphology has been adapted for architectural columns, canopies, and long-span roof supports.
nodes.author: Remo Pedreschi

nodes.label: Large-Scale 3D Printing for Construction
nodes.desc: Overview of Contour Crafting technology for 3D-printing buildings, including how topology-optimized and bio-inspired geometries become feasible at building scale.
nodes.author: Behrokh Khoshnevis (USC)

nodes.label: Digital Grotesque: 3D Printed Room
nodes.desc: Project documentation of the first fully 3D-printed room, featuring algorithmically generated ornamentation with coral-like fractal geometry.
nodes.author: Michael Hansmeyer & Benjamin Dillenburger

nodes.label: Mediated Matter Group: Bio-Inspired Digital Fabrication
nodes.desc: Research group portfolio documenting multi-material 3D printing inspired by biological structures, including the Silk Pavilion and Aguahoja projects.
nodes.author: Neri Oxman (MIT Media Lab)

nodes.label: 3D Printing Architecture: Workflows, Case Studies, Innovations
nodes.desc: Survey of current 3D printing workflows for architecture, with case studies featuring bio-inspired structural optimization and computational design pipelines.
nodes.author: Carlos Baieta

nodes.label: Biophilic Design: The Theory, Science and Practice of Bringing Buildings to Life
nodes.desc: Foundational anthology defining 14 patterns of biophilic design with evidence from environmental psychology, neuroscience, and architectural practice.
nodes.author: Stephen R. Kellert, Judith Heerwagen & Martin Mador

nodes.label: 14 Patterns of Biophilic Design
nodes.desc: Free report distilling biophilic design into 14 actionable patterns with built examples, metrics, and implementation guidance for designers.
nodes.author: Terrapin Bright Green

nodes.label: Biophilic Cities: Integrating Nature into Urban Design and Planning
nodes.desc: Beatley surveys cities worldwide that have successfully integrated nature into urban planning, from Singapore to Oslo.
nodes.author: Timothy Beatley

nodes.label: The Nature of the View from Home: Psychological Benefits
nodes.desc: Landmark study demonstrating that views of nature from residential windows correlate with higher satisfaction, well-being, and cognitive function.
nodes.author: Rachel & Stephen Kaplan

nodes.label: Green Roof Systems: A Guide to the Planning, Design and Construction
nodes.desc: Practical design guide for extensive and intensive green roofs, covering substrate engineering, plant selection, waterproofing, and stormwater performance.
nodes.author: Susan Weiler & Katrin Scholz-Barth

nodes.label: Bosco Verticale: Vertical Forest, Milan
nodes.desc: Documentary on Milan's Bosco Verticale towers, which host over 900 trees and 20,000 plants on residential balconies to filter air and moderate microclimate.
nodes.author: Stefano Boeri Architetti

nodes.label: i-Tree: Urban Forest Assessment Tools
nodes.desc: Free suite of tools for quantifying the ecosystem services of urban trees, including carbon storage, air pollution removal, and stormwater interception.
nodes.author: USDA Forest Service

nodes.label: Green Infrastructure for Landscape Planning
nodes.desc: Integration of bioswales, rain gardens, constructed wetlands, and urban forests into landscape planning with quantitative sizing methods.
nodes.author: Gary Austin

nodes.label: The Economics of Ecosystems and Biodiversity (TEEB) Manual for Cities
nodes.desc: Guidance document for municipal decision-makers on how to value and integrate urban ecosystem services into planning and budgeting.
nodes.author: TEEB

nodes.label: Urban Ecosystem Services: A Review
nodes.desc: Comprehensive review of urban ecosystem services research, covering valuation methods, typologies, and policy integration challenges.
nodes.author: Erik Gómez-Baggethun & David N. Barton

nodes.label: Nature-Based Solutions for Climate Resilience (EU Report)
nodes.desc: EU research portal on nature-based solutions for urban flood management, heat mitigation, and biodiversity conservation.
nodes.author: European Commission

nodes.label: Singapore: City in Nature (National Parks Board)
nodes.desc: Overview of Singapore's strategy to become a City in Nature by 2030, integrating skyrise greenery, ecological corridors, and therapeutic gardens.
nodes.author: NParks Singapore

nodes.label: Grasshopper: Algorithmic Modeling for Rhino
nodes.desc: The industry-standard visual programming environment for parametric design, enabling complex bio-inspired geometry through node-based workflows.
nodes.author: Robert McNeel & Associates

nodes.label: The Algorithmic Beauty of Plants
nodes.desc: Classic text on L-systems for modeling plant growth and branching, freely available online. Foundation for generative branching algorithms in architecture.
nodes.author: Przemyslaw Prusinkiewicz & Aristid Lindenmayer

nodes.label: Galapagos: Evolutionary Solver in Grasshopper
nodes.desc: Built-in evolutionary optimization component for Grasshopper that uses genetic algorithms to solve multi-objective design problems.
nodes.author: David Rutten

nodes.label: Morphogenesis and Computation: A Design Exploration (MIT OCW)
nodes.desc: MIT OpenCourseWare materials on computational design processes inspired by biological morphogenesis, covering agent-based models and reaction-diffusion systems.
nodes.author: MIT Media Lab / Neri Oxman

nodes.label: Nature of Code
nodes.desc: Free online textbook teaching simulation of natural systems (physics, flocking, cellular automata, fractals) through code, directly applicable to generative design.
nodes.author: Daniel Shiffman

nodes.label: Ladybug Tools: Environmental Analysis for Grasshopper
nodes.desc: Open-source plugin suite connecting Grasshopper to EnergyPlus, Radiance, and OpenFOAM for daylight, energy, and airflow simulation within parametric workflows.
nodes.author: Mostapha Sadeghipour Roudsari

nodes.label: EnergyPlus: Whole Building Energy Simulation
nodes.desc: Open-source building energy simulation engine capable of modeling natural ventilation, thermal mass, and adaptive facade strategies at sub-hourly resolution.
nodes.author: US Department of Energy

nodes.label: Radiance: Physically-Based Lighting Simulation
nodes.desc: Industry-standard ray-tracing engine for daylight analysis, used to optimize biomimetic shading and light-redirecting facades.
nodes.author: Greg Ward (LBNL)

nodes.label: Environmental Design of Buildings (Coursera)
nodes.desc: Course covering building physics, thermal comfort, and environmental simulation methods for sustainable architecture.
nodes.author: University of Cambridge

nodes.label: Robots in Architecture: KUKA|prc for Grasshopper
nodes.desc: Plugin for programming KUKA robotic arms directly from Grasshopper, enabling robotic fabrication of complex bio-inspired building components.
nodes.author: Association for Robots in Architecture

nodes.label: How to Make (Almost) Anything (MIT Fab Lab)
nodes.desc: MIT course on digital fabrication spanning CNC milling, laser cutting, 3D printing, and electronics—skills essential for prototyping biomimetic designs.
nodes.author: Neil Gershenfeld (MIT)

nodes.label: ICD/ITKE Research Pavilions (University of Stuttgart)
nodes.desc: Documentation of the ICD/ITKE research pavilion series, which uses robotic fabrication to build lightweight fiber structures inspired by beetle elytra and sea urchin plates.
nodes.author: Achim Menges & Jan Knippers

nodes.label: Fabrication Information Modeling: Digital Fabrication Handbook
nodes.desc: Paper on integrating digital fabrication constraints into parametric design models, ensuring computationally derived bio-inspired forms are buildable.
nodes.author: Fabian Scheurer & Hanno Stehling

nodes.label: Bio-Inspired Artificial Intelligence: Theories, Methods, and Technologies
nodes.desc: A comprehensive MIT Press text spanning neural networks, evolutionary computation, and embodied intelligence as they apply to robotics and AI.
nodes.author: Dario Floreano & Claudio Mattiussi

nodes.label: Biorobotics: Using Robots to Emulate and Investigate Agile Animal Locomotion
nodes.desc: Seminal Science review framing biorobotics as a two-way street: robots test biological hypotheses while biology inspires robot design.
nodes.author: Auke Jan Ijspeert

nodes.label: Biomimetics: Biologically Inspired Technologies
nodes.desc: Edited volume covering electroactive polymers, gecko adhesion, and other biomimetic technologies relevant to robotics.
nodes.author: Yoseph Bar-Cohen (Editor)

nodes.label: How the Body Shapes the Way We Think
nodes.desc: Foundational book on embodied intelligence, arguing that morphology and materials are as important as the controller in bio-inspired robots.
nodes.author: Rolf Pfeifer & Josh Bongard

nodes.label: Robots That Can Adapt Like Animals
nodes.desc: Nature paper presenting the Intelligent Trial-and-Error algorithm that lets damaged robots rapidly adapt, drawing on animal resilience.
nodes.author: Antoine Cully, Jeff Clune, Danesh Tarapore & Jean-Baptiste Mouret

nodes.label: Soft Robotics: Biological Inspiration, State of the Art, and Future Research
nodes.desc: Comprehensive survey in Advanced Functional Materials covering the landscape of soft robotics and its biological underpinnings.
nodes.author: Daniela Rus & Michael T. Tolley

nodes.label: Bioinspired Robot Design: A Comprehensive Review
nodes.desc: Frontiers in Robotics and AI survey providing a broad taxonomy of bio-inspired robots across locomotion, manipulation, and sensing.
nodes.author: Shuai Li et al.

nodes.label: From Animals to Animats: Simulation of Adaptive Behavior (SAB proceedings)
nodes.desc: Proceedings of the foundational SAB conference series where the animat framework bridging ethology and robotics was established.
nodes.author: Jean-Arcady Meyer & Stewart W. Wilson

nodes.label: Bio-Inspired Robotics (ETH Zurich Lecture Series)
nodes.desc: Lecture series from ETH Zurich introducing key concepts in bio-inspired robot design, including soft robotics and locomotion.
nodes.author: ETH Zurich / Robert Katzschmann

nodes.label: Introduction to Robotics — Stanford CS223A
nodes.desc: Stanford lecture series covering classical robotics fundamentals that underpin bio-inspired extensions in kinematics, dynamics, and control.
nodes.author: Oussama Khatib

nodes.label: Biologically Inspired Robotics — MIT OpenCourseWare
nodes.desc: MIT course exploring how principles from biology can inform the design of robots, covering locomotion, manipulation, and sensing.
nodes.author: MIT OCW

nodes.label: Design, Fabrication and Control of Soft Robots
nodes.desc: Nature review on how compliant materials and novel fabrication methods are creating a new class of robots fundamentally different from rigid machines.
nodes.author: Daniela Rus & Michael T. Tolley

nodes.label: Elastomeric Origami: Programmable Paper-Elastomer Composites as Pneumatic Actuators
nodes.desc: Paper demonstrating how combining paper and elastomer layers enables programmable pneumatic soft actuators with complex motions.
nodes.author: R. V. Martinez et al.

nodes.label: Dielectric Elastomers as Next-Generation Polymeric Actuators
nodes.desc: Early and influential paper on dielectric elastomer actuators achieving large strains and high energy densities comparable to biological muscle.
nodes.author: Ron Pelrine et al.

nodes.label: Soft Robotics Toolkit
nodes.desc: Open-source collection of design files, fabrication tutorials, and control software for building pneumatic soft robots.
nodes.author: Harvard Biodesign Lab

nodes.label: An Octopus-Bioinspired Solution to Movement and Manipulation for Soft Robots

nodes.desc: Open-source Python package providing reinforcement learning gym environments for simulating soft robot locomotion including crawling and swimming gaits.
nodes.author: Seung Hyun Kim et al.

nodes.label: SofaGym: Machine Learning Framework for SOFA Simulation
nodes.desc: Open-source framework integrating the SOFA physics engine with OpenAI Gym for reinforcement learning of soft robot locomotion and manipulation tasks.
nodes.author: SOFA Consortium (Defrost Team)

nodes.label: SoftGym: Benchmarking Deep RL for Deformable Object Manipulation
nodes.desc: Benchmark environments built on Nvidia FleX for developing and comparing algorithms for manipulating and locomoting with deformable soft bodies.
nodes.author: Xingyu Lin et al.

nodes.label: Low-Power Microelectronics Embedded in Live Jellyfish Enhance Propulsion
nodes.desc: Science Advances paper demonstrating that embedded micro-electronics can triple jellyfish swimming speed, opening a path for biohybrid soft robots.
nodes.author: Nicole W. Xu & John O. Dabiri

nodes.label: Collective Memory and Spatial Sorting in Animal Groups
nodes.desc: Foundational 2002 Journal of Theoretical Biology paper introducing the Couzin model with repulsion, alignment, and attraction zones that produces schooling and milling.
nodes.author: Iain D. Couzin et al.

nodes.label: Hydrodynamic Schooling of Flapping Swimmers
nodes.desc: Nature Communications paper demonstrating through simulation and experiment that fish in diamond formations gain hydrodynamic energy savings of up to 50%.
nodes.author: Liang Li et al.

nodes.label: From Behavioural Analyses to Models of Collective Motion in Fish Schools
nodes.desc: Interface Focus paper bridging behavioral experiments with mathematical models, showing how fish adjust speed, turning, and spacing to maintain group cohesion.
nodes.author: Daniel S. Calovi et al.

nodes.label: Flocks, Herds, and Schools: A Distributed Behavioral Model
nodes.desc: The landmark 1987 SIGGRAPH paper introducing the Boids algorithm with three simple rules (separation, alignment, cohesion) that produce realistic flocking behavior.
nodes.author: Craig W. Reynolds

nodes.label: A Locally-Blazed Ant Trail Achieves Efficient Collective Navigation
nodes.desc: eLife paper showing how ant colonies achieve efficient navigation through locally-blazed trails despite limited individual information, using pheromone amplification.
nodes.author: Ehud Fonio et al.

nodes.label: Surveying a Swarm: Techniques to Examine Bacterial Collective Motion
nodes.desc: Applied and Environmental Microbiology review of experimental methods for cultivating genuine swarmers and observing collective bacterial motion patterns.
nodes.author: Siobhan A. Brayshaw & Erin S. Gloag

nodes.label: A Phase Diagram for Bacterial Swarming
nodes.desc: Communications Physics paper mapping how bacteria shape and density determine emergent swarming phases, connecting biological swarming to active matter physics.
nodes.author: Iago Grobas et al.

nodes.label: Collective States, Multistability, and Transitional Behavior in Schooling Fish
nodes.desc: PLOS Computational Biology paper showing that fish groups exhibit multistability, with multiple collective states coexisting for identical individual behavior.
nodes.author: Albert B. Kao & Iain D. Couzin

nodes.label: Collective Behavior in Animal Groups: Theoretical Models and Empirical Studies
nodes.desc: Reviews the Vicsek model and extensions, showing how minimal alignment rules in self-propelled particles produce phase transitions to ordered flocking states.
nodes.author: Irene Giardina

nodes.label: Boids: Craig Reynolds' Flocking Simulation
nodes.desc: Clean Python implementation of Craig Reynolds' Boids algorithm for simulating flocking, schooling, and herding behaviors with adjustable interaction parameters.
nodes.author: Ryan Strauss

nodes.label: Schools of Fish and Flocks of Birds: Shape and Internal Structure
nodes.desc: PLOS Computational Biology paper analyzing how self-organized fish schools and bird flocks develop characteristic shapes and density distributions.
nodes.author: Daniel S. Calovi et al.

nodes.label: IBAMR: Adaptive Immersed Boundary Method Framework
nodes.desc: Distributed-memory parallel implementation of the immersed boundary method with AMR, widely used for simulating biological fluid-structure interaction in swimming and flying.

nodes.label: IB2d: Immersed Boundary Method in 2D (MATLAB & Python)

nodes.label: OpenSim: Open-Source Musculoskeletal Modeling and Simulation
nodes.desc: Stanford-developed platform for modeling, simulating, and analyzing the neuromusculoskeletal system with inverse kinematics, forward dynamics, and optimal control.
nodes.author: Scott Delp et al. (SimTK)

nodes.label: Review of CFD in Biomimetic Applications for Underwater Vehicles
nodes.desc: A 2024 Biomimetics review surveying CFD methods applied to bio-inspired underwater vehicle design, covering mesh strategies, turbulence models, and validation.

nodes.label: DeepLabCut: Markerless Pose Estimation for All Animals
nodes.desc: State-of-the-art deep learning toolbox for 2D and 3D markerless pose estimation of any animal, requiring only 50-200 labeled frames for training.

nodes.label: A Primer on Motion Capture with Deep Learning
nodes.desc: Companion guide to DeepLabCut covering principles, pitfalls, and best practices for applying deep learning to animal motion capture in research.

nodes.label: OpenSim Creator: A UI for Building OpenSim Models
nodes.desc: Standalone graphical application for building and editing OpenSim musculoskeletal models without programming, available for Windows, Mac, and Linux.

nodes.label: Awesome Biomechanics: Curated Resource List
nodes.desc: Community-curated list of biomechanics datasets, processing tools, simulation software, educational videos, and lectures for human and animal motion analysis.
nodes.author: Luca Modenese et al.

nodes.label: Awesome Animal Papers: Markerless Animal Motion Capture
nodes.desc: Curated collection of papers and datasets for markerless animal motion capture and 3D reconstruction, organized by species and method.

nodes.label: IBAMR Publications and Benchmark Data
nodes.desc: Publications list with associated benchmark data for immersed boundary simulations of biological fluid dynamics, including cardiac and locomotion problems.

nodes.label: OpenSim Models and Examples Repository
nodes.desc: Central repository hosting hundreds of validated musculoskeletal models, example simulations, and locomotion datasets contributed by the biomechanics community.

nodes.label: SMPL2AddBiomechanics: From 3D Pose to OpenSim Models

nodes.label: Photonics and Lasers: An Introduction

nodes.label: Optical Properties of Biological Tissues and Other Turbid Media

nodes.label: Light and Life: Processes in Photobiology

nodes.label: Biological Photonic Crystals (Interface Focus, 2012)

nodes.label: MIT OpenCourseWare — Optics (8.03SC)

nodes.label: Biophotonics — Coursera (EPFL)

nodes.label: Light: The Invisible Embrace (PBS documentary excerpt)

nodes.label: Structural Colour and Iridescence in Living Organisms

nodes.label: Optical Thin-Film Physics and Coating Design (Lecture)
