nodes.desc: The go-to practical textbook for time-frequency analysis, coherence, and oscillatory connectivity in EEG/MEG data.
nodes.author: Mike X Cohen

nodes.label: Mike X Cohen's Lecture Series on Neural Signal Processing
nodes.desc: YouTube channel with extensive tutorials on Fourier analysis, wavelets, connectivity, and oscillatory dynamics.
nodes.author: Mike X Cohen

nodes.label: FieldTrip Toolbox for MEG/EEG Analysis
nodes.desc: Open-source MATLAB toolbox for advanced analysis of MEG, EEG, and intracranial data including time-frequency and connectivity.
nodes.author: Donders Institute

nodes.label: MNE-Python: MEG + EEG Analysis in Python
nodes.desc: Comprehensive Python package for processing, analyzing, and visualizing neurophysiological data with excellent documentation.
nodes.author: Gramfort et al.

nodes.label: Bayesian integration in sensorimotor learning
nodes.desc: Nature paper demonstrating that humans combine prior knowledge and sensory information in a statistically optimal (Bayesian) way during reaching.
nodes.author: Kording & Wolpert (2004)

nodes.label: Perception as Bayesian Inference
nodes.desc: Influential TICS review arguing that Bayesian inference provides the unifying computational framework for understanding perception.
nodes.author: Knill & Pouget (2004)

nodes.label: Bayesian approaches to brain function
nodes.desc: Edited volume collecting key perspectives on probabilistic computation in neural circuits, decision-making, and motor control.
nodes.author: Doya, Ishii, Pouget & Rao (Eds.)

nodes.label: The Bayesian brain: the role of uncertainty in neural coding and computation
nodes.desc: TINS review on how neural populations might encode probability distributions and perform Bayesian inference.
nodes.author: Knill & Pouget (2004)

nodes.label: Optimal multisensory integration (Ernst & Banks 2002)
nodes.desc: Classic Nature paper showing that humans combine visual and haptic cues in a statistically optimal, reliability-weighted manner.
nodes.author: Ernst & Banks

nodes.label: Humans integrate visual and haptic information in a statistically optimal fashion
nodes.desc: Demonstrates Bayesian cue combination in audio-visual spatial localisation, extending the optimal integration framework.
nodes.author: Alais & Burr (2004)

nodes.label: Causal inference in multisensory perception
nodes.desc: Bayesian causal inference model explaining how the brain decides whether to integrate or segregate multisensory signals.
nodes.author: Kording et al. (2007)

nodes.label: Bayesian Reasoning and Machine Learning
nodes.desc: Free online textbook covering graphical models, inference algorithms, and connections to neural computation.
nodes.author: David Barber

nodes.label: Probabilistic Models of Cognition (probmods.org)
nodes.desc: Interactive online textbook using WebPPL to teach probabilistic models of cognition, from perception to language.
nodes.author: Goodman & Tenenbaum

nodes.label: Stan: Statistical Modeling Platform
nodes.desc: State-of-the-art probabilistic programming framework for Bayesian inference with interfaces to R, Python, and Julia.
nodes.author: Stan Development Team

nodes.label: Bayesian Cognitive Modeling: A Practical Course
nodes.desc: Hands-on textbook teaching Bayesian cognitive modeling with worked examples in JAGS/WinBUGS.
nodes.author: Lee & Wagenmakers

nodes.label: The Embodied Mind: Cognitive Science and Human Experience
nodes.desc: Founding text of enactivism, bridging cognitive science and phenomenology. Argues cognition arises from embodied action.
nodes.author: Varela, Thompson & Rosch

nodes.label: Philosophy in the Flesh
nodes.desc: Argues that abstract thought is fundamentally metaphorical and grounded in bodily experience.
nodes.author: George Lakoff & Mark Johnson

nodes.label: Being There: Putting Brain, Body, and World Together Again
nodes.desc: Clark's influential argument for situated, embodied, and dynamical approaches to cognitive science.
nodes.author: Andy Clark

nodes.label: The Ecological Approach to Visual Perception
nodes.desc: Gibson's masterwork introducing affordances, optic flow, and direct perception. A paradigm-defining text.
nodes.author: James J. Gibson

nodes.label: Supersizing the Mind: Embodiment, Action, and Cognitive Extension
nodes.desc: Extended mind thesis developed in full, arguing tools, language, and social structures are part of the cognitive system.
nodes.author: Andy Clark

nodes.label: The Extended Mind
nodes.desc: The original paper proposing that cognitive processes can extend beyond the biological brain into the environment.
nodes.author: Clark & Chalmers (1998)

nodes.label: Sensorimotor contingencies and perceptual experience
nodes.desc: BBS target article proposing that perception is constituted by practical knowledge of sensorimotor contingencies.
nodes.author: O'Regan & Noe (2001)

nodes.label: How the body shapes the mind
nodes.desc: Systematic philosophical treatment of body schema, body image, and their role in shaping cognitive processes.
nodes.author: Shaun Gallagher

nodes.label: Embodied Cognition (Stanford Encyclopedia)
nodes.desc: Authoritative philosophical overview of the embodied cognition research programme, its varieties, and critiques.
nodes.author: SEP / Robert Wilson & Lucia Foglia

nodes.label: 4E Cognition: Embodied, Embedded, Enacted, Extended
nodes.desc: Collection of lectures covering the four E's of cognition: embodied, embedded, enacted, and extended.
nodes.author: Various lecturers

nodes.label: Radical Embodied Cognitive Science
nodes.desc: Argues for a non-representational, dynamical-systems approach to embodied cognition, drawing on Gibson and phenomenology.
nodes.author: Anthony Chemero

nodes.label: Adaptive Resonance Theory: How a brain learns to consciously attend, learn, and recognize a changing world
nodes.desc: Grossberg's comprehensive review of ART covering its neural architecture, vigilance parameter, and applications to attention and learning.
nodes.author: Stephen Grossberg (2013)

nodes.label: Neural Networks and Natural Intelligence
nodes.desc: Foundational collection of Grossberg's work on ART, competitive learning, and resonant neural dynamics.
nodes.author: Stephen Grossberg

nodes.label: A neural model of attention and memory in the hippocampus (ART + hippocampus)
nodes.desc: Extends ART to hippocampal memory circuits, modelling how resonant matching drives encoding and retrieval.
nodes.author: Grossberg & Versace (2008)

nodes.label: Memory consolidation during sleep: a form of brain restitution
nodes.desc: Major review of how sleep-dependent replay consolidates declarative and procedural memories.
nodes.author: Diekelmann & Born (2010)

nodes.label: Hippocampal sharp-wave ripples and memory replay
nodes.desc: Science review on sharp-wave ripples as the key mechanism for offline memory consolidation and planning.
nodes.author: Buzsaki (2015)

nodes.label: Memory, Amnesia, and the Hippocampal System
nodes.desc: The Multiple Trace Theory proposing that hippocampus is always needed for episodic memory retrieval, not just consolidation.
nodes.author: Nadel & Moscovitch (1997)

nodes.label: Cognitive and Neural Mechanisms of Memory
nodes.desc: Comprehensive textbook covering hippocampal anatomy, relational memory, and systems consolidation.
nodes.author: Howard Eichenbaum

nodes.label: Working memory capacity as controlled attention
nodes.desc: Influential framework linking working memory capacity to executive attention control.
nodes.author: Engle (2002)

nodes.label: Theta-gamma neural code for memory

nodes.author: Lisman & Jensen (2013)

nodes.label: The role of neural oscillations in memory processes
nodes.desc: Review unifying oscillatory correlates of encoding (desynchronisation) and retrieval (synchronisation) in human memory.
nodes.author: Hanslmayr et al. (2016)

nodes.label: Integrated information theory of consciousness: an updated account

nodes.author: Tononi (2012)

nodes.label: Consciousness: Here, There and Everywhere?

nodes.label: Consciousness and the Brain: Deciphering How the Brain Codes Our Thoughts

nodes.label: A Cognitive Theory of Consciousness
nodes.desc: The original formulation of Global Workspace Theory, proposing consciousness as a broadcast mechanism for cognitive access.
nodes.author: Bernard Baars

nodes.label: Consciousness without a cerebral cortex: A challenge for neuroscience and medicine
nodes.desc: Provocative BBS paper arguing that subcortical structures can support basic forms of consciousness.
nodes.author: Bjorn Merker (2007)

nodes.label: The neural correlates of consciousness: an update
nodes.desc: Comprehensive review of NCC research including the distinction between full, content, and background NCC.
nodes.author: Christof Koch et al. (2016)

nodes.label: The Conscious Mind: In Search of a Fundamental Theory
nodes.desc: Chalmers' landmark work introducing the hard problem of consciousness and defending property dualism.
nodes.author: David Chalmers

nodes.label: Being You: A New Science of Consciousness
nodes.desc: Seth's bestselling 2021 book connecting predictive processing to consciousness through the concept of controlled hallucination.
nodes.author: Anil Seth

nodes.label: Consciousness Explained
nodes.desc: Dennett's influential eliminativist-functionalist account of consciousness, rejecting the Cartesian Theatre.
nodes.author: Daniel Dennett

nodes.label: Other Minds: The Octopus, the Sea, and the Deep Origins of Consciousness
nodes.desc: Philosophical exploration of consciousness through cephalopod cognition, asking what it is like to be an octopus.

nodes.label: ACT-R: Adaptive Control of Thought - Rational

nodes.label: Soar Cognitive Architecture

nodes.author: John Laird Lab (Michigan)

nodes.label: Nengo: Neural Engineering Framework
nodes.desc: Python framework implementing the Neural Engineering Framework (NEF) for building large-scale brain models with spiking or rate neurons.

nodes.label: NEST Simulator
nodes.desc: Simulator for spiking neural network models focusing on the dynamics, size, and structure of neural systems.
nodes.author: NEST Initiative

nodes.label: Human Connectome Project (HCP)

nodes.label: OpenNeuro

nodes.label: Allen Brain Atlas
nodes.desc: Comprehensive gene expression atlas, connectivity atlas, and cell-type databases for mouse and human brains.

nodes.label: NeuroVault: Repository of brain statistical maps

nodes.author: Gorgolewski et al.

nodes.label: nilearn: Machine Learning for Neuroimaging in Python
nodes.desc: Python library for statistical learning on neuroimaging data: decoding, connectivity, parcellation, and visualization.

nodes.label: Brian2: Spiking Neural Network Simulator
nodes.desc: Flexible Python simulator for spiking neural networks defined by equations, ideal for computational neuroscience research.

nodes.label: PyMC: Probabilistic Programming in Python

nodes.label: PsychoPy: Psychology Experiment Software
nodes.desc: Free Python-based software for running psychology and neuroscience experiments with precise timing control.

nodes.label: Design with Nature

nodes.author: Ian McHarg

nodes.label: Ecological Design
nodes.desc: A foundational guide that proposes five principles for integrating ecological thinking into design practice, from architecture to agriculture.

nodes.label: Thinking in Systems: A Primer

nodes.author: P.J. Gullan & P.S. Cranston

nodes.label: Encyclopedia of Insects
nodes.desc: A comprehensive reference with 270 chapters by leading specialists covering every major topic in entomology, from anatomy to zoonoses.
nodes.author: Vincent H. Resh & Ring T. Carde (eds.)

nodes.label: For Love of Insects
nodes.desc: A beautifully written memoir and scientific narrative by the father of chemical ecology, revealing decades of discoveries about insect chemical defense.
nodes.author: Thomas Eisner

nodes.label: The Diversity of Insects
nodes.desc: A landmark Science paper examining the extraordinary species richness of phytophagous beetles and the role of plant-insect co-evolution in generating diversity.
nodes.author: Brian D. Farrell

nodes.label: Phylogenomics Resolves the Timing and Pattern of Insect Evolution
nodes.desc: The 1KITE project's landmark phylogenomic analysis of insect evolution using transcriptomes from over 1,400 species, resolving deep divergences.
nodes.author: Bernhard Misof et al.

nodes.label: How Many Species of Insects and Other Terrestrial Arthropods Are There on Earth?
nodes.desc: A comprehensive Annual Review of Entomology article evaluating species richness estimates, concluding approximately 5.5 million insect species exist globally.
nodes.author: Nigel E. Stork

nodes.label: Insects as Food and Feed: A Review
nodes.desc: Reviews the potential of edible insects as a sustainable protein source, covering nutritional value, farming methods, and cultural acceptance worldwide.
nodes.author: Arnold van Huis

nodes.label: Bugs 101: Insect-Human Interactions
nodes.desc: A popular MOOC exploring the diversity of insects and their complex relationships with humans, from pollination to disease transmission.
nodes.author: University of Alberta via Coursera

nodes.label: Introductory Entomology (ENT 425)
nodes.desc: A comprehensive open-access entomology course covering insect anatomy, physiology, ecology, and identification with detailed lecture notes and images.
nodes.author: NC State University

nodes.label: The Insect World (BBC Earth)
nodes.desc: A visually stunning documentary introduction to insect diversity, behavior, and ecological roles narrated with BBC Earth's signature production quality.
nodes.author: BBC Earth

nodes.label: Insect Physiology and Biochemistry
nodes.desc: A comprehensive textbook covering all major physiological systems of insects including respiration, circulation, excretion, endocrinology, and reproduction.
nodes.author: James L. Nation

nodes.label: The Insects: Structure and Function
nodes.desc: The most authoritative reference on insect functional morphology, thoroughly revised in its fifth edition with modern molecular and physiological insights.
nodes.author: R.F. Chapman (ed. S.J. Simpson & A.E. Douglas)

nodes.label: Insect Morphology and Phylogeny
nodes.desc: A detailed treatment of insect morphology in a phylogenetic context, integrating traditional anatomy with modern cladistic analysis.
nodes.author: Rolf G. Beutel, Frank Friedrich & Richard A.B. Leschen

nodes.label: Insect Anatomy and Physiology (ENT 425 Module)
nodes.desc: Open-access illustrated lecture notes covering the external and internal anatomy of insects with labeled diagrams and microscopy images.
nodes.author: NC State University

nodes.label: Insect Metamorphosis: From Natural History to Regulation of Development and Evolution
nodes.desc: A thorough synthesis of metamorphosis research spanning historical observations, hormonal regulation, gene networks, and evolutionary origins.
nodes.author: Xavier Belles

nodes.label: The Mystery of Metamorphosis: A Scientific Detective Story

nodes.label: Hormonal Control of Insect Metamorphosis

nodes.author: Lynn M. Riddiford

nodes.label: The Caterpillar to Butterfly Transformation (Deep Look)
nodes.desc: Award-winning ultra-macro videography documenting the complete metamorphosis of a painted lady butterfly with expert narration.
nodes.author: KQED Deep Look

nodes.label: The Ecology of the Eyes of Insects
nodes.desc: A comprehensive treatment of animal visual systems with extensive coverage of compound eyes, ocelli, and the optical physics behind insect vision.
nodes.author: Michael F. Land & Dan-Eric Nilsson

nodes.label: Insect Hearing and Acoustic Communication
nodes.desc: A multi-author volume covering the diversity of insect auditory systems, from tympanal ears in moths to substrate vibration detection in treehoppers.
nodes.author: Berthold Hedwig (ed.)

nodes.label: Pheromone Communication in Moths
nodes.desc: An in-depth review of moth olfactory systems, pheromone biosynthesis, antennal receptor biology, and the neural processing of chemical signals.
nodes.author: Jeremy D. Allison & Ring T. Carde (eds.)

nodes.label: How Insects See (Veritasium)
nodes.desc: An accessible video exploration of compound eye optics, ultraviolet vision, and how insect visual perception differs fundamentally from vertebrate vision.

nodes.label: Insect Ecology: An Ecosystem Approach
nodes.desc: A leading textbook treating insect ecology through an ecosystem lens, covering population regulation, community interactions, and biogeochemical cycling.
nodes.author: Timothy D. Schowalter

nodes.label: Ecological Entomology
nodes.desc: A comprehensive multi-author reference on the ecological principles governing insect populations, from life table analysis to landscape ecology.
nodes.author: Carl B. Huffaker & Andrew P. Gutierrez (eds.)

nodes.label: Multitrophic Level Interactions
nodes.desc: An authoritative volume examining how interactions cascade across trophic levels, with insects as the central connecting nodes.
nodes.author: Teja Tscharntke & Bradford A. Hawkins (eds.)

nodes.label: Insect Population Ecology (Crash Course)
nodes.desc: An engaging animated introduction to population ecology concepts illustrated with insect examples including r/K selection and carrying capacity.
nodes.author: CrashCourse

nodes.label: Chemical Ecology of Insects
nodes.desc: A foundational multi-author volume on insect semiochemistry covering pheromone biology, host-plant selection, and chemical defense mechanisms.
nodes.author: William J. Bell & Ring T. Carde (eds.)

nodes.label: The Ecology of Plant Secondary Metabolites: From Genes to Global Processes
nodes.desc: Explores how plant chemical defenses shape insect communities and drive co-evolutionary dynamics from molecular to ecosystem scales.

nodes.label: Pheromones and Animal Behavior: Chemical Signals and Signatures
nodes.desc: An accessible and thorough introduction to pheromone biology across the animal kingdom, with extensive insect coverage and evolutionary context.

nodes.label: Chemical Ecology: The Language of Bugs (iBiology)
nodes.desc: A captivating lecture by pioneer chemical ecologist May Berenbaum on how insects use chemistry for communication, defense, and warfare.
nodes.author: May Berenbaum / iBiology

nodes.label: Insect-Symbiont Interactions
nodes.desc: An Annual Review of Entomology article reviewing the molecular mechanisms, ecological consequences, and evolutionary dynamics of insect-microbe symbioses.
nodes.author: Angela E. Douglas

nodes.label: Symbiosis: An Introduction to Biological Associations
nodes.desc: A comprehensive textbook on biological symbiosis with detailed chapters on insect-microbe associations including Buchnera in aphids and Wolbachia.

nodes.label: The Gut Microbiome of Insects: Diversity in Diet and Ecology
nodes.desc: A review examining how diet and ecological niche shape insect gut microbial communities, with implications for pest management and conservation.
nodes.author: Tobin J. Hammer & Noah Fierer

nodes.label: Wolbachia: Master Manipulators of Invertebrate Biology
nodes.desc: A Nature Reviews Microbiology article on the most widespread intracellular symbiont on Earth, exploring its manipulation of insect reproduction and evolution.
nodes.author: John H. Werren, Laura Baldo & Michael E. Clark

nodes.label: The Bees in Your Backyard: A Guide to North America's Bees
nodes.desc: A beautifully illustrated field guide introducing the astonishing diversity of native North American bees beyond the familiar honeybee.
nodes.author: Joseph S. Wilson & Olivia Messinger Carril

nodes.label: The Biology of the Honey Bee
nodes.desc: A classic and comprehensive treatment of honeybee biology covering development, social organization, communication, foraging, and colony reproduction.

nodes.label: The Lives of Bees: The Untold Story of the Honey Bee in the Wild
nodes.desc: Seeley draws on decades of field research to reveal how wild honeybee colonies thrive without human management, offering lessons for sustainable beekeeping.
nodes.author: Thomas D. Seeley

nodes.label: Honeybee Democracy
nodes.desc: An accessible account of collective decision-making in honeybee swarms, demonstrating how decentralized groups can make optimal choices.
nodes.author: Thomas D. Seeley

nodes.label: Plant-Pollinator Interactions: From Specialization to Generalization
nodes.desc: A multi-author volume examining the spectrum from specialized to generalized pollination systems, network topology, and their evolutionary consequences.

nodes.label: The Economics of Ecosystems and Biodiversity (TEEB) for Agriculture: Pollination

nodes.label: The Structure of Plant-Pollinator Interaction Networks

nodes.label: The Hidden Beauty of Pollination (TED Talk)

nodes.label: A World Without Bees
nodes.desc: An accessible investigation into Colony Collapse Disorder, pesticide impacts, and the global implications of declining bee populations.
nodes.author: Alison Benjamin & Brian McCallum

nodes.label: Neonicotinoids in Bees: A Review on Concentrations, Side-Effects, and Risk Assessment
nodes.desc: A widely cited review of neonicotinoid insecticide impacts on bee physiology, behavior, and colony viability at field-realistic exposure levels.

nodes.label: Safeguarding Pollinators and Their Values to Human Well-Being
nodes.desc: A Nature paper synthesizing evidence on pollinator decline and proposing ten policy-relevant strategies for pollinator conservation globally.

nodes.label: Silence of the Bees (PBS Nature Documentary)

nodes.label: Flying Insects and Robots

nodes.label: RoboBee: An Insect-Scale Flying Robot (Harvard Microrobotics Lab)
nodes.desc: A demonstration video of Harvard's RoboBee project, showing a sub-gram flying robot inspired by insect wing mechanics and hovering flight.

nodes.label: DelFly: Design, Aerodynamics, and Artificial Intelligence of a Flapping Wing Robot

nodes.label: Ant Colony Optimization

nodes.label: Swarm Intelligence: From Natural to Artificial Systems

nodes.label: Ant Colony Optimization Explained (Reducible)

nodes.label: Biomimetics of Optical Nanostructures
nodes.desc: A Nature Photonics review of structural coloration in insects (Morpho butterfly wings, jewel beetles) and their translation into photonic materials.

nodes.label: Bio-Inspired Surfaces: Cicada Wing Nanopillar Bactericidal Mechanisms

nodes.label: Insect-Inspired Materials and Surfaces (Nature Masterclass)
nodes.desc: A short documentary on how insect surfaces — from moth-eye antireflection to butterfly wing iridescence — inspire next-generation functional materials.

nodes.label: Integrated Pest Management: Concepts, Tactics, Strategies and Case Studies
nodes.desc: A comprehensive textbook covering IPM principles, tactics, and case studies across major crop systems, with contributions from leading practitioners.

nodes.label: Destructive Insects: The Science of Pest Control (USDA)

nodes.label: RNA Interference for Insect Control: From Research to Application

nodes.label: Insect Apocalypse? Not So Fast (Atlantic)

nodes.label: Insect Conservation: A Handbook of Approaches and Methods

nodes.label: Docker for Data Science: Building Reproducible Computational Environments

nodes.label: Stanford CS 157 — Computational Logic

nodes.label: Logic & Proof (Carnegie Mellon)

nodes.label: Teach Yourself Logic — Study Guide

nodes.label: Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy — Logic

nodes.label: Handbook of Satisfiability

nodes.label: Decision Procedures: An Algorithmic Point of View

nodes.label: SAT Competition Benchmarks
nodes.desc: Annual competition benchmarks for SAT solvers. Excellent source of test instances.

nodes.label: A Mathematical Introduction to Logic (Ch. 2)

nodes.label: UCLA Math 220A–C — Mathematical Logic
nodes.desc: Graduate sequence in mathematical logic covering model theory, set theory, and recursion theory.

nodes.label: Marker — Lecture Notes on Model Theory
nodes.desc: Lecture notes from UIC graduate model theory course. Accessible companion to Marker's textbook.

nodes.label: Logic & Proofs (CMU OLI)
nodes.desc: Interactive online course on propositional and predicate logic with automated proof checking.

nodes.author: Bruno Poizat (trans. Moses Klein)

nodes.label: Finite Model Theory
nodes.desc: Model theory over finite structures: Ehrenfeucht-Fraisse games, 0-1 laws, descriptive complexity.
nodes.author: Heinz-Dieter Ebbinghaus & J\u00F6rg Flum

nodes.label: Elements of Finite Model Theory
nodes.desc: Connects logic to database theory and computational complexity. Pebble games, locality, fixed-point logics.
nodes.author: Leonid Libkin

nodes.label: The Lambda Calculus: Its Syntax and Semantics
nodes.desc: The definitive monograph on untyped lambda calculus: Church-Rosser, Bohm trees, models, lambda definability.
nodes.author: Henk Barendregt

nodes.label: Lambda Calculi with Types
nodes.desc: Barendregt's lambda cube: systematizes typed lambda calculi from simple types through System F to the Calculus of Constructions.
nodes.author: Henk Barendregt

nodes.label: Lectures on the Curry-Howard Isomorphism
nodes.desc: Systematic treatment: untyped and typed lambda calculus, intuitionistic logic, second-order logic, System F.
nodes.author: Morten Heine S\u00F8rensen & Pawel Urzyczyn

nodes.label: An Introduction to Lambda Calculi for Computer Scientists
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction aimed at CS students: reduction strategies, type systems, denotational semantics.
nodes.author: Chris Hankin

nodes.label: Types and Programming Languages (TAPL)
nodes.desc: The standard reference on type systems: untyped lambda calculus, simple types, subtyping, recursive types, polymorphism, System F.
nodes.author: Benjamin C. Pierce

nodes.label: Advanced Topics in Types and Programming Languages (ATTAPL)
nodes.desc: Sequel to TAPL covering dependent types, effect systems, linear types, module systems, and more.
nodes.author: Benjamin C. Pierce (ed.)

nodes.label: Practical Foundations for Programming Languages
nodes.desc: CMU approach to PL theory: statics, dynamics, function types, polymorphism, inductive and coinductive types.
nodes.author: Robert Harper

nodes.label: Lecture Notes on the Lambda Calculus
nodes.desc: Clear, self-contained notes: untyped lambda calculus, Church-Rosser theorem, simply typed calculus, strong normalization.
nodes.author: Peter Selinger

nodes.label: Oregon Programming Languages Summer School (OPLSS)
nodes.desc: Annual summer school with recorded lectures on type theory, lambda calculus, category theory, and PL foundations.
nodes.author: Various lecturers

nodes.label: Philip Wadler — Propositions as Types
nodes.desc: Classic talk explaining the Curry-Howard correspondence between logic and programming.
nodes.author: Philip Wadler

nodes.label: Computerphile — Lambda Calculus
nodes.desc: Accessible video introduction to lambda calculus, beta-reduction, and Church numerals.
nodes.author: Computerphile / Graham Hutton

nodes.label: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs (SICP)
nodes.desc: The legendary MIT textbook. Teaches computation through Scheme: abstraction, higher-order procedures, metalinguistic abstraction, interpreters.
nodes.author: Harold Abelson & Gerald Jay Sussman

nodes.label: The Little Schemer (4th ed.)
nodes.desc: Socratic dialogue teaching recursion, lambda, and computation through Scheme. The classic introduction.
nodes.author: Daniel P. Friedman & Matthias Felleisen

nodes.label: The Seasoned Schemer
nodes.desc: Sequel to The Little Schemer: continuations, set!, letrec, and higher-order thinking.
nodes.author: Daniel P. Friedman & Matthias Felleisen

nodes.label: The Reasoned Schemer (2nd ed.)
nodes.desc: Logic programming in Scheme via miniKanren. Bridges Lisp and formal logic — directly relevant to Charlotte.
nodes.author: Daniel P. Friedman, William E. Byrd & Oleg Kiselyov

nodes.label: Practical Common Lisp
nodes.desc: Modern Common Lisp tutorial. Practical projects: unit testing, binary parsing, spam filter, MP3 database, web server.
nodes.author: Peter Seibel

nodes.label: On Lisp: Advanced Techniques for Common Lisp
nodes.desc: Master class in macros, closures, continuations, and embedded languages. Free PDF available.
nodes.author: Paul Graham

nodes.label: Let Over Lambda
nodes.desc: Deep dive into Common Lisp macros: closures over macros, reader macros, and anaphoric macros.
nodes.author: Doug Hoyte

nodes.label: Paradigms of AI Programming (PAIP)
nodes.desc: AI programming in Common Lisp: search, logic programming, natural language, expert systems. GitHub repo with full code.
nodes.author: Peter Norvig

nodes.label: The Art of the Metaobject Protocol (AMOP)
nodes.desc: CLOS metaobject protocol: introspection, intercessory techniques, reflective OOP in Common Lisp.
nodes.author: Gregor Kiczales, Jim des Rivi\u00E8res & Daniel G. Bobrow

nodes.label: Clojure for the Brave and True
nodes.desc: Fun, accessible introduction to Clojure: functional programming, concurrency, macros on the JVM.
nodes.author: Daniel Higginbotham

nodes.label: How to Design Programs (HtDP)
nodes.desc: Systematic program design using Racket. Design recipes, data-driven programming, testing.
nodes.author: Matthias Felleisen et al.

nodes.label: The Racket Guide
nodes.desc: Official Racket tutorial: language-oriented programming, macros, contracts, modules.
nodes.author: Racket Documentation Team

nodes.label: Lisp in Small Pieces
nodes.desc: Eleven interpreters and two compilers for Lisp/Scheme. Deep understanding of evaluation, compilation, reflection.
nodes.author: Christian Queinnec

nodes.label: Software Foundations
nodes.desc: The gold standard for learning Coq: logic, functional programming, program verification, PLT. Free online.
nodes.author: Benjamin C. Pierce et al.

nodes.label: Certified Programming with Dependent Types (CPDT)
nodes.desc: Advanced Coq techniques: proof automation, dependent types, certified compilers and interpreters.
nodes.author: Adam Chlipala

nodes.label: Theorem Proving in Lean 4
nodes.desc: Official tutorial for Lean 4: dependent type theory, tactics, term-mode proofs, and metaprogramming.
nodes.author: Jeremy Avigad et al.

nodes.label: Mathematics in Lean
nodes.desc: Learn to formalize mathematics in Lean 4 using mathlib. Sets, functions, topology, algebra.
nodes.author: Jeremy Avigad & Patrick Massot

nodes.label: Concrete Semantics (with Isabelle/HOL)
nodes.desc: Programming language semantics formalized in Isabelle/HOL. Free PDF, highly practical.
nodes.author: Tobias Nipkow & Gerwin Klein

nodes.label: Z3 — SMT Solver
nodes.desc: Industry-standard SMT solver. Python, C++, and .NET APIs. Used in program verification, symbolic execution, and testing.
nodes.author: Microsoft Research

nodes.label: Z3 Tutorial (Rise4Fun)
nodes.desc: Interactive tutorial for Z3: propositional logic, arithmetic, bit-vectors, arrays, quantifiers.
nodes.author: Microsoft Research

nodes.label: Vampire — First-Order Theorem Prover
nodes.desc: State-of-the-art superposition-based first-order theorem prover. Multiple CASC competition winner.
nodes.author: Andrei Voronkov et al.

nodes.label: E Theorem Prover
nodes.desc: High-performance equational theorem prover for full first-order logic with equality. Open source.
nodes.author: Stephan Schulz

nodes.label: Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP) Course
nodes.desc: Course materials on interactive theorem proving with Isabelle. Slides, exercises, and recordings.
nodes.author: Jasmin Blanchette (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam)

nodes.label: The QED Manifesto Revisited
nodes.desc: Vision document for formalizing all of mathematics. Context for the proof assistant ecosystem.
nodes.author: Various authors

nodes.label: Handbook of Automated Reasoning
nodes.desc: Comprehensive two-volume reference: resolution, rewriting, decision procedures, higher-order reasoning.
nodes.author: Alan Robinson & Andrei Voronkov (eds.)

nodes.label: SWI-Prolog
nodes.desc: The most widely used open-source Prolog system. Comprehensive libraries, constraint solving, web frameworks.
nodes.author: Jan Wielemaker et al.

nodes.label: miniKanren
nodes.desc: Minimalist relational programming language embeddable in Scheme, Python, Clojure. Core of The Reasoned Schemer.
nodes.author: William E. Byrd et al.

nodes.label: Learn Prolog Now!
nodes.desc: Free online textbook: unification, proof search, lists, definite clause grammars, cuts.
nodes.author: Patrick Blackburn, Johan Bos & Kristina Striegnitz

nodes.label: The Art of Prolog
nodes.desc: Classic text on logic programming: database programming, meta-interpreters, search strategies, constraint logic.
nodes.author: Leon Sterling & Ehud Shapiro

nodes.label: TPTP Problem Library
nodes.desc: Thousands of first-order and higher-order logic problems. Standard benchmark for automated theorem provers.
nodes.author: Geoff Sutcliffe

nodes.label: SMT-LIB — Standard for SMT Solvers
nodes.desc: Standard language and benchmark library for SMT solvers. Logics, benchmarks, and solver interface specification.
nodes.author: Clark Barrett et al.

nodes.label: CASC — CADE ATP System Competition
nodes.desc: Annual competition for automated theorem provers. Results, problem sets, system descriptions.
nodes.author: Geoff Sutcliffe

nodes.label: Metamath
nodes.desc: Formal proof database with over 40,000 verified proofs. Minimal logical foundation, community-maintained.
nodes.author: Norman Megill

nodes.label: CaDiCaL SAT Solver
nodes.desc: Award-winning CDCL SAT solver by a leading SAT researcher. Clean C++ codebase, excellent for learning modern SAT.
nodes.author: Armin Biere

nodes.label: CVC5 SMT Solver
nodes.desc: Open-source SMT solver supporting many theories: arithmetic, strings, datatypes, sets, sequences.
nodes.author: Stanford / Iowa / NYU

nodes.label: Alloy Analyzer
nodes.desc: Lightweight formal modeling tool using relational logic. Automatic analysis of structural models via SAT.
nodes.author: Daniel Jackson (MIT)

nodes.label: Logisim Evolution
nodes.desc: Digital logic circuit simulator. Great for visualizing Boolean logic, gates, and truth tables.
nodes.author: logisim-evolution contributors

nodes.label: Theory of Games and Economic Behavior
nodes.desc: The founding text of game theory. Establishes the mathematical framework for strategic interaction, minimax theorem, and expected utility theory.
nodes.author: John von Neumann & Oskar Morgenstern

nodes.label: Non-Cooperative Games (PhD Thesis)
nodes.desc: The 27-page thesis that introduced the Nash equilibrium. One of the most influential documents in 20th-century mathematics.
nodes.author: John Nash

nodes.label: The Strategy of Conflict
nodes.desc: Nobel laureate Schelling on focal points, credible commitments, and the strategy of deterrence. Readable and profound.
nodes.author: Thomas C. Schelling

nodes.label: A Course in Game Theory
nodes.desc: Rigorous graduate-level treatment. Covers strategic, extensive, coalitional, and Bayesian games. Free PDF from authors' website.
nodes.author: Martin J. Osborne & Ariel Rubinstein

nodes.label: Game Theory
nodes.desc: The comprehensive graduate reference. Extensive form, repeated games, incomplete information, equilibrium refinements.
nodes.author: Drew Fudenberg & Jean Tirole

nodes.label: An Introduction to Game Theory
nodes.desc: Best undergraduate textbook. Clear exposition, good exercises. Covers all the essentials without excessive formalism.
nodes.author: Martin J. Osborne

nodes.label: Game Theory: Analysis of Conflict
nodes.desc: By the Nobel laureate who extended Nash's work. Deep treatment of Bayesian games, mechanism design, and incentive theory.
nodes.author: Roger B. Myerson

nodes.label: Strategy: An Introduction to Game Theory
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction emphasizing contract and institutional design. Excellent for first exposure.
nodes.author: Joel Watson

nodes.label: Playing for Real: A Text on Game Theory
nodes.desc: Comprehensive and opinionated. Binmore brings philosophical depth alongside mathematical rigor.
nodes.author: Ken Binmore

nodes.label: Game Theory: An Introduction
nodes.desc: Modern graduate text balancing rigor and intuition. Strong on information economics and mechanism design.
nodes.author: Steven Tadelis

nodes.label: Game Theory 101: The Complete Textbook
nodes.desc: Companion to the popular YouTube series. Step-by-step solutions to standard game theory problems.
nodes.author: William Spaniel

nodes.label: Game Theory (Yale Open Courses)
nodes.desc: Outstanding introductory course. 24 lectures covering dominance, Nash equilibrium, mixed strategies, auctions, and evolution. Freely available.
nodes.author: Ben Polak

nodes.label: Game Theory (Stanford/UBC via Coursera)
nodes.desc: Two-part Coursera specialization. Part I covers fundamentals; Part II covers mechanism design and advanced topics.
nodes.author: Matthew O. Jackson, Kevin Leyton-Brown & Yoav Shoham

nodes.label: Game Theory 101
nodes.desc: Excellent YouTube series. Short, clear videos covering Nash equilibrium, extensive form games, Bayesian games, and more.
nodes.author: William Spaniel

nodes.label: Game Theory (MIT 14.12)
nodes.desc: MIT's economic applications of game theory. Lecture notes, problem sets, and exams freely available.
nodes.author: MIT OpenCourseWare

nodes.label: Algorithmic Game Theory (Stanford CS364A)
nodes.desc: Legendary Stanford course. Mechanism design, auction theory, price of anarchy, equilibrium computation.
nodes.author: Tim Roughgarden

nodes.label: Thinking Strategically
nodes.desc: The classic popular introduction. Real-world strategic situations analyzed with game-theoretic reasoning. No math required.
nodes.author: Avinash Dixit & Barry Nalebuff

nodes.label: The Art of Strategy
nodes.desc: Updated and expanded version of Thinking Strategically. Covers bargaining, brinkmanship, voting, and more.
nodes.author: Avinash Dixit & Barry Nalebuff

nodes.label: Rock, Paper, Scissors: Game Theory in Everyday Life
nodes.desc: Entertaining introduction connecting game theory to everyday dilemmas, from traffic to relationships.
nodes.author: Len Fisher

nodes.label: Prisoner's Dilemma
nodes.desc: History of game theory intertwined with the story of the Cold War, RAND Corporation, and John von Neumann.
nodes.author: William Poundstone

nodes.label: A Value for n-Person Games
nodes.desc: The paper that introduced the Shapley value. Elegant axiomatic derivation of the unique fair division rule.
nodes.author: Lloyd Shapley

nodes.label: The Bargaining Problem
nodes.desc: Nash's axiomatic approach to bilateral bargaining. Established the Nash bargaining solution.
nodes.author: John Nash

nodes.label: Cores of Convex Games
nodes.desc: Proves that convex games always have non-empty cores. Foundational result for cooperative game theory.
nodes.author: Lloyd Shapley

nodes.label: Game Theory (Cooperative Chapter)
nodes.desc: Chapters 13-15 provide a rigorous introduction to coalitional games, the core, and the Shapley value.
nodes.author: Osborne & Rubinstein

nodes.label: Cooperative Game Theory and Applications
nodes.desc: Comprehensive treatment of cooperative models with applications to operations research and cost allocation.
nodes.author: Imma Curiel

nodes.label: Fair Division and Collective Welfare
nodes.desc: Axiomatic approach to fair division, cost sharing, and surplus sharing. Bridges cooperative game theory and social choice.
nodes.author: Herve Moulin

nodes.label: Bargaining and Markets
nodes.desc: Alternating-offers bargaining model that became the standard framework. Free PDF available from authors.
nodes.author: Martin J. Osborne & Ariel Rubinstein

nodes.label: Cooperative Game Theory (Shapley Value Explained)
nodes.desc: Clear visual explanation of the Shapley value with worked examples.
nodes.author: William Spaniel

nodes.label: Game Theory II: Advanced Applications (Coursera)
nodes.desc: Covers cooperative game theory, the core, Shapley value, and stable matchings.
nodes.author: Jackson, Leyton-Brown & Shoham

nodes.label: Evolution and the Theory of Games
nodes.desc: The founding text. Introduced ESS to biology. Changed how we understand animal conflict, signaling, and cooperation.
nodes.author: John Maynard Smith

nodes.label: The Evolution of Cooperation
nodes.desc: Classic account of the iterated Prisoner's Dilemma tournaments. Tit-for-Tat and the emergence of cooperation among egoists.
nodes.author: Robert Axelrod

nodes.label: The Logic of Animal Conflict
nodes.desc: The original Nature paper that launched evolutionary game theory. Introduced the Hawk-Dove game and ESS concept.
nodes.author: John Maynard Smith & George Price

nodes.label: Evolutionary Dynamics: Exploring the Equations of Life
nodes.desc: Beautiful modern treatment. Covers replicator dynamics, spatial games, evolutionary graph theory, and the evolution of cooperation.
nodes.author: Martin A. Nowak

nodes.label: Population Games and Evolutionary Dynamics
nodes.desc: Definitive mathematical treatment. Revision protocols, deterministic dynamics, stochastic evolution.
nodes.author: William H. Sandholm

nodes.label: Evolutionary Game Theory
nodes.desc: Rigorous but accessible. Connects evolutionary stability to classical equilibrium concepts.
nodes.author: Jorgen Weibull

nodes.label: Game Theory and the Social Contract (2 vols)
nodes.desc: Ambitious application of evolutionary game theory to moral philosophy and social institutions.
nodes.author: Ken Binmore

nodes.label: The Calculus of Selfishness
nodes.desc: Elegant treatment of indirect reciprocity, reputation, and the evolution of social norms.
nodes.author: Karl Sigmund

nodes.label: Evolutionary Game Theory (Yale, Lectures 10-13)
nodes.desc: Four lectures on evolutionary stability and replicator dynamics within the broader game theory course.
nodes.author: Ben Polak

nodes.label: Evolution of Cooperation (Primer)
nodes.desc: Beautifully animated exploration of the evolution of cooperation. Interactive simulations available on the channel.
nodes.author: Primer

nodes.label: Evolutionary Game Theory and Agents
nodes.desc: Santa Fe Institute courses on evolutionary dynamics, complex adaptive systems, and agent-based modeling.
nodes.author: Santa Fe Institute (Complexity Explorer)

nodes.label: Counterspeculation, Auctions, and Competitive Sealed Tenders
nodes.desc: Introduced the second-price sealed-bid auction (Vickrey auction) and revenue equivalence. Nobel Prize-winning work.
nodes.author: William Vickrey

nodes.label: Optimal Auction Design
nodes.desc: Characterizes the revenue-maximizing auction. One of the most cited papers in economics.
nodes.author: Roger Myerson

nodes.label: College Admissions and the Stability of Marriage
nodes.desc: Introduced the deferred acceptance algorithm and stable matching. Foundation of modern market design.
nodes.author: David Gale & Lloyd Shapley

nodes.label: Auction Theory
nodes.desc: The definitive graduate text on auction theory. Single-item, multi-item, combinatorial, and optimal auctions.
nodes.author: Vijay Krishna

nodes.label: An Introduction to the Theory of Mechanism Design
nodes.desc: Clear, modern introduction. Covers social choice, VCG, optimal mechanisms, and implementation theory.
nodes.author: Tilman Borgers

nodes.label: Putting Auction Theory to Work
nodes.desc: Practical auction design by the architect of the FCC spectrum auctions. Theory meets real-world implementation.
nodes.author: Paul Milgrom

nodes.label: Who Gets What — and Why
nodes.desc: Nobel laureate Roth on matching markets: kidney exchange, school choice, job markets. No math required.
nodes.author: Alvin Roth

nodes.label: Discovering Prices: Auction Design in Markets with Complex Constraints
nodes.desc: The story of the incentive auction for TV broadcast spectrum. Combinatorial auctions in practice.
nodes.author: Paul Milgrom

nodes.label: Twenty Lectures on Algorithmic Game Theory
nodes.desc: Chapters on mechanism design, VCG, optimal auctions, and Myerson's lemma. Based on the Stanford course.
nodes.author: Tim Roughgarden

nodes.label: Mechanism Design (Coursera — Game Theory II)
nodes.desc: Weeks 2-3 cover mechanism design fundamentals, VCG, and combinatorial auctions.
nodes.author: Jackson, Leyton-Brown & Shoham

nodes.label: Auction Theory (William Spaniel)
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction to first-price, second-price, English, and Dutch auctions with clear examples.
nodes.author: William Spaniel

nodes.label: Algorithmic Game Theory
nodes.desc: THE reference book. 25 chapters by leading researchers. Covers equilibrium computation, mechanism design, auctions, networks, and more.
nodes.author: Nisan, Roughgarden, Tardos & Vazirani (eds.)

nodes.label: Twenty Lectures on Algorithmic Game Theory
nodes.desc: Distilled from the Stanford course. Self-contained, beautifully written. Covers mechanism design, price of anarchy, equilibrium computation.
nodes.author: Tim Roughgarden

nodes.label: Multiagent Systems: Algorithmic, Game-Theoretic, and Logical Foundations
nodes.desc: Comprehensive text bridging AI and game theory. Free PDF. Covers distributed optimization, social choice, and computational aspects.
nodes.author: Yoav Shoham & Kevin Leyton-Brown

nodes.label: The Complexity of Computing a Nash Equilibrium
nodes.desc: Proved that computing Nash equilibria is PPAD-complete. Resolved a major open question about equilibrium computation.
nodes.author: Daskalakis, Goldberg & Papadimitriou

nodes.label: How Bad is Selfish Routing?
nodes.desc: Introduced the price of anarchy framework. Shows selfish routing can be 4/3 worse than optimal in linear latency networks.
nodes.author: Tim Roughgarden & Eva Tardos

nodes.label: Algorithmic Mechanism Design
nodes.desc: Foundational paper connecting mechanism design with computational complexity. Launched the field.
nodes.author: Noam Nisan & Amir Ronen

nodes.label: Truthful Auctions for Pricing Search Keywords
nodes.desc: Early analysis of sponsored search auctions (the business model of Google). Theory meets internet economics.
nodes.author: Aggarwal, Goel & Motwani

nodes.label: Algorithmic Game Theory (CS364A)
nodes.desc: 20 lectures. Mechanism design, sponsored search, VCG, price of anarchy, equilibrium computation. The gold standard.
nodes.author: Tim Roughgarden (Stanford)

nodes.label: Advanced Mechanism Design (CS364B)
nodes.desc: Sequel course. Multi-parameter mechanism design, combinatorial auctions, optimal mechanism design.
nodes.author: Tim Roughgarden (Stanford)

nodes.label: Algorithmic Game Theory (Cornell)
nodes.desc: Cornell graduate course on AGT. Lecture notes and readings from one of the field's founders.
nodes.author: Eva Tardos

nodes.label: Behavioral Game Theory: Experiments in Strategic Interaction
nodes.desc: THE reference. Covers decades of experimental evidence on how people actually play games. Essential reading.
nodes.author: Colin Camerer

nodes.label: Thinking, Fast and Slow
nodes.desc: Nobel laureate Kahneman on dual-process theory, heuristics, biases, and prospect theory. Not game theory per se, but foundational for behavioral approaches.
nodes.author: Daniel Kahneman

nodes.label: Prospect Theory: An Analysis of Decision under Risk
nodes.desc: The most cited paper in economics. Introduced prospect theory: loss aversion, probability weighting, reference dependence.
nodes.author: Daniel Kahneman & Amos Tversky

nodes.label: A Theory of Fairness, Competition, and Cooperation
nodes.desc: Influential model of inequity aversion. Explains experimental anomalies in ultimatum, public goods, and market games.
nodes.author: Ernst Fehr & Klaus Schmidt

nodes.label: The Handbook of Experimental Economics
nodes.desc: Comprehensive reference on experimental methods in economics. Bargaining, auctions, public goods, coordination games.
nodes.author: John Kagel & Alvin Roth (eds.)

nodes.label: Strategy and Choice
nodes.desc: Collection bridging theory and behavioral evidence. Essays by Schelling, Raiffa, and others.
nodes.author: Richard Zeckhauser (ed.)

nodes.label: Predictably Irrational
nodes.desc: Accessible and entertaining. Shows systematic irrationalities in decision-making through clever experiments.
nodes.author: Dan Ariely

nodes.label: Behavioral Economics (MIT 14.13)
nodes.desc: MIT course covering reference dependence, social preferences, time inconsistency, and behavioral policy.
nodes.author: MIT OpenCourseWare

nodes.label: Crash Course Economics: Game Theory
nodes.desc: Quick, entertaining overview of game theory concepts including Prisoner's Dilemma and Nash equilibrium.
nodes.author: Crash Course

nodes.label: Networks, Crowds, and Markets
nodes.desc: Brilliant undergraduate text connecting graph theory, game theory, and network economics. Free pre-print online.
nodes.author: David Easley & Jon Kleinberg

nodes.label: Social and Economic Networks
nodes.desc: Comprehensive treatment of network formation, diffusion, learning, and strategic interaction on networks.
nodes.author: Matthew O. Jackson

nodes.label: The Oxford Handbook of the Economics of Networks
nodes.desc: Authoritative survey of network economics. Chapters on games on networks, peer effects, network formation.
nodes.author: Bramoulle, Galeotti & Rogers (eds.)

nodes.label: Lessons in Play: An Introduction to Combinatorial Game Theory
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction to combinatorial game theory. Nim values, Sprague-Grundy theory, surreal numbers.
nodes.author: Albert, Nowakowski & Wolfe

nodes.label: Winning Ways for your Mathematical Plays (4 vols)
nodes.desc: The magnum opus of combinatorial game theory. Encyclopedic, playful, and deep. A mathematical classic.
nodes.author: Berlekamp, Conway & Guy

nodes.label: Congestion Games with Player-Specific Payoff Functions
nodes.desc: Extends Rosenthal's congestion game framework. Existence of equilibria in games with heterogeneous players on networks.
nodes.author: Igal Milchtaich

nodes.label: A Strategic Model of Social and Economic Networks
nodes.desc: Foundational model of strategic network formation. Pairwise stability and efficiency in network structures.
nodes.author: Matthew O. Jackson & Asher Wolinsky

nodes.label: Maximizing the Spread of Influence through a Social Network
nodes.desc: Foundational paper on influence maximization in networks. NP-hard but admits a greedy (1-1/e) approximation.
nodes.author: Kempe, Kleinberg & Tardos

nodes.label: Social and Economic Networks (Coursera)
nodes.desc: Accessible course on network analysis, models, and strategic behavior on networks by the leading researcher.
nodes.author: Matthew O. Jackson

nodes.label: Networks (Playlist)
nodes.desc: Beautifully animated explanations of graph algorithms and network concepts relevant to game theory on networks.
nodes.author: Reducible

nodes.label: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning: Foundations and Modern Approaches
nodes.desc: Comprehensive modern textbook on MARL. Free online. Covers cooperative, competitive, and mixed settings.
nodes.author: Albrecht, Christianos & Schafer

nodes.label: Mastering the Game of Go without Human Knowledge
nodes.desc: AlphaGo Zero: learning superhuman Go entirely through self-play. Game theory meets deep reinforcement learning.
nodes.author: Silver et al. (DeepMind)

nodes.label: OpenAI Five
nodes.desc: Dota 2 at professional level through multi-agent self-play. Demonstrates emergent team coordination in complex games.
nodes.author: OpenAI

nodes.label: Emergent Complexity via Multi-Agent Competition
nodes.desc: Shows that competitive self-play in simple environments produces increasingly complex behaviors — an arms race dynamic.
nodes.author: Bansal et al.

nodes.label: A Unified Game-Theoretic Approach to Multiagent Reinforcement Learning
nodes.desc: Connects MARL to game-theoretic solution concepts. Policy-Space Response Oracles (PSRO) framework.
nodes.author: Lanctot et al. (DeepMind)

nodes.label: A Unified Approach to Interpreting Model Predictions
nodes.desc: Introduced SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations). Connects Shapley values from cooperative game theory to ML interpretability.
nodes.author: Scott Lundberg & Su-In Lee

nodes.label: From Local Explanations to Global Understanding with Explainable AI for Trees
nodes.desc: TreeSHAP: efficient exact Shapley value computation for tree-based models. Made SHAP practical at scale.
nodes.author: Lundberg et al.

nodes.label: SHAP Documentation
nodes.desc: The SHAP Python library. Tutorials, API docs, and examples for computing Shapley-value-based feature attributions.
nodes.author: Scott Lundberg

nodes.label: Who Gets What — and Why
nodes.desc: Nobel laureate on real-world market design: kidney exchange, school choice, labor markets. Accessible and compelling.
nodes.author: Alvin Roth

nodes.label: Social Choice and Individual Values
nodes.desc: Arrow's impossibility theorem: no voting system can satisfy all fairness axioms simultaneously. A pillar of social choice theory.
nodes.author: Kenneth Arrow

nodes.label: The Design of Everyday Markets
nodes.desc: Stanford online course on market design principles applied to matching, auctions, and allocation problems.
nodes.author: Stanford Online

nodes.label: Evolutionary Game Theory and Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
nodes.desc: Bridge paper connecting evolutionary game dynamics to multi-agent learning algorithms.
nodes.author: Karl Tuyls & Ann Nowe

nodes.label: SuperCooperators: Altruism, Evolution, and Why We Need Each Other
nodes.desc: Popular science book on the five mechanisms for the evolution of cooperation. By the leading mathematical biologist.
nodes.author: Martin Nowak & Roger Highfield

nodes.label: Gambit: Software Tools for Game Theory
nodes.desc: The standard open-source library for building, analyzing, and computing equilibria in finite games. Python and C++.
nodes.author: McKelvey, McLennan & Turocy

nodes.label: Nashpy
nodes.desc: Lightweight Python library for computing Nash equilibria of two-player games. Clean API, good documentation.
nodes.author: Vincent Knight et al.

nodes.label: Lemke-Howson Algorithm Visualizer
nodes.desc: Implementation and visualization of the Lemke-Howson algorithm for computing Nash equilibria via complementary pivoting.
nodes.author: Various

nodes.label: OpenSpiel
nodes.desc: Collection of games, algorithms, and tools for game-theoretic research. CFR, MCTS, PSRO, and more. Python/C++.
nodes.author: DeepMind

nodes.label: PettingZoo
nodes.desc: Multi-agent reinforcement learning environments. Standard API for cooperative and competitive games.
nodes.author: Farama Foundation

nodes.label: RLlib Multi-Agent
nodes.desc: Scalable multi-agent RL within the Ray framework. Supports shared/independent policies, parameter sharing.
nodes.author: Ray/Anyscale

nodes.label: Axelrod Python Library
nodes.desc: Framework for iterated Prisoner's Dilemma tournaments. 200+ strategies implemented. Reproduce and extend Axelrod's classic tournaments.
nodes.author: Axelrod-Python

nodes.label: Mesa: Agent-Based Modeling in Python
nodes.desc: General-purpose agent-based modeling framework. Build simulations of strategic interaction in spatial and network environments.
nodes.author: Project Mesa

nodes.label: Game Theory Explorer
nodes.desc: Web-based tool for creating and solving extensive form games. Visual game tree builder with equilibrium computation.
nodes.author: Rahul Savani et al.

nodes.label: QuantEcon
nodes.desc: Open-source code for quantitative economics. Game theory modules in Python and Julia. Lectures and notebooks.
nodes.author: Thomas Sargent & John Stachurski

nodes.label: SHAP
nodes.desc: SHapley Additive exPlanations library. Computes Shapley values for ML model interpretability. The most-used XAI library.
nodes.author: Scott Lundberg

nodes.label: Graph Theory (Diestel) — Free Online Edition
nodes.desc: The standard graduate textbook on graph theory, available free online. Covers all foundational topics rigorously from connectivity to minors.
nodes.author: Reinhard Diestel

nodes.label: Introduction to Graph Theory — Sarada Herke YouTube Series
nodes.desc: Gentle and highly visual introduction to graph theory fundamentals. Over 50 short lectures covering vertices, edges, trees, Euler paths, and more.
nodes.author: Sarada Herke

nodes.label: Knowledge Graphs — Comprehensive Survey
nodes.desc: The definitive survey paper on knowledge graphs covering data models, creation, enrichment, quality, and applications. Essential reading.
nodes.author: Aidan Hogan et al.

nodes.label: MIT 18.217: Graph Theory and Additive Combinatorics
nodes.desc: Advanced MIT course connecting graph theory with additive combinatorics. Covers extremal graph theory, Szemeredi regularity lemma, and graph limits.
nodes.author: Yufei Zhao (MIT OCW)

nodes.label: Neo4j Graph Database — Getting Started
nodes.desc: Official getting-started guide for Neo4j, the most widely adopted graph database. Learn Cypher queries and property graph modeling from scratch.
nodes.author: Neo4j Inc.

nodes.label: NetworkX: Python Graph Library
nodes.desc: The standard Python library for creating, manipulating, and studying complex networks. Includes generators, algorithms, and visualization utilities.
nodes.author: Aric Hagberg et al.

nodes.label: W3C RDF 1.1 Primer
nodes.desc: Official W3C primer for the Resource Description Framework. The foundational standard for representing knowledge as subject-predicate-object triples.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: Temporal Network Theory — Holme & Saramaki
nodes.desc: Foundational survey of temporal networks — graphs where edges carry time information. Covers models, metrics, and spreading processes on temporal structures.
nodes.author: Petter Holme, Jari Saramaki

nodes.label: Stanford SNAP: Large Network Dataset Collection
nodes.desc: Massive collection of real-world network datasets for research: social networks, web graphs, road networks, citation networks, and more.
nodes.author: Jure Leskovec (Stanford)

nodes.label: Graph Theory (5th Edition)
nodes.desc: The standard graduate text. Covers connectivity, matching, planarity, coloring, flows, extremal problems, and infinite graphs. Free online edition available.
nodes.author: Reinhard Diestel

nodes.label: Introduction to Graph Theory (2nd Edition)
nodes.desc: Comprehensive undergraduate/graduate textbook with extensive exercises. Covers matchings, connectivity, coloring, planar graphs, and Ramsey theory.
nodes.author: Douglas B. West

nodes.label: Graph Theory with Applications
nodes.desc: Classic textbook covering graph theory from basics through advanced topics. Known for elegant proofs and thorough treatment of extremal graph theory.
nodes.author: J.A. Bondy, U.S.R. Murty

nodes.label: A First Course in Graph Theory
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction to graph theory for undergraduates. Covers fundamentals with clear exposition, many examples, and exercises at varying difficulty levels.
nodes.author: Gary Chartrand, Ping Zhang

nodes.label: Graph Theory and Its Applications (3rd Edition)
nodes.desc: Applied perspective on graph theory covering algorithms, network flows, and combinatorial optimization alongside pure theory.
nodes.author: Jonathan L. Gross, Jay Yellen, Mark Anderson

nodes.label: Graph Theory — Sarada Herke Full Course
nodes.desc: Comprehensive YouTube playlist covering graph theory from scratch: definitions, trees, Euler circuits, Hamiltonian paths, coloring, planarity, and matchings.
nodes.author: Sarada Herke

nodes.label: MIT 18.217: Graph Theory and Additive Combinatorics
nodes.desc: Advanced MIT course. Topics include extremal graph theory, Szemeredi regularity lemma, pseudorandomness, and graph limits (graphons).
nodes.author: Yufei Zhao

nodes.label: MIT 18.212: Algebraic Combinatorics
nodes.desc: MIT course covering algebraic methods in combinatorics including graph eigenvalues, chromatic polynomials, and matroid theory.
nodes.author: Alexander Postnikov

nodes.label: Essence of Linear Algebra (Graph Eigenvalues Context)
nodes.desc: While focused on linear algebra, this series provides essential visual intuition for spectral graph theory — understanding graphs through their eigenvalues.
nodes.author: 3Blue1Brown (Grant Sanderson)

nodes.label: Graph Theory (Coursera / UC San Diego)
nodes.desc: Part of the Data Structures and Algorithms specialization. Covers BFS, DFS, strongly connected components, and shortest paths with hands-on programming assignments.
nodes.author: Alexander S. Kulikov, Michael Levin

nodes.label: D3 Graph Theory — Interactive Tutorials
nodes.desc: Beautiful interactive tutorials teaching graph theory concepts through D3.js visualizations. Covers vertices, edges, walks, paths, connectivity, and trees.
nodes.author: Avinash Pandey

nodes.label: VisuAlgo — Graph Visualizations
nodes.desc: Interactive visualization platform for graph data structures and algorithms. Step through BFS, DFS, shortest path, MST, and more with animated execution.
nodes.author: Steven Halim

nodes.label: Spectral Graph Theory (Spielman Lecture Notes)
nodes.desc: Yale lecture notes on spectral graph theory covering Laplacian matrices, Cheeger inequality, expander graphs, and spectral sparsification.
nodes.author: Daniel A. Spielman

nodes.label: Knowledge Graphs (Synthesis Lectures)
nodes.desc: The definitive comprehensive survey covering knowledge graph data models, creation, enrichment, quality assessment, refinement, and applications. 170+ pages.
nodes.author: Aidan Hogan, Eva Blomqvist, Michael Cochez et al.

nodes.label: Foundations of Semantic Web Technologies
nodes.desc: Textbook covering RDF, RDFS, OWL, SPARQL, and semantic web reasoning. Provides solid theoretical foundations for building knowledge graphs.
nodes.author: Pascal Hitzler, Markus Krotzsch, Sebastian Rudolph

nodes.label: Exploiting Linked Data and Knowledge Graphs in Large Organisations
nodes.desc: Practical guide on deploying knowledge graph technologies in enterprise settings. Covers integration, querying, and real-world case studies.
nodes.author: Jeff Z. Pan et al.

nodes.label: A Review of Relational Machine Learning for Knowledge Graphs
nodes.desc: Influential survey on statistical relational learning methods for knowledge graphs including tensor factorization and neural embedding approaches.
nodes.author: Maximilian Nickel, Kevin Murphy, Volker Tresp, Evgeniy Gabrilovich

nodes.label: W3C RDF 1.1 Primer
nodes.desc: Official W3C introduction to RDF. Explains triples, graphs, serialization formats (Turtle, JSON-LD, N-Triples), and the RDF data model.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: SPARQL 1.1 Query Language Specification
nodes.desc: The complete W3C specification for SPARQL, the standard query language for RDF data. Covers SELECT, CONSTRUCT, ASK, DESCRIBE, and federation.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: Schema.org — Vocabulary for Structured Data
nodes.desc: Collaborative vocabulary supported by Google, Microsoft, Yahoo, and Yandex for marking up web content with structured data understood by search engines.
nodes.author: Schema.org Community

nodes.label: JSON-LD 1.1 Specification
nodes.desc: W3C standard for serializing linked data in JSON format. The bridge between developer-friendly JSON and the semantic web's RDF model.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: Wikidata — Free Knowledge Base
nodes.desc: The largest open knowledge graph with 100M+ items. Structured data backbone for Wikipedia. Queryable via SPARQL endpoint, excellent for learning and experimentation.
nodes.author: Wikimedia Foundation

nodes.label: Apache Jena — RDF Framework for Java
nodes.desc: Open-source Java framework for building semantic web and linked data applications. Includes TDB triple store, Fuseki SPARQL server, and OWL reasoner.
nodes.author: Apache Software Foundation

nodes.label: rdflib — Python RDF Library
nodes.desc: Pure Python library for working with RDF. Parse, serialize, and query RDF data. Supports SPARQL, Turtle, JSON-LD, and N-Triples formats.
nodes.author: RDFLib Team

nodes.label: Google Knowledge Graph Search API
nodes.desc: API for searching Google's Knowledge Graph, which contains billions of facts about people, places, and things. Useful for entity resolution and enrichment.
nodes.author: Google

nodes.label: Temporal Networks
nodes.desc: The foundational survey on temporal networks. Covers representations, metrics (temporal distance, reachability), burstiness, and processes on temporal structures.
nodes.author: Petter Holme, Jari Saramaki

nodes.label: Temporal Network Theory (Book)
nodes.desc: Comprehensive edited volume on temporal network theory covering mathematical foundations, analysis methods, generative models, and applications across disciplines.
nodes.author: Petter Holme, Jari Saramaki (Editors)

nodes.label: Stream Graphs and Link Streams for the Modeling of Interactions over Time
nodes.desc: Introduces the stream graph formalism as a unified framework for temporal networks, extending classical graph concepts (density, clustering, paths) to the temporal setting.
nodes.author: Matthieu Latapy, Tiphaine Viard, Clemence Magnien

nodes.label: An Introduction to Temporal Graphs: An Algorithmic Perspective
nodes.desc: Algorithmic perspective on temporal graphs covering temporal connectivity, exploration problems, and computational complexity of temporal graph problems.
nodes.author: Othon Michail

nodes.label: Computing with Temporal Graphs
nodes.desc: Foundational framework for classifying temporal graphs based on their properties: edge recurrence, connectivity over time, and the computability hierarchy.
nodes.author: Arnaud Casteigts, Paola Flocchini, Walter Quattrociocchi, Nicola Santoro

nodes.label: Apache Kafka — Event Streaming Platform
nodes.desc: Distributed event streaming platform used to build real-time streaming data pipelines and applications. Essential infrastructure for streaming graph processing.
nodes.author: Apache Software Foundation

nodes.label: Raphtory — Temporal Graph Analytics
nodes.desc: Open-source temporal graph analytics engine. Query and analyze graph data that changes over time. Supports both batch and streaming temporal graph analysis.
nodes.author: Pometry

nodes.label: SNAP Temporal Datasets
nodes.desc: Collection of temporal network datasets from SNAP including email networks, social media interaction streams, and Wikipedia edit histories with timestamps.
nodes.author: Jure Leskovec (Stanford)

nodes.label: Temporal Graph Networks for Deep Learning on Dynamic Graphs
nodes.desc: Introduces TGN, a generic framework for deep learning on continuous-time dynamic graphs combining memory modules with graph neural networks.
nodes.author: Emanuele Rossi et al.

nodes.label: NetworkX Temporal Extensions
nodes.desc: NetworkX supports temporal modeling through attributed edges with time properties. Documentation covers approaches for representing and analyzing time-varying networks.
nodes.author: NetworkX Community

nodes.label: Network Science — Chapter on Temporal Networks
nodes.desc: Barabasi's free online Network Science textbook includes coverage of dynamic and temporal network phenomena including spreading processes and epidemic modeling.
nodes.author: Albert-Laszlo Barabasi

nodes.label: Temporal Graph Learning Workshop (NeurIPS)
nodes.desc: Workshop papers and presentations from the NeurIPS Temporal Graph Learning Workshop covering cutting-edge research in learning on time-varying graph data.
nodes.author: Various

nodes.label: The Description Logic Handbook (2nd Edition)
nodes.desc: The authoritative reference on description logics — the formal foundation of OWL. Covers complexity, reasoning algorithms, and extensions. Essential for ontology theorists.
nodes.author: Franz Baader, Diego Calvanese, Deborah McGuinness et al.

nodes.label: Ontology Engineering (Keet)
nodes.desc: Comprehensive textbook on ontology engineering methodology. Covers top-down and bottom-up approaches, ontology design patterns, and evaluation methods. Free online.
nodes.author: C. Maria Keet

nodes.label: A Semantic Web Primer (3rd Edition)
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction to semantic web technologies including RDF, OWL, SPARQL, and ontology engineering. Good starting point for newcomers.
nodes.author: Grigoris Antoniou, Paul Groth, Frank van Harmelen, Rinke Hoekstra

nodes.label: Ontology Design Patterns (ODP Portal)
nodes.desc: Community portal cataloging reusable ontology design patterns. Includes content patterns, structural patterns, and correspondence patterns with examples and best practices.
nodes.author: ODP Community

nodes.label: OWL 2 Web Ontology Language Primer
nodes.desc: Official W3C primer for OWL 2. Covers classes, properties, individuals, axioms, and the three OWL 2 profiles (EL, QL, RL) with their computational tradeoffs.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: SHACL — Shapes Constraint Language
nodes.desc: W3C recommendation for validating RDF graphs against a set of conditions (shapes). Essential for enforcing data quality in knowledge graphs.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: SKOS — Simple Knowledge Organization System
nodes.desc: W3C standard for representing controlled vocabularies, thesauri, and taxonomies in RDF. Simpler than OWL, useful for organizing concepts hierarchically.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: RDFS — RDF Schema 1.1
nodes.desc: W3C specification for RDF Schema — the basic type system for RDF. Defines classes, subclasses, properties, and domains/ranges for lightweight ontologies.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: SUMO — Suggested Upper Merged Ontology
nodes.desc: One of the largest and most comprehensive formal ontologies, with over 20,000 terms and 70,000 axioms. Freely available, mapped to WordNet.
nodes.author: Adam Pease et al.

nodes.label: DOLCE — Descriptive Ontology for Linguistic and Cognitive Engineering
nodes.desc: Foundational ontology focused on cognitive and linguistic adequacy. Distinguishes endurants from perdurants, qualities from abstracts. Influential in ontology engineering.
nodes.author: Nicola Guarino et al.

nodes.label: Protege — Ontology Editor
nodes.desc: The most widely used free, open-source ontology editor. Supports OWL 2, includes reasoners (HermiT, Pellet), and provides visualization of class hierarchies.
nodes.author: Stanford Center for Biomedical Informatics Research

nodes.label: Basic Formal Ontology (BFO)
nodes.desc: Upper-level ontology adopted as ISO/IEC 21838-2. Used as the foundation for hundreds of domain ontologies in biomedicine, defense, and industry.
nodes.author: Barry Smith et al.

nodes.label: Neo4j Documentation — Getting Started
nodes.desc: Official Neo4j documentation covering installation, Cypher query language basics, data modeling in property graphs, and driver APIs for multiple languages.
nodes.author: Neo4j Inc.

nodes.label: Graph Databases (2nd Edition)
nodes.desc: Free ebook from Neo4j covering graph database concepts, data modeling patterns, Cypher query language, and real-world use cases. Excellent introduction.
nodes.author: Ian Robinson, Jim Webber, Emil Eifrem

nodes.label: Neo4j Graph Data Science Library
nodes.desc: Neo4j's graph analytics library with 60+ algorithms including PageRank, community detection, node similarity, path finding, and graph embeddings.
nodes.author: Neo4j Inc.

nodes.label: Cypher Query Language Reference
nodes.desc: The open standard for the Cypher graph query language. Specification, grammar, and compatibility documentation for implementing Cypher across platforms.
nodes.author: openCypher Project

nodes.label: Apache TinkerPop / Gremlin Documentation
nodes.desc: Documentation for Apache TinkerPop graph computing framework and Gremlin traversal language. Vendor-neutral standard supported by many graph databases.
nodes.author: Apache Software Foundation

nodes.label: Amazon Neptune — Developer Guide
nodes.desc: AWS managed graph database supporting both property graphs (Gremlin) and RDF (SPARQL). Documentation covers setup, data loading, querying, and best practices.
nodes.author: Amazon Web Services

nodes.label: ArangoDB Documentation
nodes.desc: Multi-model database supporting graphs, documents, and key-value. AQL query language unifies access patterns. Good for projects needing flexible data modeling.
nodes.author: ArangoDB GmbH

nodes.label: Dgraph Documentation
nodes.desc: Distributed, horizontally scalable graph database with native GraphQL support. Documentation covers DQL query language, schema design, and cluster management.
nodes.author: Dgraph Labs

nodes.label: Graph Database Benchmark (LDBC)
nodes.desc: Industry benchmarks for graph database performance. The Social Network Benchmark (SNB) and Financial Benchmark provide standardized workloads for comparing systems.
nodes.author: Linked Data Benchmark Council

nodes.label: GQL — Graph Query Language (ISO Standard)
nodes.desc: The emerging ISO standard graph query language unifying Cypher, PGQL, and G-CORE. Will become the SQL equivalent for graph databases.
nodes.author: ISO/IEC JTC 1

nodes.label: Practical Gremlin — An Apache TinkerPop Tutorial
nodes.desc: Comprehensive free online book teaching Gremlin from basics to advanced traversals. Uses an air routes dataset for hands-on examples throughout.
nodes.author: Kelvin R. Lawrence

nodes.label: Graph Databases vs Relational Databases (Neo4j Guide)
nodes.desc: Clear comparison of graph vs relational databases covering data modeling differences, query patterns, performance characteristics, and when to choose each approach.
nodes.author: Neo4j Inc.

nodes.label: Introduction to Algorithms (CLRS) — Graph Chapters
nodes.desc: The definitive algorithms textbook. Chapters 20-26 cover BFS, DFS, topological sort, strongly connected components, MST, shortest paths, and network flow.
nodes.author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson, Ronald L. Rivest, Clifford Stein

nodes.label: Networks: An Introduction
nodes.desc: Comprehensive textbook on network science covering graph metrics, random graphs, community detection, network dynamics, and applications across many fields.
nodes.author: Mark Newman

nodes.label: Algorithm Design
nodes.desc: Excellent algorithms text with strong coverage of graph algorithms, network flow, and NP-completeness. Known for clear exposition and real-world motivation.
nodes.author: Jon Kleinberg, Eva Tardos

nodes.label: The Algorithm Design Manual
nodes.desc: Practical algorithms reference with a catalog of graph algorithm problems. Covers implementations, war stories, and guidance on choosing the right algorithm.
nodes.author: Steven S. Skiena

nodes.label: NetworkX — Python Graph Library
nodes.desc: The standard Python library for network analysis. Implements 500+ graph algorithms including shortest paths, centrality, community detection, and isomorphism.
nodes.author: Aric Hagberg, Dan Schult, Pieter Swart

nodes.label: igraph — High-Performance Graph Library
nodes.desc: High-performance graph library with R, Python, and C interfaces. Faster than NetworkX for large graphs. Strong community detection and layout algorithms.
nodes.author: Gabor Csardi, Tamas Nepusz et al.

nodes.label: graph-tool — Efficient Graph Analysis in Python
nodes.desc: Python library using C++ and Boost under the hood for maximum performance. Excellent statistical analysis including stochastic block models for community detection.
nodes.author: Tiago P. Peixoto

nodes.label: JUNG — Java Universal Network/Graph Framework
nodes.desc: Java library for graph/network analysis. Provides algorithms for clustering, decomposition, optimization, random graph generation, and visualization.
nodes.author: Joshua O'Madadhain et al.

nodes.label: Algorithms Specialization (Stanford / Coursera)
nodes.desc: Stanford algorithms course covering graph search, shortest paths, minimum spanning trees, and NP-completeness with rigorous analysis and programming assignments.
nodes.author: Tim Roughgarden

nodes.label: Graph Analytics for Big Data (Coursera / UC San Diego)
nodes.desc: Course on graph analytics at scale covering community detection, influence propagation, and practical tools for analyzing large networks.
nodes.author: Ilkay Altintas

nodes.label: William Fiset — Graph Theory Algorithms (YouTube)
nodes.desc: Excellent YouTube playlist covering graph algorithm implementations: DFS, BFS, Dijkstra, Bellman-Ford, Floyd-Warshall, topological sort, bridges, and articulation points.
nodes.author: William Fiset

nodes.label: Mining of Massive Datasets — Graph Chapters
nodes.desc: Free textbook covering PageRank, link analysis, community detection, and graph mining at web scale. Based on Stanford CS246 course.
nodes.author: Jure Leskovec, Anand Rajaraman, Jeff Ullman

nodes.label: SNAP — Stanford Large Network Dataset Collection
nodes.desc: The most widely used network dataset repository. Includes social networks, web graphs, road networks, citation networks, Amazon co-purchasing, and Wikipedia.
nodes.author: Jure Leskovec (Stanford)

nodes.label: KONECT — The Koblenz Network Collection
nodes.desc: Large collection of network datasets with 300+ networks. Provides statistics, visualizations, and downloadable data in multiple formats.
nodes.author: Jerome Kunegis

nodes.label: Network Repository — Interactive Analysis
nodes.desc: Interactive network data repository with thousands of datasets. Provides real-time visual analytics, statistics, and benchmarks for network analysis research.
nodes.author: Ryan A. Rossi, Nesreen K. Ahmed

nodes.label: Open Graph Benchmark (OGB)
nodes.desc: Standardized benchmark datasets for graph machine learning. Covers node classification, link prediction, and graph classification across diverse domains.
nodes.author: Weihua Hu, Matthias Fey et al.

nodes.label: Wikidata SPARQL Endpoint
nodes.desc: Public SPARQL endpoint for querying Wikidata's knowledge graph of 100M+ items. Includes query editor with autocompletion and visualization tools.
nodes.author: Wikimedia Foundation

nodes.label: Gephi — Open Graph Visualization Platform
nodes.desc: The leading open-source software for network visualization and exploration. Supports large graphs, multiple layout algorithms, dynamic filtering, and plugin ecosystem.
nodes.author: Gephi Consortium

nodes.label: D3.js — Force-Directed Graph Layouts
nodes.desc: JavaScript library for data-driven visualizations. Its force simulation module creates interactive, physics-based graph layouts in the browser.
nodes.author: Mike Bostock

nodes.label: Sigma.js — Large Graph Rendering for the Web
nodes.desc: JavaScript library dedicated to graph drawing using WebGL for performance. Optimized for rendering large networks (100K+ nodes) in the browser.
nodes.author: Sciences Po medialab

nodes.label: Cytoscape — Network Analysis and Visualization
nodes.desc: Open-source platform for visualizing complex networks originally designed for biology. Rich plugin ecosystem, supports large networks, and exports publication-quality figures.
nodes.author: Cytoscape Consortium

nodes.label: Graphviz — Graph Visualization Software
nodes.desc: Classic open-source graph visualization software using the DOT language. Produces static layouts (hierarchical, radial, force-directed) for documentation and analysis.
nodes.author: AT&T Labs Research

nodes.label: Apache Spark GraphX
nodes.desc: Distributed graph processing framework built on Apache Spark. Implements Pregel-style computation for PageRank, connected components, and triangle counting at scale.
nodes.author: Apache Software Foundation

nodes.label: PyTorch Geometric (PyG)
nodes.desc: Library for deep learning on graphs and other irregular structures built on PyTorch. Implements GCN, GAT, GraphSAGE, and many other graph neural network architectures.
nodes.author: Matthias Fey, Jan Eric Lenssen

nodes.label: DGL — Deep Graph Library
nodes.desc: Framework-agnostic library for implementing graph neural networks on top of PyTorch, TensorFlow, or MXNet. Strong support for heterogeneous graphs.
nodes.author: DGL Team (Amazon)
