nodes.label: SNAP.py — Stanford Network Analysis Platform for Python
nodes.desc: Python interface to the SNAP C++ library for large-scale network analysis. Efficient implementations of graph algorithms for networks with millions of nodes.
nodes.author: Jure Leskovec (Stanford)

nodes.label: Knowledge Representation and Reasoning
nodes.desc: The standard textbook on KR&R covering logic, frames, semantic networks, description logics, and non-monotonic reasoning.
nodes.author: Ronald Brachman & Hector Levesque

nodes.label: Knowledge Representation: Logical, Philosophical, and Computational Foundations
nodes.desc: Encyclopaedic treatment of knowledge representation spanning philosophy, logic, linguistics, and AI. Introduces conceptual graphs.
nodes.author: John F. Sowa

nodes.label: The Knowledge Level
nodes.desc: Newell's seminal AI paper proposing knowledge as an independent level of analysis above the symbol level, characterised by goals and rationality.
nodes.author: Allen Newell (1982)

nodes.label: Epistemology (Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy)
nodes.desc: Authoritative philosophical survey of what knowledge is, the conditions for justified belief, and the structure of epistemic warrant.
nodes.author: SEP / Matthias Steup

nodes.label: Personal Knowledge: Towards a Post-Critical Philosophy
nodes.desc: Polanyi's classic on tacit knowledge — the idea that 'we know more than we can tell' — foundational for heuristic and procedural knowledge.
nodes.author: Michael Polanyi

nodes.label: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach (4th Ed.)
nodes.desc: The definitive AI textbook. Chapters on knowledge representation, logical agents, planning, and probabilistic reasoning cover all five knowledge types.
nodes.author: Stuart Russell & Peter Norvig

nodes.label: Building Knowledge Graphs
nodes.desc: End-to-end guide to constructing knowledge graphs from heterogeneous sources, covering extraction, integration, completion, and querying.
nodes.author: Mayank Kejriwal, Craig Knoblock & Pedro Szekely

nodes.label: Knowledge Graphs: Fundamentals, Techniques, and Applications
nodes.desc: Comprehensive textbook on knowledge graph construction, embedding, reasoning, and deployment in real-world applications.
nodes.author: Mayank Kejriwal, Craig Knoblock & Pedro Szekely

nodes.label: The Semantic Web (W3C Overview)
nodes.desc: W3C standards page covering RDF, OWL, SPARQL, and linked data — the web-scale infrastructure for machine-readable knowledge.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: Knowledge Graphs (Stanford CS520)
nodes.desc: Stanford seminar covering knowledge graph construction, reasoning, embedding, and applications across industry.
nodes.author: Vinay Chaudhri et al.

nodes.label: A Survey of Knowledge Graph Embedding Methods
nodes.desc: Comprehensive survey of KG embedding techniques including TransE, RotatE, ComplEx, and their theoretical properties.
nodes.author: Dai et al. (2020)

nodes.label: Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (Brachman & Levesque lectures)
nodes.desc: Lectures by Levesque covering the foundations of KR: expressiveness vs tractability, the frame problem, and closed-world reasoning.
nodes.author: Hector Levesque

nodes.label: Semantic Networks in Artificial Intelligence
nodes.desc: Sowa's definitive survey of semantic network formalisms from Quillian's Teachable Language Comprehender to modern conceptual graphs.
nodes.author: John F. Sowa (1992)

nodes.label: Ontology Development 101: A Guide to Creating Your First Ontology
nodes.desc: The classic practical guide to ontology engineering with Protege, covering classes, properties, constraints, and design patterns.
nodes.author: Noy & McGuinness (Stanford)

nodes.label: The Description Logic Handbook (2nd Ed.)
nodes.desc: Comprehensive reference on description logics — the formal foundation of OWL and modern ontology languages.
nodes.author: Baader, Calvanese, McGuinness et al.

nodes.label: An Introduction to Description Logics
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction to DL syntax, semantics, reasoning services, and the expressiveness-tractability trade-off.
nodes.author: Franz Baader & Werner Nutt

nodes.label: Ontologies: A Silver Bullet for Knowledge Management and Electronic Commerce
nodes.desc: Early but influential monograph on the role of ontologies in enabling interoperability across knowledge systems.
nodes.author: Dieter Fensel

nodes.label: Graph Databases (2nd Ed.)
nodes.desc: Free O'Reilly book introducing the property graph model, Cypher query language, and graph database design patterns.
nodes.author: Ian Robinson, Jim Webber & Emil Eifrem

nodes.label: RDF 1.1 Primer (W3C)
nodes.desc: Official W3C primer on the Resource Description Framework — subject-predicate-object triples as the atomic unit of structural knowledge.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: SPARQL 1.1 Query Language (W3C)
nodes.desc: The W3C specification for querying RDF graphs. SPARQL is the SQL of the semantic web.
nodes.author: W3C

nodes.label: Property Graph Model (ISO GQL & SQL/PGQ)
nodes.desc: Academic foundation for the ISO Graph Query Language standard, unifying property graph models across database systems.
nodes.author: ISO / Deutsch et al.

nodes.label: Translating Embeddings for Modeling Multi-relational Data (TransE)
nodes.desc: The foundational KG embedding paper: model relations as translations in embedding space (h + r ≈ t). Over 10,000 citations.
nodes.author: Bordes et al. (2013)

nodes.label: RotatE: Knowledge Graph Embedding by Relational Rotation in Complex Space
nodes.desc: Models relations as rotations in complex vector space, capturing symmetry, antisymmetry, inversion, and composition patterns.
nodes.author: Sun et al. (2019)

nodes.label: Knowledge Graph Completion via Complex Tensor Factorization (ComplEx)
nodes.desc: Complex-valued tensor factorization for KG link prediction, handling asymmetric relations through complex conjugation.
nodes.author: Trouillon et al. (2016)

nodes.label: A Review of Relational Machine Learning for Knowledge Graphs
nodes.desc: IEEE Proceedings survey covering statistical relational learning, tensor factorization, and neural approaches for KG completion.
nodes.author: Nickel et al. (2016)

nodes.label: Introduction to Mathematical Logic (6th Ed.)
nodes.desc: Classic textbook on propositional and predicate logic, completeness, incompleteness, and model theory — the foundation of declarative knowledge.
nodes.author: Elliott Mendelson

nodes.label: Logic for Computer Science: Foundations of Automatic Theorem Proving
nodes.desc: Free textbook covering resolution, unification, Herbrand's theorem, and automated reasoning — the computational engine behind declarative knowledge.
nodes.author: Jean Gallier

nodes.label: Datalog and Recursive Query Processing
nodes.desc: Survey of Datalog as a knowledge representation language: stratified negation, aggregation, and modern implementations.
nodes.author: Todd J. Green et al. (2013)

nodes.label: What is a Knowledge Base? (Levesque 1986)
nodes.desc: Foundational paper distinguishing a knowledge base (declarative semantics) from a database (extensional semantics).
nodes.author: Hector Levesque

nodes.label: Wikidata: A Free Collaborative Knowledgebase
nodes.desc: The foundational paper on Wikidata — the free, multilingual knowledge base with 100M+ items serving as structured backbone of Wikipedia.
nodes.author: Vrandecic & Krotzsch (2014)

nodes.label: DBpedia: A Large-Scale, Multilingual Knowledge Base
nodes.desc: Describes DBpedia's extraction framework, ontology, and interlinks. One of the central hubs of the Linked Open Data cloud.
nodes.author: Lehmann et al. (2015)

nodes.label: YAGO: A Core of Semantic Knowledge
nodes.desc: Introduces YAGO, unifying WordNet taxonomy with Wikipedia facts into a high-precision knowledge base with 120M+ facts.
nodes.author: Suchanek, Kasneci & Weikum (2007)

nodes.label: Freebase: A Collaboratively Created Graph Database for Structuring Human Knowledge
nodes.desc: The Freebase paper — the collaborative structured knowledge project that became Google's Knowledge Graph.
nodes.author: Bollacker et al. (2008)

nodes.label: Cyc: A Large-Scale Investment in Knowledge Infrastructure
nodes.desc: Lenat's overview of the Cyc project — the ambitious 30+ year effort to encode common-sense declarative knowledge in formal logic.
nodes.author: Douglas Lenat (1995)

nodes.label: Knowledge Vault: A Web-Scale Approach to Probabilistic Knowledge Fusion
nodes.desc: Google's probabilistic approach to extracting and fusing facts from web text, DOM structure, and existing KBs at web scale.
nodes.author: Dong et al. (Google, 2014)

nodes.label: OpenIE: Open Information Extraction from the Web
nodes.desc: Seminal paper on domain-independent relation extraction from text — extracting (subject, relation, object) triples without pre-defined schemas.
nodes.author: Banko et al. (2007)

nodes.label: DeepDive: A Knowledge Management System for Science
nodes.desc: Stanford's system for constructing knowledge bases from dark data using statistical inference, distant supervision, and user feedback.
nodes.author: Zhang et al. (2017)

nodes.label: Knowledge Base Population (TAC-KBP)
nodes.desc: NIST's Text Analysis Conference benchmark for extracting entities, relations, and events from text to populate knowledge bases.
nodes.author: NIST / TAC

nodes.label: Production Systems and Rule-Based Inference
nodes.desc: Classic reference on production system architectures: working memory, conflict resolution, the Rete algorithm, and OPS5.
nodes.author: Brownston, Farrell, Kant & Martin

nodes.label: The Rete Match Algorithm
nodes.desc: The original paper on the Rete algorithm — the efficient pattern-matching algorithm at the heart of production rule systems.
nodes.author: Charles Forgy (1982)

nodes.label: CLIPS Reference Manual
nodes.desc: CLIPS (C Language Integrated Production System) — NASA's expert system shell, still the standard teaching tool for rule-based AI.
nodes.author: NASA / Gary Riley

nodes.label: Drools: Business Rules Management System
nodes.desc: Open-source Java rule engine implementing the Rete algorithm. Widely used in enterprise for encoding procedural business logic.
nodes.author: Red Hat / KIE Group

nodes.label: Automated Planning: Theory and Practice
nodes.desc: The definitive textbook on AI planning covering STRIPS, partial-order planning, hierarchical task networks, and planning under uncertainty.
nodes.author: Ghallab, Nau & Traverso

nodes.label: STRIPS: A New Approach to the Application of Theorem Proving to Problem Solving
nodes.desc: The foundational planning paper introducing preconditions and effects as the formalism for procedural knowledge of actions.
nodes.author: Fikes & Nilsson (1971)

nodes.label: PDDL — The Planning Domain Definition Language
nodes.desc: The standard language for encoding planning domains, used across the International Planning Competition. Encodes procedural knowledge as action schemas.
nodes.author: McDermott et al. (1998)

nodes.label: Hierarchical Task Network Planning: Formalization, Analysis, and Implementation
nodes.desc: Formal treatment of HTN planning — decomposing complex procedures into sub-tasks, the closest planning formalism to human procedural knowledge.
nodes.author: Erol, Hendler & Nau (1994)

nodes.label: Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN 2.0)
nodes.desc: The OMG standard for graphically modelling business processes — the industry-standard language for encoding procedural knowledge in organisations.
nodes.author: OMG

nodes.label: Communicating Sequential Processes
nodes.desc: Hoare's landmark work on process algebra — a formal language for describing concurrent procedural interactions. Free PDF.
nodes.author: C.A.R. Hoare

nodes.label: XState: State Machines and Statecharts for JavaScript
nodes.desc: Modern implementation of Harel statecharts in JavaScript/TypeScript — encoding procedural UI and system logic as finite state machines.
nodes.author: David Khourshid

nodes.label: Statecharts: A Visual Formalism for Complex Systems
nodes.desc: Harel's influential paper extending finite state machines with hierarchy, concurrency, and history — the theoretical basis for UML state diagrams.
nodes.author: David Harel (1987)

nodes.label: Rule-Based Expert Systems: The MYCIN Experiments
nodes.desc: The definitive account of MYCIN — the landmark expert system for antibiotic therapy, introducing certainty factors for heuristic reasoning.
nodes.author: Buchanan & Shortliffe (Eds.)

nodes.label: Expert Systems: Principles and Programming
nodes.desc: Standard textbook on expert system design covering forward/backward chaining, certainty factors, and CLIPS programming.
nodes.author: Giarratano & Riley

nodes.label: The Delphi Method: Techniques and Applications
nodes.desc: Classic reference on structured expert elicitation — systematically extracting heuristic knowledge from human experts.
nodes.author: Linstone & Turoff (Eds.)

nodes.label: Heuristics: Intelligent Search Strategies for Computer Problem Solving
nodes.desc: Pearl's early masterwork on heuristic search: A*, branch-and-bound, and the theory of admissible heuristics.
nodes.author: Judea Pearl

nodes.label: Models of Bounded Rationality (Vols 1-3)
nodes.desc: Simon's collected works on bounded rationality, satisficing, and the adaptive toolbox — the theoretical foundation of heuristic reasoning.
nodes.author: Herbert A. Simon

nodes.label: Judgment Under Uncertainty: Heuristics and Biases
nodes.desc: The landmark collection of papers on representativeness, availability, anchoring, and other cognitive heuristics that shape human judgment.
nodes.author: Kahneman, Slovic & Tversky (Eds.)

nodes.label: Thinking, Fast and Slow
nodes.desc: Kahneman's popular masterwork on dual-process theory — System 1 (heuristic, fast) vs System 2 (deliberate, slow) thinking.
nodes.author: Daniel Kahneman

nodes.label: Simple Heuristics That Make Us Smart
nodes.desc: The 'fast and frugal heuristics' programme showing that simple heuristics can outperform complex optimization in uncertain environments.
nodes.author: Gigerenzer, Todd & the ABC Research Group

nodes.label: Ecological Rationality: Intelligence in the World
nodes.desc: Framework for understanding when and why heuristics succeed by matching their structure to environmental regularities.
nodes.author: Todd & Gigerenzer (2012)

nodes.label: Fuzzy Sets
nodes.desc: Zadeh's foundational paper introducing fuzzy sets — graded membership functions that formalize heuristic vagueness.
nodes.author: Lotfi Zadeh (1965)

nodes.label: Fuzzy Logic with Engineering Applications (4th Ed.)
nodes.desc: Standard engineering textbook on fuzzy sets, fuzzy inference systems, and fuzzy control — the applied side of heuristic knowledge.
nodes.author: Timothy J. Ross

nodes.label: Probabilistic Reasoning in Intelligent Systems: Networks of Plausible Inference
nodes.desc: Pearl's seminal work on Bayesian networks — the formal framework for propagating heuristic beliefs through graphical models.
nodes.author: Judea Pearl

nodes.label: An Introduction to Bayesian Networks
nodes.desc: Accessible textbook on Bayesian network construction, inference algorithms, and applications to uncertain heuristic reasoning.
nodes.author: Finn V. Jensen & Thomas D. Nielsen

nodes.label: Epistemology: A Contemporary Introduction to the Theory of Knowledge
nodes.desc: Leading introductory textbook covering justified true belief, Gettier problems, foundationalism, coherentism, and reliabilism.
nodes.author: Robert Audi

nodes.label: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
nodes.desc: Kuhn's paradigm-shifting work on how scientific knowledge evolves through normal science, crisis, and paradigm shifts — meta knowledge at civilisational scale.
nodes.author: Thomas Kuhn

nodes.label: On Certainty
nodes.desc: Wittgenstein's final work examining the foundations of knowledge — what it means to 'know' something and the role of bedrock propositions.
nodes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

nodes.label: Metacognition (Stanford Encyclopedia)
nodes.desc: Comprehensive philosophical survey of metacognition: monitoring, control, and the relationship between knowing and knowing that you know.
nodes.author: SEP / Joelle Proust

nodes.label: On the Logic of Theory Change: Partial Meet Contraction and Revision Functions (AGM)
nodes.desc: The AGM paper — the foundational framework for belief revision, defining rational postulates for how knowledge bases should change when new information arrives.
nodes.author: Alchourron, Gardenfors & Makinson (1985)

nodes.label: Knowledge in Flux: Modeling the Dynamics of Epistemic States
nodes.desc: Book-length treatment of belief revision theory: expansion, contraction, revision, and the epistemic entrenchment ordering.
nodes.author: Peter Gardenfors

nodes.label: A Truth Maintenance System
nodes.desc: The original TMS paper — maintaining consistency of beliefs and their justifications, enabling non-monotonic reasoning and dependency-directed backtracking.
nodes.author: Jon Doyle (1979)

nodes.label: An Assumption-based Truth Maintenance System (ATMS)
nodes.desc: De Kleer's ATMS — tracking all possible consistent belief sets simultaneously, enabling efficient hypothetical reasoning about what is known.
nodes.author: Johan de Kleer (1986)

nodes.label: PROV-O: The PROV Ontology (W3C)
nodes.desc: W3C standard for representing provenance of knowledge — who created it, how, when, and from what sources. Essential meta knowledge infrastructure.
nodes.author: W3C Provenance Working Group

nodes.label: Data Quality: Concepts, Methodologies and Techniques
nodes.desc: Comprehensive treatment of data quality dimensions (accuracy, completeness, timeliness, consistency) — the quantitative side of meta knowledge.
nodes.author: Batini & Scannapieco

nodes.label: OWL 2 Web Ontology Language Primer (W3C)
nodes.desc: The W3C OWL 2 primer — defining what kinds of knowledge are expressible in a domain, the schema-level meta knowledge.
nodes.author: W3C OWL Working Group

nodes.label: Knowledge Graph Refinement: A Survey of Approaches and Evaluation Methods
nodes.desc: Survey of methods for assessing and improving KG quality: completeness estimation, error detection, and type prediction.
nodes.author: Paulheim (2017)

nodes.label: Open World Assumption (SEP entry on Logic and Databases)
nodes.desc: Philosophical treatment of open vs closed world assumptions — the fundamental meta-knowledge decision about what absence of information means.
nodes.author: SEP / Raymond Reiter

nodes.label: Knowledge Acquisition in Practice: A Step-by-step Guide
nodes.desc: Practical guide to structured knowledge elicitation techniques: interviews, protocol analysis, card sorting, and repertory grids.
nodes.author: Shadbolt, Smart & Wilson

nodes.label: A Practical Guide to Knowledge Acquisition
nodes.desc: Classic reference on knowledge acquisition methodology for building expert systems, covering task analysis and structured interviews.
nodes.author: Scott, Clayton & Gibson

nodes.label: Ontology Learning from Text: Methods, Evaluation, and Applications
nodes.desc: Methods for automatically extracting ontological knowledge from unstructured text — bridging NLP and knowledge engineering.
nodes.author: Cimiano (2006)

nodes.label: Knowledge Elicitation Techniques (SEP)
nodes.desc: Philosophical perspective on knowledge-how vs knowledge-that, relevant to eliciting procedural vs declarative knowledge from experts.
nodes.author: SEP / Various

nodes.label: Ontology Design Patterns (ODP)
nodes.desc: Community catalogue of reusable ontology design patterns — best practices for encoding structural and declarative knowledge.
nodes.author: ontologydesignpatterns.org

nodes.label: A Pattern-Based Method for Building Ontologies
nodes.desc: Methodology for using ontology design patterns to systematically build domain ontologies — knowledge engineering as pattern composition.
nodes.author: Blomqvist & Sandkuhl (2005)

nodes.label: Protege Ontology Editor
nodes.desc: The most widely-used open-source ontology editor, supporting OWL 2 and SWRL rules. The de facto tool for knowledge engineers.
nodes.author: Stanford BMIR

nodes.label: The Semantic Web — ISWC Conference Proceedings
nodes.desc: Proceedings of the International Semantic Web Conference — the premier venue for knowledge engineering research.
nodes.author: Various (Annual)

nodes.label: Neo4j Graph Database
nodes.desc: The leading property graph database with Cypher query language. Over 800 enterprise customers using knowledge graphs in production.
nodes.author: Neo4j Inc.

nodes.label: Apache Jena: A Semantic Web Framework for Java
nodes.desc: Full-featured RDF/OWL framework with SPARQL engine, reasoner, and TDB triple store. The workhorse of semantic web applications.
nodes.author: Apache Foundation

nodes.label: Stardog: Enterprise Knowledge Graph Platform
nodes.desc: Enterprise KG platform supporting OWL reasoning, SPARQL, GraphQL, and virtual knowledge graphs over relational sources.
nodes.author: Stardog Union

nodes.label: Amazon Neptune / Azure Cosmos DB (Graph)
nodes.desc: Cloud-native graph database services supporting both property graph (Gremlin/openCypher) and RDF (SPARQL) models at scale.
nodes.author: AWS / Microsoft

nodes.label: FB15k-237: A Filtered Version of FB15k
nodes.desc: Standard benchmark for KG link prediction, derived from Freebase with test leakage removed. 14,541 entities, 237 relations.
nodes.author: Toutanova & Chen (2015)

nodes.label: WN18RR: A Reinvestigation of WordNet-based KG Benchmarks
nodes.desc: Cleaned WordNet benchmark for link prediction. 40,943 entities and 11 relations capturing lexical relationships.
nodes.author: Dettmers et al. (2018)

nodes.label: OGBL-WikiKG2 (Open Graph Benchmark)
nodes.desc: Large-scale Wikidata-based KG benchmark with 2.5M entities, 535 relations, and 17M triples for realistic link prediction evaluation.
nodes.author: Hu et al. (2021)

nodes.label: Freebase/Wikidata Entity Linking Benchmarks
nodes.desc: Collection of entity linking and disambiguation benchmarks built on Wikidata, testing the ability to ground text mentions to KG entities.
nodes.author: Various

nodes.label: SimpleQuestions: A Resource for Question Answering over KGs
nodes.desc: 108K simple factual questions paired with Freebase triples. The foundational benchmark for single-hop KGQA.
nodes.author: Bordes et al. (2015)

nodes.label: ComplexWebQuestions: Multi-Hop QA over Knowledge Graphs
nodes.desc: 34K complex questions requiring multi-hop reasoning, comparison, and aggregation over a knowledge graph.
nodes.author: Talmor & Berant (2018)

nodes.label: WebQuestionsSP: Semantic Parsing on Freebase
nodes.desc: 4,737 questions with SPARQL annotations over Freebase, bridging NL understanding and structured knowledge retrieval.
nodes.author: Yih et al. (2016)

nodes.label: KGQA Survey: Knowledge Graph Question Answering
nodes.desc: Comprehensive survey of KGQA methods: semantic parsing, embedding-based, and retrieval-augmented approaches.
nodes.author: Lan et al. (2021)

nodes.label: ATOMIC: An Atlas of Machine Commonsense for If-Then Reasoning
nodes.desc: 877K inferential knowledge tuples covering causes, effects, mental states — a commonsense knowledge graph for heuristic reasoning.
nodes.author: Sap et al. (2019)

nodes.label: ConceptNet 5.5: An Open Multilingual Graph of General Knowledge
nodes.desc: Large-scale commonsense knowledge graph with 21M edges across 36 relation types. Links to WordNet, DBpedia, and Wikidata.
nodes.author: Speer, Chin & Havasi (2017)

nodes.label: CommonsenseQA: A Question Answering Challenge Targeting World Knowledge
nodes.desc: 12K multiple-choice questions requiring commonsense reasoning, sourced from ConceptNet relation triples.
nodes.author: Talmor et al. (2019)

nodes.label: RuleTaker: Probing Neural Models for Compositional Reasoning
nodes.desc: Benchmark testing whether language models can follow logical rules and derive conclusions — probing procedural and meta knowledge in neural systems.
nodes.author: Clark et al. (2020)

nodes.label: Introduction to Quantitative Genetics
nodes.desc: The definitive textbook on quantitative genetics \u2014 heritability, selection response, genetic correlations. Essential foundation for understanding EPDs and breeding value estimation.
nodes.author: Falconer & Mackay

nodes.label: Animal Breeding and Genetics
nodes.desc: Open-access animal breeding genetics textbook covering BLUP, genomic selection, and breeding program design for livestock species.
nodes.author: Julius van der Werf, et al. \u2014 University of New England

nodes.label: Pathways to Pregnancy and Parturition
nodes.desc: Comprehensive reproductive physiology textbook covering estrous cycles, pregnancy, and parturition across livestock species. Standard reference for swine reproduction.
nodes.author: P.L. Senger

nodes.label: Pork Industry Handbook
nodes.desc: Comprehensive collection of fact sheets covering all aspects of pork production \u2014 genetics, nutrition, health, facilities, and management.
nodes.author: Purdue University Extension

nodes.label: Genetics and the Behavior of Domestic Animals
nodes.desc: Explores the genetic basis of behavior in livestock, including temperament and handling traits relevant to show ring performance.
nodes.author: Temple Grandin & Mark Deesing

nodes.label: Journal of Animal Science
nodes.desc: Premier peer-reviewed journal publishing research on animal genetics, nutrition, physiology, and management. Essential for staying current with swine science.
nodes.author: American Society of Animal Science

nodes.label: Livestock Science (Elsevier Journal)
nodes.desc: International journal covering animal production science including breeding, nutrition, and welfare across all livestock species.
nodes.author: Elsevier

nodes.label: Swine Science
nodes.desc: Comprehensive introductory text covering swine breeds, genetics, reproduction, nutrition, health, and management. Ideal starting reference.
nodes.author: Palmer Holden & M.E. Ensminger

nodes.label: Introduction to Quantitative Genetics
nodes.desc: Gold-standard textbook on heritability, selection response (R = h\u00B2S), genetic drift, and inbreeding. Foundational for all EPD-based selection programs.
nodes.author: Falconer & Mackay

nodes.label: Understanding Animal Breeding
nodes.desc: Applied animal breeding textbook covering EPDs, accuracy, selection indices, mating systems, and breeding program design. Written with livestock producers in mind.
nodes.author: Richard M. Bourdon

nodes.label: Genetics of Livestock Improvement
nodes.desc: Classic text on livestock genetics with practical applications for cattle and swine breeding programs. Covers both qualitative and quantitative traits.
nodes.author: John F. Lasley

nodes.label: Breeding and Genetics \u2014 National Swine Registry
nodes.desc: Breed registry for Yorkshire, Duroc, Hampshire, and Landrace. Publishes EPDs, sire summaries, and genetic trend data for registered seedstock.
nodes.author: NSR

nodes.label: National Swine Registry (NSR)
nodes.desc: Central registry for four major U.S. swine breeds. Provides EPDs for backfat, loin muscle area, days to 250, and number born alive. Maintains pedigree records.
nodes.author: NSR

nodes.label: American Berkshire Association (ABA)
nodes.desc: Breed registry for Berkshire hogs. Known for meat quality (pH, marbling, color). Publishes Berkshire-specific EPDs and maintains herd book records.
nodes.author: ABA

nodes.label: Certified Pedigreed Swine (CPS)
nodes.desc: Registry for Chester White, Poland China, and Spotted breeds. Publishes genetic evaluations and sire summaries for registered populations.
nodes.author: CPS

nodes.label: National Swine Improvement Federation (NSIF) Guidelines
nodes.desc: Industry guidelines for swine genetic evaluation, on-farm testing, ultrasound scanning protocols, and EPD calculation methodologies. Standard for seedstock programs.
nodes.author: NSIF

nodes.label: Swine Genetics \u2014 Iowa State Extension
nodes.desc: Extension publications on crossbreeding systems, EPD interpretation, breed selection, and genetic improvement strategies for Iowa pork producers.
nodes.author: Iowa State University

nodes.label: Swine Breeding and Gestation Management
nodes.desc: Practical guides on mating management, boar selection, gilt development, and reproductive performance optimization for swine operations.
nodes.author: Penn State Extension

nodes.label: Applied Swine Genetics
nodes.desc: Extension publications covering heritability estimates for swine traits, use of EPDs in selection, and crossbreeding system design for commercial and seedstock herds.
nodes.author: Purdue University Extension

nodes.label: Pig Genetics and Genomics
nodes.desc: Advanced reference covering molecular genetics, QTL mapping, marker-assisted selection, and genomic tools applied to swine improvement.
nodes.author: Max Rothschild \u2014 Iowa State University

nodes.label: Pathways to Pregnancy and Parturition
nodes.desc: The standard reproductive physiology textbook for animal science programs. Covers neuroendocrine control, folliculogenesis, spermatogenesis, pregnancy, and parturition.
nodes.author: P.L. Senger

nodes.label: Reproduction in Domestic Animals (Hafez)
nodes.desc: Classic reference covering comparative reproductive anatomy, endocrinology, and assisted reproduction across livestock species including detailed swine chapters.
nodes.author: Hafez & Hafez

nodes.label: Boar Stud Management & AI Techniques
nodes.desc: Practical extension guides on semen collection, evaluation, extension, and insemination timing for swine AI programs. Includes protocols for on-farm use.
nodes.author: Iowa State University Extension

nodes.label: Control of Pig Reproduction (SRF Series)
nodes.desc: Advanced reference on reproductive endocrinology, ovarian function, and technologies for controlling and synchronizing reproduction in swine.
nodes.author: Society for Reproduction and Fertility

nodes.label: Swine Reproduction Guide \u2014 PIC
nodes.desc: Technical bulletins on gilt development, estrus detection, AI timing, farrowing management, and reproductive benchmarks from a major genetics company.
nodes.author: PIC (Pig Improvement Company)

nodes.label: Gilt Development and Breeding Management
nodes.desc: Applied articles on gilt selection, boar exposure protocols, body condition targets, and breeding herd replacement strategies.
nodes.author: National Hog Farmer

nodes.label: Swine Reproductive Physiology
nodes.desc: Extension publications on estrous cycle management, heat detection, and reproductive failure diagnosis in commercial and seedstock swine operations.
nodes.author: University of Missouri Extension

nodes.label: Reproductive Technologies in Swine
nodes.desc: Leading journal for animal reproduction research. Publishes studies on AI, embryo transfer, cryopreservation, and reproductive biotechnologies in swine.
nodes.author: Theriogenology (Journal)

nodes.label: Matrix (Altrenogest) for Estrus Synchronization
nodes.desc: Product information and protocols for altrenogest-based estrus synchronization in gilts. Standard tool for batch farrowing management in show and commercial herds.
nodes.author: Merck Animal Health

nodes.label: Prostaglandin & Oxytocin Use in Swine Reproduction
nodes.desc: Veterinary protocols for prostaglandin-based parturition induction, oxytocin use during farrowing, and hormonal intervention for reproductive disorders.
nodes.author: Iowa State Veterinary Extension

nodes.label: Reproductive Failure in Swine \u2014 Diagnostic Approach
nodes.desc: Diagnostic decision trees for investigating reproductive failure \u2014 returns to estrus, small litters, mummified fetuses, abortions, and anestrus in sow herds.
nodes.author: Pig Site / 5m Publishing

nodes.label: Nutrient Requirements of Swine (NRC)
nodes.desc: The authoritative reference for swine nutrient requirements. Provides detailed tables for energy, amino acids, minerals, and vitamins across all production stages. 11th Revised Edition.
nodes.author: National Research Council

nodes.label: Applied Animal Nutrition
nodes.desc: Comprehensive animal nutrition textbook covering digestive physiology, feedstuffs, ration formulation, and species-specific nutrition including swine.
nodes.author: Peter Cheeke & Ellen Dierenfeld

nodes.label: Swine Nutrition Guide
nodes.desc: K-State applied swine nutrition publications covering diet formulation, amino acid requirements, feed additives, and grow-finish feeding programs.
nodes.author: Kansas State University

nodes.label: Swine Nutrition
nodes.desc: Advanced reference text covering amino acid nutrition, energy metabolism, mineral and vitamin requirements, and feed processing effects in swine.
nodes.author: Austin Lewis & Lee Southern

nodes.label: Honor Show Chow Feeding Guide
nodes.desc: Product line and feeding guides for the Honor Show Chow show pig feed program. Includes phase-feeding recommendations and body condition management tips.
nodes.author: Purina Animal Nutrition

nodes.label: Show Pig Nutrition and Feeding
nodes.desc: Extension guide on show pig feeding programs covering feed selection, feeding schedules, and nutritional strategies to optimize muscle and condition for the show ring.
nodes.author: Texas A&M AgriLife Extension

nodes.label: Growth Curves and Feed Management
nodes.desc: Publications on modeling swine growth curves, adjusting feed intake for target weight and condition, and using ADG projections for show date planning.
nodes.author: Iowa State Extension \u2014 IPIC

nodes.label: Feed Additives and Growth Promotants in Swine
nodes.desc: Extension guide covering feed additives including antibiotics, probiotics, organic acids, and beta-agonists (ractopamine) in swine diets. Includes withdrawal times and show rules.
nodes.author: University of Kentucky Extension

nodes.label: Feedstuffs Magazine & Database
nodes.desc: Industry publication and ingredient database covering feed markets, ingredient analysis, and ration formulation tools for livestock nutritionists.
nodes.author: Feedstuffs

nodes.label: INRA-CIRAD-AFZ Feed Tables
nodes.desc: Comprehensive online database of feed ingredient composition including amino acid profiles, digestibility coefficients, and energy values for swine diet formulation.
nodes.author: INRA/AFZ

nodes.label: Swine Diet Formulation \u2014 Spreadsheet Tools
nodes.desc: Downloadable spreadsheet tools for swine diet formulation using linear programming. Includes ingredient databases and nutrient requirement tables.
nodes.author: University of Minnesota Extension

nodes.label: 4-H Swine Showmanship Guide
nodes.desc: Comprehensive 4-H showmanship guide covering pig handling, driving techniques, positioning for the judge, and show ring etiquette for youth exhibitors.
nodes.author: Ohio State University Extension

nodes.label: FFA Livestock Evaluation Career Development Event
nodes.desc: Official FFA livestock evaluation CDE materials including judging rubrics, oral reasons frameworks, and practice classes for swine evaluation.
nodes.author: National FFA Organization

nodes.label: Fitting and Grooming Show Pigs
nodes.desc: Step-by-step guide to show pig preparation including washing, clipping, skin conditioning, and day-of-show grooming techniques.
nodes.author: Purdue University Extension

nodes.label: Show Ring Success \u2014 The Showman's Guide
nodes.desc: Industry-leading show supply company providing educational resources, video tutorials, and product guides for fitting and grooming across species including swine.
nodes.author: Sullivan Supply

nodes.label: Livestock Judging Manual
nodes.desc: Comprehensive livestock judging manual covering market hog evaluation, breeding gilt selection, oral reasons delivery, and comparative terminology for swine classes.
nodes.author: Oklahoma State University

nodes.label: Evaluating and Grading Swine
nodes.desc: Official USDA grading standards for barrows and gilts. Covers yield grades, quality grades, and carcass evaluation criteria used in industry and contest grading.
nodes.author: USDA Agricultural Marketing Service

nodes.label: Visual Appraisal of Market Hogs
nodes.desc: Guide to visual evaluation of market hogs covering structural soundness assessment, muscling evaluation, and lean growth prediction from live animal appraisal.
nodes.author: University of Nebraska Extension

nodes.label: Oral Reasons \u2014 A Guide to Livestock Judging
nodes.desc: Framework for delivering oral reasons in livestock judging contests including terminology, structure (grant-initial-middle-final), and comparative language for swine classes.
nodes.author: Texas A&M Meat Science

nodes.label: World Pork Expo
nodes.desc: The largest pork-specific trade show and exhibition in the world, held annually in Des Moines, Iowa. Features junior and open swine shows, educational seminars, and trade exhibits.
nodes.author: National Pork Producers Council

nodes.label: North American International Livestock Exposition (NAILE)
nodes.desc: One of the largest purebred livestock shows in North America held annually in Louisville, KY. Premier venue for show pig competition and genetics showcasing.
nodes.author: Kentucky State Fair Board

nodes.label: Team Purebred
nodes.desc: National junior swine organization providing point-based recognition for youth exhibitors showing registered purebred swine across sanctioned shows.
nodes.author: Team Purebred

nodes.label: Showpig.com
nodes.desc: Industry marketplace and community hub for show pig breeders and exhibitors. Includes sale listings, show results, breeder directories, and industry news.
nodes.author: Showpig.com

nodes.label: PigCHAMP
nodes.desc: Industry-standard swine herd management software. Tracks reproductive performance, production metrics, health events, and generates benchmarking reports for sow herds.
nodes.author: PigCHAMP Inc.

nodes.label: Easy Pig
nodes.desc: Cloud-based pig herd management system designed for smaller operations. Tracks breeding, farrowing, growth, and health records with mobile access.
nodes.author: Agritec Software

nodes.label: Swine Management Services Benchmarking
nodes.desc: SMS publishes quarterly benchmarking reports comparing reproductive and production performance metrics across U.S. sow farms. Establishes industry KPI targets.
nodes.author: Swine Management Services

nodes.label: Record Keeping for Show Pig Operations
nodes.desc: Extension guide on essential records for show pig breeders including pedigree tracking, performance records, health logs, and financial record-keeping for youth projects.
nodes.author: University of Illinois Extension

nodes.label: Secure Pork Supply Plan
nodes.desc: National biosecurity framework for swine operations. Includes site-specific biosecurity plans, movement controls, and business continuity guidance for disease outbreak scenarios.
nodes.author: USDA APHIS / Iowa State

nodes.label: Pork Quality Assurance Plus (PQA Plus)
nodes.desc: Industry certification program covering animal welfare, food safety, and on-farm management practices. Required for many show exhibitions and commercial marketing channels.
nodes.author: National Pork Board

nodes.label: Swine Biosecurity Protocols
nodes.desc: AASV guidelines on entry protocols, shower-in/shower-out procedures, downtime requirements, and transport biosecurity for maintaining herd health status.
nodes.author: American Association of Swine Veterinarians

nodes.label: Swine Housing and Equipment Handbook
nodes.desc: Engineering reference for swine facility design including ventilation, heating, flooring, pen layouts, and environmental control systems for all production stages.
nodes.author: Midwest Plan Service (MWPS)

nodes.label: Small-Scale Swine Facility Design
nodes.desc: Facility design guide scaled for small and show pig operations covering barn layouts, pen sizes, ventilation basics, and manure management for 10\u2013100 sow operations.
nodes.author: Penn State Extension

nodes.label: Environmental Management in Swine Production
nodes.desc: Extension resources on temperature management, ventilation design, waste handling, and environmental regulations affecting swine facility operations.
nodes.author: North Carolina State Extension

nodes.label: Diseases of Swine
nodes.desc: The definitive veterinary reference for swine diseases. 11th edition covers infectious, metabolic, and toxicologic diseases with detailed diagnosis, treatment, and prevention protocols.
nodes.author: Zimmerman, Karriker, Ramirez, Schwartz & Stevenson

nodes.label: Merck Veterinary Manual \u2014 Swine
nodes.desc: Free online veterinary reference covering swine diseases, nutrition, management, and pharmacology. Continuously updated by veterinary experts.
nodes.author: Merck & Co.

nodes.label: The Pig Site \u2014 Disease Reference
nodes.desc: Online disease reference guide with detailed entries for each major swine disease including clinical signs, diagnosis, treatment, and prevention strategies.
nodes.author: 5m Publishing

nodes.label: Swine Disease Manual
nodes.desc: Pocket reference for field veterinarians covering clinical identification, differential diagnosis, and treatment protocols for common swine diseases.
nodes.author: American Association of Swine Veterinarians

nodes.label: Swine Vaccination Guidelines
nodes.desc: Evidence-based vaccination recommendations for commercial and seedstock swine herds including timing, routes, and product selection for major swine pathogens.
nodes.author: Iowa State Veterinary Diagnostic Lab

nodes.label: PRRS Elimination and Control Strategies
nodes.desc: Comprehensive PRRS resource including regional elimination strategies, load-close-expose protocols, McREBEL procedures, and area/regional control programs.
nodes.author: Swine Health Information Center (SHIC)

nodes.label: Internal and External Parasites of Swine
nodes.desc: Extension guide on common swine parasites (Ascaris, Trichuris, Sarcoptic mange) including identification, treatment protocols, deworming schedules, and resistance management.
nodes.author: University of Kentucky Extension

nodes.label: Antibiotic Use and Stewardship in Swine
nodes.desc: Industry guidelines on responsible antibiotic use including VFD (Veterinary Feed Directive) requirements, withdrawal times, and antimicrobial stewardship principles.
nodes.author: National Pork Board

nodes.label: Health Requirements for Swine Exhibition
nodes.desc: Federal and state health certificate requirements, testing protocols (brucellosis, pseudorabies), and import/export regulations for exhibition swine.
nodes.author: USDA APHIS VS

nodes.label: Swine Show Health and Biosecurity
nodes.desc: Guide for youth exhibitors on pre-show health checks, post-show isolation protocols, and biosecurity practices to protect home herds from show-acquired pathogens.
nodes.author: Ohio State University Extension

nodes.label: Common Skin Conditions in Show Pigs
nodes.desc: Identification and treatment of skin conditions affecting show pigs including mange, ringworm, greasy pig disease, sunburn, and pityriasis rosea.
nodes.author: Michigan State University Extension

nodes.label: USDA NASS \u2014 Hogs and Pigs Report
nodes.desc: Quarterly report on U.S. swine inventory, breeding herd size, pig crop, and farrowing intentions. Essential market intelligence for production planning and breeding decisions.
nodes.author: USDA National Agricultural Statistics Service

nodes.label: USDA ERS \u2014 Hog and Pork Sector Data
nodes.desc: Economic research data on pork production costs, trade, per capita consumption, farm-to-retail price spreads, and industry structure analysis.
nodes.author: USDA Economic Research Service

nodes.label: USDA Market News \u2014 Swine Reports
nodes.desc: Daily and weekly market reports including negotiated hog prices, cutout values, slaughter data, and carcass merit premiums/discounts.
nodes.author: USDA AMS Market News

nodes.label: National Pork Board Research Database
nodes.desc: Searchable database of checkoff-funded research projects covering genetics, nutrition, health, welfare, and pork quality. Includes final reports and producer-facing summaries.
nodes.author: National Pork Board (Checkoff)

nodes.label: NSIF Swine Genetic Evaluation Programs
nodes.desc: NSIF guidelines and standards for on-farm performance testing, central test station protocols, ultrasound scanning, and genetic evaluation methodologies across U.S. swine breeds.
nodes.author: National Swine Improvement Federation

nodes.label: BLUPF90 Family of Programs
nodes.desc: Suite of programs for genetic evaluation including BLUP, REML variance component estimation, and single-step genomic BLUP (ssGBLUP). Widely used in livestock breeding research.
nodes.author: Ignacy Misztal \u2014 University of Georgia

nodes.label: Neogen GeneSeek Genomic Profiler (GGP) Porcine
nodes.desc: Commercial SNP genotyping arrays for pigs (GGP Porcine HD: ~62K SNPs). Used for genomic selection, parentage verification, and genetic defect screening in seedstock programs.
nodes.author: Neogen Corporation

nodes.label: AGIL (Animal Genomics and Improvement Laboratory)
nodes.desc: USDA research lab developing genomic evaluation methods for livestock. Publishes research on genetic evaluation accuracy, genomic prediction, and breed composition estimation.
nodes.author: USDA ARS

nodes.label: PigCHAMP
nodes.desc: Comprehensive sow herd management system tracking breeding, farrowing, weaning, and health events. Industry benchmark data enables performance comparison across operations.
nodes.author: PigCHAMP Inc.

nodes.label: MetaFarms
nodes.desc: Cloud-based livestock production platform for record keeping, compliance reporting, and production analytics. Integrates sow farm, nursery, and finisher data across multi-site operations.
nodes.author: MetaFarms Inc.

nodes.label: Iowa State \u2014 Iowa Pork Industry Center
nodes.desc: Central resource hub for Iowa pork production data, extension publications, management tools, and decision aids from Iowa State University\u2019s pork industry center.
nodes.author: Iowa State University

nodes.label: Pig Improvement Company (PIC) Technical Resources
nodes.desc: Technical bulletins, management guides, and production benchmarks from one of the world\u2019s largest swine genetics companies. Covers nutrition, reproduction, and health management.
nodes.author: PIC / Genus plc

nodes.label: Nature-Inspired Optimization Algorithms
nodes.desc: A comprehensive introduction to major nature-inspired algorithms including genetic algorithms, ant colony optimization, and firefly algorithms. Ideal entry point with clear mathematical formulations.
nodes.author: Xin-She Yang

nodes.label: Introduction to Evolutionary Computing
nodes.desc: The standard textbook for evolutionary computation, covering genetic algorithms, evolution strategies, genetic programming, and their theoretical foundations.
nodes.author: A.E. Eiben & J.E. Smith

nodes.label: Essentials of Metaheuristics
nodes.desc: A freely available textbook covering a wide range of metaheuristic techniques with pseudocode. Continuously updated and community-driven.
nodes.author: Sean Luke

nodes.label: Swarm Intelligence: From Natural to Artificial Systems
nodes.desc: A foundational text that bridges the gap between biological swarm behavior and computational swarm intelligence algorithms.
nodes.author: Eric Bonabeau, Marco Dorigo & Guy Theraulaz

nodes.label: No Free Lunch Theorems for Optimization
nodes.desc: The seminal 1997 paper proving that averaged over all possible problems, every optimization algorithm performs identically, shaping modern metaheuristic research.
nodes.author: David H. Wolpert & William G. Macready

nodes.label: Metaheuristics: A Survey of Informing Approaches
nodes.desc: An influential survey classifying metaheuristic techniques along multiple dimensions including trajectory vs. population, memory usage, and neighborhood structures.
nodes.author: Christian Blum & Andrea Roli

nodes.label: A Comprehensive Survey on Nature-Inspired Algorithms
nodes.desc: A modern survey categorizing nature-inspired algorithms by their biological inspiration source and comparing their convergence properties.
nodes.author: Sadeeq et al.

nodes.label: Metaheuristic Research: A Comprehensive Survey
nodes.desc: Reviews the development timeline of metaheuristic algorithms and identifies key trends, open problems, and promising research directions.
nodes.author: Seyedali Mirjalili

nodes.label: Nature-Inspired Computing (IIT Kharagpur, NPTEL)
nodes.desc: A full lecture series covering foundational nature-inspired methods from genetic algorithms to swarm optimization with worked examples.
nodes.author: Prof. Kaushik Das Sharma

nodes.label: Bio-Inspired AI (YouTube Series)
nodes.desc: Engaging video series on genetic algorithms, steering behaviors, and evolutionary art using Processing and p5.js.
nodes.author: The Coding Train (Daniel Shiffman)

nodes.label: Computational Intelligence: An Introduction (Coursera)
nodes.desc: Textbook companion for computational intelligence covering neural networks, evolutionary computation, and swarm intelligence from a unified perspective.
nodes.author: Andries Engelbrecht

nodes.label: Adaptation in Natural and Artificial Systems
nodes.desc: The foundational 1975 book that introduced genetic algorithms, the schema theorem, and the building-block hypothesis.
nodes.author: John H. Holland

nodes.label: An Introduction to Genetic Algorithms
nodes.desc: An accessible and widely-used textbook that explains genetic algorithms from basic concepts through advanced theory with practical exercises.
nodes.author: Melanie Mitchell

nodes.label: Genetic Algorithms in Search, Optimization, and Machine Learning
nodes.desc: One of the most cited GA references, covering schemata theory, building blocks, parallel GAs, and applications to machine learning.
nodes.author: David E. Goldberg

nodes.label: Differential Evolution: A Practical Approach to Global Optimization
nodes.desc: The authoritative reference on differential evolution, including its theory, variants, and applications to real-world engineering problems.
nodes.author: Kenneth V. Price, Rainer M. Storn & Jouni A. Lampinen

nodes.label: Genetic Algorithm Walkthroughs
nodes.desc: Visual step-by-step explanation of how genetic algorithms work, covering selection, crossover, and mutation with animated examples.
nodes.author: Kie Codes

nodes.label: Genetic Programming: On the Programming of Computers by Means of Natural Selection
nodes.desc: Koza's seminal book that introduced genetic programming, demonstrating automatic evolution of computer programs for diverse tasks.
nodes.author: John R. Koza

nodes.label: A Field Guide to Genetic Programming
nodes.desc: A freely available introduction to GP covering tree-based, linear, and grammar-based approaches with practical implementation advice.
nodes.author: Riccardo Poli, William B. Langdon & Nicholas F. McPhee

nodes.label: DEAP: Distributed Evolutionary Algorithms in Python
nodes.desc: A popular Python framework for prototyping evolutionary algorithms including GP, with built-in benchmarks and parallelization support.
nodes.author: Fortin et al.

nodes.label: PushGP and Program Synthesis
nodes.desc: Introduces Push, a stack-based language designed for GP, enabling evolution of programs with complex control flow and multiple data types.
nodes.author: Lee Spector

nodes.label: Multi-Objective Optimization Using Evolutionary Algorithms
nodes.desc: The definitive text on multi-objective evolutionary optimization, introducing NSGA-II and providing extensive theory on Pareto dominance.
nodes.author: Kalyanmoy Deb

nodes.label: A Fast and Elitist Multiobjective Genetic Algorithm: NSGA-II
nodes.desc: The original NSGA-II paper proposing fast non-dominated sorting and crowding distance, one of the most cited evolutionary computation papers.
nodes.author: Kalyanmoy Deb, Amrit Pratap, Sameer Agarwal & T. Meyarivan

nodes.label: MOEA Framework
nodes.desc: A comprehensive Java framework for multi-objective evolutionary algorithms supporting NSGA-II, SPEA2, MOEA/D, and many others with built-in analysis tools.
nodes.author: David Hadka

nodes.label: pymoo: Multi-Objective Optimization in Python
nodes.desc: A Python library providing state-of-the-art multi-objective optimization algorithms, visualization tools, and benchmark problem suites.
nodes.author: Julian Blank & Kalyanmoy Deb

nodes.label: Ant Colony Optimization
nodes.desc: The comprehensive reference by ACO's inventor, covering ant system, MAX-MIN ant system, and applications to routing, scheduling, and assignment problems.
nodes.author: Marco Dorigo & Thomas Stutzle

nodes.label: Ant Colony System: A Cooperative Learning Approach to the Traveling Salesman Problem
nodes.desc: The landmark paper introducing Ant Colony System (ACS), demonstrating state-of-the-art performance on TSP instances using pheromone-based learning.
nodes.author: Marco Dorigo & Luca Maria Gambardella

nodes.label: ACO Algorithms for the TSP (ACO code)
nodes.desc: Reference implementation of ant colony optimization algorithms applied to traveling salesman problem instances with configurable parameters.
nodes.author: Thomas Stutzle

nodes.label: Ant Colony Optimization — Computerphile
nodes.desc: A clear visual explanation of how ant colony optimization works, covering pheromone deposition, evaporation, and convergence behavior.
nodes.author: Computerphile

nodes.label: Particle Swarm Optimization (Original Paper)
nodes.desc: The 1995 paper that introduced PSO, showing how a swarm of particles navigating a search space can solve continuous optimization problems.
nodes.author: James Kennedy & Russell Eberhart

nodes.label: Swarm Intelligence (Morgan Kaufmann)
nodes.desc: A thorough treatment of swarm intelligence with emphasis on PSO, including social-psychological motivations and practical algorithm design.
nodes.author: James Kennedy & Russell Eberhart

nodes.label: A Comprehensive Review of Particle Swarm Optimization
nodes.desc: Reviews PSO variants including constriction factor, inertia weight strategies, and multi-objective extensions with convergence analysis.
nodes.author: Marini & Walczak

nodes.label: PySwarms: A Research Toolkit for Particle Swarm Optimization
nodes.desc: A Python library for PSO with global-best and local-best topologies, built-in visualization, and support for custom objective functions.
nodes.author: Lester James V. Miranda

nodes.label: Firefly Algorithm (Original Paper)
nodes.desc: Introduces the firefly algorithm, where attraction between fireflies is modulated by light intensity and distance, with natural multimodal capability.
nodes.author: Xin-She Yang

nodes.label: Artificial Bee Colony Algorithm (ABC)
nodes.desc: The foundational paper for the ABC algorithm modeling employed, onlooker, and scout bee behaviors for numerical function optimization.
nodes.author: Dervis Karaboga

nodes.label: Grey Wolf Optimizer
nodes.desc: Proposes the GWO algorithm inspired by the social hierarchy and hunting strategies of grey wolves, demonstrating competitive benchmark performance.
nodes.author: Seyedali Mirjalili, Seyed Mohammad Mirjalili & Andrew Lewis

nodes.label: Whale Optimization Algorithm
nodes.desc: A swarm algorithm inspired by the bubble-net hunting strategy of humpback whales, using encircling prey and spiral updating mechanisms.
nodes.author: Seyedali Mirjalili & Andrew Lewis

nodes.label: Neural Networks and Deep Learning (Online Book)
nodes.desc: A freely available, elegantly written introduction to neural networks and deep learning with interactive visualizations and clear mathematical explanations.
nodes.author: Michael Nielsen

nodes.label: Deep Learning
nodes.desc: The comprehensive textbook covering deep learning theory from linear algebra foundations through modern architectures like CNNs, RNNs, and generative models.
nodes.author: Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio & Aaron Courville

nodes.label: Neural Networks: Zero to Hero
nodes.desc: A hands-on video series building neural networks from scratch in Python, progressing from simple neurons to transformers and language models.
nodes.author: Andrej Karpathy

nodes.label: The Biological Basis of Deep Learning
nodes.desc: Explores the connections between deep learning and neuroscience, examining how biological plausibility constraints could improve artificial networks.
nodes.author: Yoshua Bengio et al.

nodes.label: Spiking Neuron Models: Single Neurons, Populations, Plasticity
nodes.desc: A rigorous treatment of spiking neuron models including integrate-and-fire, Hodgkin-Huxley, and spike-response models with network-level analysis.
nodes.author: Wulfram Gerstner & Werner Kistler

nodes.label: Spiking Neural Networks: An Introduction (Tutorial)
nodes.desc: A comprehensive tutorial on SNN architectures, learning rules (STDP, supervised), and their relationship to conventional deep learning approaches.
nodes.author: Aboozar Taherkhani et al.

nodes.label: Norse: A Library for Spiking Neural Networks in PyTorch
nodes.desc: A PyTorch-based library for building and training spiking neural networks with GPU acceleration and integration with deep learning workflows.
nodes.author: Christian Pehle & Jens Egholm Pedersen

nodes.label: snnTorch: Training Spiking Neural Networks
nodes.desc: A Python package for training spiking neural networks using surrogate gradient methods, featuring tutorials on neuromorphic datasets and hardware deployment.
nodes.author: Jason K. Eshraghian et al.

nodes.label: Loihi: A Neuromorphic Manycore Processor (Intel)
nodes.desc: Describes Intel's Loihi chip featuring 128 neuromorphic cores, on-chip learning, and hierarchical connectivity for energy-efficient spiking computation.
nodes.author: Mike Davies et al.

nodes.label: TrueNorth: Design and Tool Flow of a 65 mW Neuromorphic Chip
nodes.desc: IBM's TrueNorth chip paper presenting a million-neuron programmable neurosynaptic processor with unprecedented energy efficiency for pattern recognition.
nodes.author: Paul A. Merolla et al.

nodes.label: Lava: An Open-Source Software Framework for Neuromorphic Computing
nodes.desc: Intel's open-source framework for developing neuro-inspired applications deployable on heterogeneous architectures including Loihi neuromorphic processors.
nodes.author: Intel Labs

nodes.label: Neuromorphic Computing and Engineering (IOP Journal)
nodes.desc: A dedicated journal publishing research on neuromorphic hardware, algorithms, and applications, serving as a hub for the neuromorphic computing community.
nodes.author: IOP Publishing

nodes.label: Immunology for Computer Scientists
nodes.desc: An accessible primer on immunology concepts relevant to computer scientists, bridging biological terminology and computational abstractions.
nodes.author: Melanie Mitchell & Stephanie Forrest

nodes.label: Janeway's Immunobiology (9th Edition)
nodes.desc: The standard immunology textbook providing deep biological context for adaptive and innate immunity that inspires AIS algorithm design.
nodes.author: Kenneth Murphy & Casey Weaver

nodes.label: The Immune System (Garland Science)
nodes.desc: An accessible introduction to immunology with clear illustrations, suitable for computer scientists seeking biological grounding for AIS research.
nodes.author: Peter Parham

nodes.label: Artificial Immune Systems: A New Computational Intelligence Approach
nodes.desc: A comprehensive introduction to AIS covering clonal selection (CLONALG), negative selection, immune network models, and their applications.
nodes.author: Leandro Nunes de Castro & Jonathan Timmis

nodes.label: Learning and Optimization Using the Clonal Selection Principle (CLONALG)
nodes.desc: The original CLONALG paper showing how clonal selection and affinity maturation can solve pattern recognition and multimodal optimization problems.
nodes.author: Leandro Nunes de Castro & Fernando Jose Von Zuben

nodes.label: Negative Selection Algorithm for Network Intrusion Detection
nodes.desc: The pioneering paper applying negative selection to computer security, detecting unauthorized changes by distinguishing self from non-self patterns.
nodes.author: Stephanie Forrest et al.

nodes.label: The Dendritic Cell Algorithm (DCA)
nodes.desc: Introduces an algorithm based on dendritic cell biology and danger theory, classifying anomalous behavior through multiple signal processing.
nodes.author: Julie Greensmith, Uwe Aickelin & Steve Cayzer

nodes.label: Artificial Immune Systems for Anomaly Detection
nodes.desc: Covers the application of AIS techniques to anomaly detection in network security, fraud detection, and fault diagnosis.
nodes.author: Dipankar Dasgupta

nodes.label: An Overview of Artificial Immune Systems (Applied Soft Computing Survey)
nodes.desc: A broad survey linking immune mechanisms to their algorithmic counterparts, providing a roadmap for applying AIS to engineering problems.
nodes.author: Leandro Nunes de Castro & Jonathan Timmis

nodes.label: Artificial Immune System Approaches to Intrusion Detection — A Review
nodes.desc: Reviews how immune-inspired approaches address network intrusion detection, comparing negative selection and danger theory methods.
nodes.author: Steve Hofmeyr & Stephanie Forrest

nodes.label: opt-aiNet: Immune Network Algorithm for Optimization
nodes.desc: An immune network-based algorithm for multimodal function optimization that dynamically adjusts population size to maintain diverse solutions.
nodes.author: Leandro Nunes de Castro & Jonathan Timmis

nodes.label: A New Kind of Science
nodes.desc: Wolfram's comprehensive exploration of cellular automata and computational universality, with thousands of pages of examples and a freely available online edition.
nodes.author: Stephen Wolfram

nodes.label: Artificial Life: An Overview
nodes.desc: Langton's foundational overview of the artificial life field, defining its scope and relationship to biology, computer science, and complex systems.
nodes.author: Christopher G. Langton

nodes.label: Cellular Automata Modeling of Physical Systems
nodes.desc: A rigorous treatment of cellular automata applied to physical simulation including diffusion, fluid dynamics, and reaction-diffusion systems.
nodes.author: Bastien Chopard & Michel Droz

nodes.label: Golly: Cellular Automata Simulator
nodes.desc: An open-source, cross-platform application for exploring Conway's Life and other cellular automata rules with support for very large patterns.

nodes.label: The Algorithmic Beauty of Plants
nodes.desc: The classic reference on L-systems and their use in modeling plant development, freely available online with stunning visualizations of botanical structures.

nodes.label: Lindenmayer Systems, Fractals, and Plants
nodes.desc: A concise introduction to L-systems and their connection to fractal geometry in plant modeling, with numerous graphical examples.
nodes.author: Przemyslaw Prusinkiewicz & James Hanan

nodes.label: On Growth and Form
nodes.desc: The 1917 masterpiece relating biological form to mathematical and physical principles, a foundational influence on computational morphogenesis.
nodes.author: D'Arcy Wentworth Thompson

nodes.label: L-System Plant Geometry Generator
nodes.desc: A lightweight implementation of parametric L-systems for generating plant-like structures with turtle graphics interpretation.
nodes.author: Paul Shortone

nodes.label: The Chemical Basis of Morphogenesis
nodes.desc: Turing's landmark 1952 paper proposing that chemical substances (morphogens) reacting and diffusing can explain biological pattern formation.
nodes.author: Alan M. Turing

nodes.label: Reaction-Diffusion Textures (GPU Gems)
nodes.desc: A practical guide to implementing reaction-diffusion systems on GPU hardware for texture generation and pattern synthesis.
nodes.author: Andrew Witkin & Michael Kass

nodes.label: Ready: A Cross-Platform Reaction-Diffusion Explorer
nodes.desc: A GPU-accelerated program for exploring reaction-diffusion systems and other continuous cellular automata on grids and meshes.
nodes.author: Tim Hutton et al.

nodes.label: Gray-Scott Reaction-Diffusion Explorer
nodes.desc: An interactive parameter-space explorer for the Gray-Scott model, cataloging the rich variety of patterns produced by different reaction-diffusion parameters.
nodes.author: Robert Munafo

nodes.label: DEAP: Distributed Evolutionary Algorithms in Python
nodes.desc: A versatile Python framework for rapid prototyping of evolutionary algorithms supporting GP, GA, PSO, ES, and multi-objective optimization.
nodes.author: Felix-Antoine Fortin et al.

nodes.label: PyGMO / Pagmo2: Parallel Global Multiobjective Optimizer
nodes.desc: A scientific library by the European Space Agency for massively parallel optimization, featuring island model parallelism and dozens of algorithms.

nodes.label: jMetal: Metaheuristic Algorithms in Java

nodes.author: Antonio J. Nebro et al.

nodes.label: ECJ: A Java-Based Evolutionary Computation Research System
nodes.desc: A highly configurable evolutionary computation system supporting GP, coevolution, island models, and multi-objective optimization with parameter file-based configuration.
nodes.author: Sean Luke et al.

nodes.label: Nevergrad: Gradient-Free Optimization Platform
nodes.desc: Meta's platform for derivative-free optimization providing a unified interface to evolutionary strategies, PSO, CMA-ES, and other black-box optimizers.

nodes.label: CEC Competition Benchmark Functions

nodes.label: COCO: Comparing Continuous Optimizers (BBOB)
nodes.desc: The COCO platform for black-box optimization benchmarking with automated performance assessment, used for the BBOB workshop series at GECCO.
nodes.author: Nikolaus Hansen et al.

nodes.label: TSPLIB: Traveling Salesman Problem Library
nodes.desc: A widely-used library of sample instances for the TSP and related problems, serving as the standard testbed for combinatorial optimization algorithms.
nodes.author: Gerhard Reinelt

nodes.label: IOHprofiler: Iterative Optimization Heuristics Profiler
nodes.desc: A comprehensive benchmarking framework with statistical analysis tools for profiling and comparing iterative optimization heuristics.
nodes.author: Carola Doerr et al.

nodes.label: A Practical Tutorial on the Use of Nonparametric Statistical Tests

nodes.label: CMA-ES: Evolution Strategy with Covariance Matrix Adaptation

nodes.label: SciPy Optimize: Benchmark and Compare Optimizers

nodes.label: Sporadic: Statistical Performance Reporting for Algorithm Design

nodes.label: Group Theory: A Primer

nodes.label: Representation Theory of Finite Groups

nodes.label: What is a Tensor?
nodes.desc: Detailed series building tensor understanding from first principles.
nodes.author: XylyXylyX

nodes.label: Representation Theory
nodes.desc: University-level lectures on representation theory of finite groups and Lie algebras.

nodes.label: Category Theory for AI

nodes.label: Lie Groups and Lie Algebras

nodes.label: Geometric Anatomy of Theoretical Physics
nodes.desc: Legendary lecture series covering topology, manifolds, bundles, connections with extraordinary clarity.

nodes.desc: Crash-course in Riemannian geometry for ML researchers. Hands-on with code.

nodes.label: Geometric Methods in Robot Learning
nodes.desc: Riemannian optimization and control for robotics applications.

nodes.label: Manifolds: A Gentle Introduction

nodes.desc: Classic text on how group invariance structures statistical problems. Historical foundation.

nodes.desc: Practical guide to spatial analysis in R covering mapping, point patterns, geostatistics, and spatial regression.
nodes.author: Chris Brunsdon & Lex Comber

nodes.label: Spatial Statistics & Geostatistics (SAGE)
nodes.desc: Theory and applications of spatial statistics: variograms, kriging, spatial filtering, and eigenvector methods.
nodes.author: Yongwan Chun & Daniel Griffith

nodes.label: PostGIS in Action (3rd ed.)
nodes.desc: The definitive PostGIS book: geometry/geography types, spatial indexing, raster, topology, routing, and 3D.
nodes.author: Regina Obe & Leo Hsu

nodes.label: PostGIS Official Documentation
nodes.desc: Comprehensive reference for all ST_* functions, spatial indexing, raster support, and configuration.
nodes.author: PostGIS Project

nodes.label: Introduction to PostGIS (Workshop)
nodes.desc: Free hands-on workshop: loading spatial data, spatial queries, joins, indexing, and projections in PostGIS.
nodes.author: Boundless / Crunchy Data

nodes.label: PostGIS Cookbook (2nd ed.)
nodes.desc: Recipe-style guide covering importing data, spatial queries, raster analysis, routing, and web integration.
nodes.author: Paolo Corti, Thomas Kraft, Stephen Mather & Bborie Park

nodes.label: SpatiaLite Cookbook
nodes.desc: Tutorial-style guide to SpatiaLite: loading shapefiles, spatial queries, and analysis in an embedded database.
nodes.author: SpatiaLite Project

nodes.label: MongoDB Geospatial Queries
nodes.desc: Official guide to MongoDB's 2dsphere and 2d indexes, GeoJSON support, and $geoWithin/$near operators.
nodes.author: MongoDB Documentation

nodes.label: DuckDB Spatial Extension
nodes.desc: Analytical spatial queries in DuckDB: read Shapefiles/GeoJSON/GeoParquet, perform spatial joins at columnar speed.
nodes.author: DuckDB Foundation

nodes.label: Apache Sedona (GeoSpark)
nodes.desc: Cluster-computing system for processing large-scale spatial data on Spark and Flink with spatial SQL support.

nodes.label: The R-tree: An Efficient and Robust Access Method
nodes.desc: The foundational R-tree paper describing the balanced tree structure for spatial data with minimum bounding rectangles.
nodes.author: Antonin Guttman (1984)

nodes.label: The R*-tree: An Efficient and Robust Access Method for Points and Rectangles
nodes.desc: Improved R-tree variant with better split and reinsertion heuristics, reducing overlap and improving query performance.

nodes.label: Spatial Indexing with Quadtrees and Hilbert Curves
nodes.desc: Introduction to quadtree decomposition and space-filling curves for spatial indexing and range queries.
nodes.author: Various / GeeksforGeeks

nodes.label: Computational Geometry: Algorithms and Applications (3rd ed.)
nodes.desc: The standard textbook: convex hulls, line segment intersection, polygon triangulation, Voronoi, Delaunay, range trees.
nodes.author: de Berg, Cheong, van Kreveld & Overmars

nodes.label: Computational Geometry in C (2nd ed.)
nodes.desc: Practical approach with C implementations: polygon operations, convex hulls, Voronoi, motion planning.
nodes.author: Joseph O'Rourke

nodes.label: Geometric Tools for Computer Graphics
nodes.desc: Exhaustive reference: intersection tests, distance queries, containment, curves, surfaces. Companion code library.
nodes.author: Philip Schneider & David Eberly

nodes.label: Algorithms in a Nutshell (Ch. Computational Geometry)
nodes.desc: Accessible introduction to convex hull, line sweep, nearest neighbor, and Voronoi algorithms with code.
nodes.author: George Heineman, Gary Pollice & Stanley Selkow

nodes.label: Point-in-Polygon (Ray Casting Algorithm)
nodes.desc: Classic short C implementation of the ray casting point-in-polygon test. Simple, robust, widely cited.
nodes.author: W. Randolph Franklin

nodes.label: Fortune's Algorithm for Voronoi Diagrams
nodes.desc: O(n log n) sweep-line algorithm for computing Voronoi diagrams. The standard efficient approach.
nodes.author: Steven Fortune (1987)

nodes.label: Robust Predicates for Computational Geometry
nodes.desc: Exact arithmetic predicates (orient2d, incircle) that prevent floating-point errors in geometric computation.
nodes.author: Jonathan Shewchuk

nodes.label: CGAL: Computational Geometry Algorithms Library
nodes.desc: C++ library implementing robust, efficient geometric algorithms: triangulations, Voronoi, hulls, mesh generation.
nodes.author: CGAL Project

nodes.label: Shapely (Python)
nodes.desc: Python library for manipulation and analysis of planar geometric objects. Wraps GEOS for point-in-polygon, buffers, intersections.
nodes.author: Sean Gillies / Toblerity

nodes.label: Turf.js: Advanced Geospatial Analysis
nodes.desc: JavaScript library for spatial operations in the browser: buffer, union, Voronoi, tin, nearest, boolean operations.
nodes.author: Mapbox

nodes.label: JTS Topology Suite
nodes.desc: Java library for 2D geometry operations. The upstream of GEOS (C++) which powers PostGIS and Shapely.
nodes.author: Martin Davis / LocationTech

nodes.label: S2 Geometry Library
nodes.desc: Spherical geometry library using Hilbert curve cell decomposition. Exact predicates on the sphere; used by BigQuery GIS.
nodes.author: Google

nodes.label: Map Projections: A Working Manual (USGS PP 1395)
nodes.desc: The definitive reference on map projections: derivations, formulas, and properties for every standard projection.
nodes.author: John P. Snyder

nodes.label: Map Projections: A Reference Manual
nodes.desc: Comprehensive mathematical treatment of map projections, distortion analysis, and optimal projection selection.
nodes.author: Lev Bugayevskiy & John Snyder

nodes.label: Datums and Map Projections (2nd ed.)
nodes.desc: Practical guide to geodetic datums, transformations, and projections for GIS and surveying professionals.
nodes.author: Jonathan Iliffe & Roger Lott

nodes.label: Flattening the Earth: Two Thousand Years of Map Projections
nodes.desc: Historical survey of map projections from antiquity to modern computing. Accessible and fascinating.
nodes.author: John P. Snyder

nodes.label: EPSG.io: Coordinate Systems Worldwide
nodes.desc: Search engine for EPSG codes with WKT definitions, proj4 strings, transformation parameters, and interactive map.

nodes.label: PROJ Documentation

nodes.label: Spatial Reference Systems (OGC/ISO 19111)
nodes.desc: The standard for Well-Known Text representation of coordinate reference systems (WKT2). Adopted by ISO 19162.

nodes.label: Understanding UTM Zones
nodes.desc: Clear explanation of UTM zones, when to use geographic vs. projected coordinate systems, and common pitfalls.

nodes.label: pyproj: Python Interface to PROJ
nodes.desc: Python bindings for PROJ. Transform coordinates between CRS, query EPSG database, handle datum shifts.

nodes.label: Coordinate Transformations & Conversions (GeoPandas Guide)
nodes.desc: Practical guide to reprojecting GeoDataFrames between coordinate systems using .to_crs() method.

nodes.label: Mercator vs. Equal-Area: Choosing the Right Projection
nodes.desc: Visual guide to projection properties, distortion patterns, and choosing projections for different purposes.

nodes.label: Geodesy for the Layman (Defense Mapping Agency)
nodes.desc: Classic accessible introduction to geodesy: Earth's shape, datums, coordinate systems, and satellite geodesy.

nodes.label: H3: Uber's Hexagonal Hierarchical Spatial Index
nodes.desc: Documentation for Uber's H3 system: hexagonal cells at 16 resolutions, edge/vertex functions, and hierarchical operations.

nodes.label: H3: A Hexagonal Hierarchical Geospatial Indexing System (Paper)

nodes.label: S2 Geometry Library
nodes.desc: Documentation for Google's S2: cell IDs, coverings, boolean operations on the sphere. Powers BigQuery GIS.
nodes.author: Google

nodes.label: S2 Cells Explorer
nodes.desc: Interactive visualization of S2 cell decomposition. Explore cell hierarchies, coverings, and containment visually.
nodes.author: sidewalklabs

nodes.label: Geohash Explorer
nodes.desc: Interactive geohash calculator and map. Encode/decode coordinates, visualize cell boundaries, understand precision levels.
nodes.author: Movable Type Scripts

nodes.label: R-Trees: A Dynamic Index Structure for Spatial Searching
nodes.desc: The original R-tree paper. Describes insertion, deletion, splitting, and search in balanced spatial trees.
nodes.author: Antonin Guttman (1984, SIGMOD)

nodes.label: The R*-tree: An Efficient Access Method (1990)
nodes.desc: Improved R-tree with forced reinsertion and better split strategy. Significantly better query performance.
nodes.author: Beckmann, Kriegel, Schneider & Seeger

nodes.label: k-d Trees (Stanford CS Library)
nodes.desc: Introduction to k-d tree construction, nearest-neighbor search, and range queries in low-dimensional space.
nodes.author: Stanford University

nodes.label: Multidimensional Binary Search Trees (k-d trees)
nodes.desc: The foundational paper on k-d trees: binary partitioning of k-dimensional space for efficient search.
nodes.author: Jon Louis Bentley (1975)

nodes.label: Spatial Indexes: Geohash vs. H3 vs. S2
nodes.desc: Side-by-side comparison of the three major discrete global grid systems: cell shapes, hierarchies, and trade-offs.

nodes.label: h3-py: H3 Python Bindings
nodes.desc: Python API for H3: lat/lon to cell, k-ring neighbors, polyfill polygons, compact/uncompact hierarchies.

nodes.label: python-geohash
nodes.desc: Python library for geohash encoding/decoding, neighbor finding, and bounding box computation.

nodes.label: Introductory Digital Image Processing: A Remote Sensing Perspective (4th ed.)
nodes.desc: The standard remote sensing textbook: electromagnetic radiation, sensors, image enhancement, classification, change detection.

nodes.label: Remote Sensing and Image Interpretation (7th ed.)
nodes.desc: Comprehensive introduction covering photographic, thermal, radar, and LiDAR remote sensing with interpretation techniques.

nodes.desc: Covers remote sensing physics, sensors, and applications in geology, land use, oceanography, and environmental monitoring.

nodes.desc: Complete guide to GEE: JavaScript/Python API, image collections, reducers, classifiers, and export workflows.

nodes.author: Sean Gillies / Toblerity

nodes.label: Biological Materials Science

nodes.label: A Review of Nacre-Inspired Materials: Chemistry, Strengthening-Deformation Mechanism, Synthesis, and Applications

nodes.desc: Science paper demonstrating that laser-engraved glass panels with nacre-inspired tablet architectures dramatically increase impact resistance while maintaining transparency.

nodes.desc: Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society A paper reviewing how hierarchical organization and nanoscale features produce the remarkable mechanical properties of nacre.

nodes.desc: Open-access review covering synthetic-biology toolkits (E. coli, yeast, plants, transgenic silkworms) for producing high-molecular-weight spidroins at industrial scale.

nodes.desc: Molecular Biology Reports paper demonstrating that piggyBac-transformed silkworms can spin cocoons containing MaSp1 dragline silk with enhanced tensile strength and elasticity.

nodes.desc: Product page for Bolt Threads' Microsilk platform, describing how yeast fermentation produces spider-silk-inspired protein fibers for textiles in partnership with Patagonia.

nodes.desc: Frontiers in Materials review exploring how spider-silk biomimetics inform next-generation wearable devices and smart textiles through tunable mechanical and sensing properties.

nodes.label: Review of Spider Silk Applications in Biomedical and Tissue Engineering
nodes.desc: Open-access 2024 Biomimetics journal review surveying spider silk in wound healing, drug delivery, nerve conduits, and bone scaffolds.
nodes.author: Various authors

nodes.label: Disentangling the Web: An Interdisciplinary Review on the Potential and Feasibility of Spider Silk Bioproduction
nodes.desc: ACS Biomaterials Science & Engineering review evaluating the technical and economic feasibility of scaling recombinant spider silk production for real-world applications.
nodes.author: Various authors
